+0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/049twyaviiunOqyakM4XK0y/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"04011c8f94a8bd82031d2ab2736c9706","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn93@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-01-997_153452e258652ca4.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":592946,"destBytes":592946,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/049twyaviiunOqyakM4XK0y/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn93@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-01-997_153452e258652ca4.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/049twyaviiunOqyakM4XK0y/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.png":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421784},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"NASA waited 50 years to unseal these precious moon rocks","link":"https://mashable.com/article/nasa-moon-rocks-space","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00BxoSpPV9jZhRiR4iF19rs/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"an astronaut standing on the moon\"><p>The last time anyone set foot on the moon, in 1972, astronauts plunged metal tubes into the lunar ground. They captured soil and rock and then sealed off the precious extraterrestrial material. </p><p>One of the samples, 73001, has been fastened shut for half a century. But in recent weeks, scientists pierced the metal tube to reveal what's inside. Mashable spoke with these researchers, clad in their white clean-room attire, via a video chat just after they'd collected rare moon gases from sample 73001. It's one of the last remaining unopened lunar specimens. </p><p>Apollo Astronauts Eugene Cernan and Harrison \"Jack\" Schmitt, who gathered 73001 from the ancient <a href=\"https://www.hq.nasa.gov/alsj/a17/a17.site.html\">Valley of Taurus-Littrow</a>, couldn't have known NASA would store the sample for the lengthy span of <i>10 presidential administrations</i> inside a specialized lab at NASA's Johnson Space Center. But the space agency waited until the technology to sleuth out the tube's untainted contents had progressed.</p><p>\"We were waiting for the instruments to get better,\" Ryan Zeigler, NASA's Apollo sample curator, told Mashable. Before we spoke on March 8, Zeigler worked with Juliane Gross, a planetary scientist at Rutgers University, and Rita Parai, a geochemist at Washington University in St. Louis, to collect the lunar gases.</p><q>\n    \"This gives us our best chance to learn what gas is leaking out of the moon.\"\n    </q>\n<p>Yet the decision to unseal the rare sample was nudged by more than scientific curiosity and technological advancement. NASA is building a new megarocket, the powerful Space Launch System, and has designs to return to the moon, <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/nasa-moon-artemis-training\">specifically the shadowy South Pole</a>, later this decade. All the lunar samples gathered between 1969 and 1972 &mdash; <a href=\"https://curator.jsc.nasa.gov/lunar/\">all 842 pounds</a> &mdash; are from the dayside of the moon, somewhat near the moon's equator. But before NASA returns to a disparate southern region to scour the area for valuable resources (like hydrogen, oxygen, and ice), the agency wants to know what gases seep from the moon, and what exactly is in the equatorial rock gathered by Apollo astronauts. NASA needs to gauge what they might discover in the South Pole, and compare how different &mdash; or valuable &mdash; the resources are in this new region.</p><p>That's where the gases sealed in sample 73001 come into play. \"This gives us our best chance to learn what gas is leaking out of the moon,\" NASA's Zeigler said. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/space-diamond-carbonado-auction\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Is the mysterious 'space diamond' for real? An investigation.\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/rocket-moon-crash-space\">A rocket will crash into the moon. It'll leave way more than a scar.</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://helios-preview.mashable.com/article/space-station-moon-transit-photo\">Stunning photo captures space station crossing the moon in jaw-dropping detail</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/comet-solar-system-space\">The mega-comet hurtling through our solar system is 85, yes 85, miles wide</a></p></li></ul><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" samples stored in a sealed tube.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: NASA</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00BxoSpPV9jZhRiR4iF19rs/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646947350.jpg\" alt=\"an astronaut collecting lunar samples on the moon\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00BxoSpPV9jZhRiR4iF19rs/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646947350.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00BxoSpPV9jZhRiR4iF19rs/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646947350.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"2000\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Apollo 17 astronaut Eugene Cernan prepares to collect lunar sample 73001.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: NASA</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>To collect these extraterrestrial gases, the researchers are using a contraption dubbed a \"manifold.\" Just weeks ago, it carefully pierced the 50-year-old tube, and now captures the gases preserved inside. When I spoke with the extraction team, they had just filled their 11th bottle with lunar gas. </p><p>Next up, scientists will closely inspect the actual lunar rocks and soil. \"There's a lot that will happen,\" explained Zeigler. Different planetary scientists and geologists with different expertise will inspect the composition of these moon fragments. Some salient goals include better understanding resources on the moon (like water ice), and the origins of different elements. </p><p>When future astronauts, perhaps later this decade, collect moon samples, they'll work in remarkably different environs than the lunar explorers of half a century ago. The Apollo astronauts roved around the moon in bright sunlight. But in the lunar South Pole, the moon barely rises over the horizon. It's an eerie, dark, and shadowy place.</p><p>And if all goes as planned, astronauts will return new, precious lunar samples to the vault at NASA's Johnson Space Center.</p><div addition to their 15-day free trial. If you decide to continue, their Standard Plan for small businesses costs $29.95, Plus Plan costs $79.95, and Pro Plan costs $299.95.</p><hr><p>Ask most entrepreneurs for the name of the company they wish their new business could emulate and many would answer without a second thought: Amazon. In just over 25 years, the company built out of a Washington garage has grown to become a world retailing power, all without any significant brick and mortar locations.</p><p>Digital sales are the key to explosive growth in today&rsquo;s marketplace. But to fully take advantage of those growth opportunities, business owners need a platform that can grow with that operation and offer an array of features for companies of all levels to make that growth succeed.&nbsp;</p><p><a href=\"https://stck.media/r/bigcommerce-mashable-editorial\">BigCommerce</a> is positioned as a digital retail partner for all types of businesses. An ecommerce hub with a wealth of customization options that can help businesses keep pace with online growth and never outgrow their site or force a migration.</p><p>The Australian-born service offers <a href=\"https://stck.media/r/bigcommerce-mashable-editorial\">an all-in-one approach to digital retailing</a>, laying out a simple path to get an online storefront off the ground, even if you have no coding or web development experience.</p><p>Make online selling your reality by easily customizing your storefront with beautifully designed templates. Get up and running faster with the BigCommerce Page Builder - an intuitive drag-and-drop solution for creating and managing page content, no coding required. The flexibility of BigCommerce allows you to create tailored pages and keep customers coming back with custom features, such as in-store pickup options, or even a buy now, pay later plan.</p><p>Meanwhile, BigCommerce makes it easy to get your products listed on the world&rsquo;s largest digital marketplaces, including Amazon, eBay, Walmart, and others. And don&rsquo;t forget about BigCommerce&rsquo;s robust set of social media integrations as well, making it simple to get your items featured on the most popular platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok.</p><p>Nursery retailer Winstanleys Pramworld raves, \"There's just no learning curve with BigCommerce. It's not complicated. alt=\"A photo of Tesla CEO Elon Musk and singer Grimes at the Met Gala. \"><p>Grimes is many things: a visionary artist, a modern philosopher, a mother of two (more on that later), a supportive partner to a billionaire iconoclast, a \"capitalist Democrat\" (her words), and a proud weeb. But at least she's not boring. </p><p>The 33-year-old singer graces the <a href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2022/03/grimes-cover-story-on-music-and-mars\">April cover of </a><a href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2022/03/grimes-cover-story-on-music-and-mars\"><i>Vanity Fair</i></a> and chief among the seismic details in the piece is the surprise reveal of her second child, a daughter, with Tesla founder and CEO Elon Musk. The baby, Exa Dark Sider&aelig;l Musk (also known by the nicknames \"Y\" and \"Sailor Mars\"), was born via surrogate, according to <i>Vanity Fair</i>. The couple <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/elon-musk-grimes-baby-new-name\">welcomed a son</a>, X &AElig; A-12, pronounced \"X A.I. Archangel\" or \"X\" for short, in March 2020 &mdash; which one might see as prophetic timing. </p><p>Perhaps even more surreal than a celebrity couple with a secret baby is the way in which writer Devin Gordon discovered little Y's existence. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/elon-musk-grimes-baby-new-name\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Grimes says she and Elon Musk have changed their baby's name\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>While discussing the \"Shinigami Eyes\" singer&rsquo;s upcoming album <i>Book 1</i>, Gordon heard \"what sounds vaguely like a lone cry from an infant upstairs.\" A few moments later, he heard even more wailing: \"This time it&rsquo;s multiple cries, and it&rsquo;s unmistakable. I&rsquo;ve got two kids. That&rsquo;s a baby. And I can tell by the frozen look on my host&rsquo;s face that she heard it too. So I brace myself to ask the strangest question of my career: Do you have another baby in your life, Grimes?\" </p><p>The answer was, of course, yes. But can you blame Grimes for wanting to keep Y's birth a secret? </p><p>\"Whatever is going on with family stuff, I just feel like kids need to stay out of it, and [first Musk baby] X is just out there,\" Grimes said. \"I mean, I think E is really seeing him as a prot&eacute;g&eacute; and bringing him to everything and stuff... X is out there. His situation is like that.\" </p><p>And Y, for now, is all hers. \"The best situation here,\" she revealed later in the piece, \"is me training the girl and [Musk] training the boy.\" Training for what? Life on Earth as celebrity children? Life on Mars alongside their father? </p><p>The way she sees it, X is more than Musk's prot&eacute;g&eacute;. More than the son of the wealthiest man in the world &mdash; Musk is valued <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/real-time-billionaires/#16ce9ab03d78\">at over $200 billion, according to Forbes</a> &mdash; X himself is the Chosen One in his mother's eyes, mirroring the destiny of one of her favorite sci-fi heroes: <i>Dune</i>'s Paul Atreides. </p><p>\"I just know X is going to have to go through all this really fucked-up shit that sort of mirrors Paul-type stuff,\" she said. </p><p>Speaking of Mars, Musk confirmed that the plan is to <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/elon-musk-moving-to-mars-interview\">depart for the red planet</a> within the next 10 years. Grimes may or may not follow him, eventually. She described the SpaceX founder's mission not as megalomania but rather \"for the benefit of humanity, and it&rsquo;s dangerous and it&rsquo;s expensive, and people are like, 'He&rsquo;s hoarding money!' No, he&rsquo;s spending everything on R&amp;D... Bro might say a lot of stupid shit, but he does the right thing.\" </p><q>\n    Bro might say a lot of stupid shit, but he does the right thing.\n            <footer>- Grimes on Elon Musk</footer>\n    </q>\n<p>Grimes also defended her on-again-off-again boyfriend (<a href=\"https://twitter.com/Grimezsz/status/1501959073591296002\">they are currently off again</a>) &mdash; \"we&rsquo;re very fluid,\" she said &mdash; against critics who view him and his ideas as needlessly excessive. \"Bro does not live like a billionaire,\" she told <i>Vanity Fair</i>. \"Bro lives at times below the poverty line. She's just...changed. Every simulation evolves over time. Still, she understands why her fans feel betrayed by her choices. </p><p>\"I mean, when people say I&rsquo;m a class traitor that is not&hellip;an inaccurate description,\" she said. \"I was deeply from the far left and I converted to being essentially a capitalist Democrat. 56x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn39@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-24-909_eefb62aed26c61bd.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00VLT7Yy5wJwSEApaHyiG5V/images-10.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn39@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-24-900_f390788f91f0d5ba.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00VLT7Yy5wJwSEApaHyiG5V/images-11.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn63@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-24-832_ce46b8294ab4e2c3.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00VLT7Yy5wJwSEApaHyiG5V/images-12.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn55@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-25-293_d472b33e488a937e.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00VLT7Yy5wJwSEApaHyiG5V/images-13.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":null,"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00VLT7Yy5wJwSEApaHyiG5V/images-14.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn24@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-25-509_df84d628688ad6de.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00VLT7Yy5wJwSEApaHyiG5V/images-15.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn12@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-25-506_870140c844d3ac63.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00VLT7Yy5wJwSEApaHyiG5V/images-16.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn93@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-25-971_62274fd5c8ee9f35.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421787},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"E3 isn't happening in 2022. But cloud gaming can bring previews to the people at home.","link":"https://mashable.com/article/e3-2022-rumor-cloud-gaming-for-e3-at-home","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03WqHxBNCTmZSNXCaHiMi6L/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"An exterior view of the Los Angeles Convention Center as it appeared during the E3 video game trade show in 2006.\"><p>There's buzz about a theoretical E3 2022.</p><p>First, let's face facts: It's not happening. The rumor that's floating right now around is mostly based on some chatter from GamesBeat's Jeff Grubb, who mentioned during a recent podcast that <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X6qYonSzdzI\">Microsoft is planning for an \"E3-style\" event</a> in June. But even if something called \"E3\" gets announced, it's not the in-person exhibition that was <a href=\"https://www.ign.com/articles/e3-2022-cancels-in-person-event-digital-show-uncertain\">already cancelled</a> back in January.</p><p>The show has suffered in recent years, and not just because of the ongoing pandemic. The proliferation of high-quality video streaming has made it easy for publishers to share news with the public on their own terms, removed from the all-consuming buzz of gaming's biggest U.S. trade show. Electronic Arts has been doing its own event near E3 but not at the show itself since 2016. Other major names like Nintendo and Microsoft have also scaled back their presence in other ways.</p><p>The show's organizer, the Entertainment Software Association (ESA) has also had its share of troubles. The industry group has struggled to regain the trust of the press and influencer community after a <a href=\"https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2019-08-03-e3-accidentally-leaks-personal-details-of-journalists-youtubers-and-analysts\">shockingly careless leak of attendee data</a> in 2019. And new competition from the likes of Geoff Keighley's Summer Game Fest and <a href=\"https://www.ign.com/events/summer-of-gaming\">IGN's Summer of Gaming</a> has joined old standbys like PAX and Gamescom, giving publishers more places to go to make waves with their news during the pre-holiday summer months of what is traditionally trade show season for video games.</p><p>While all of this has been going on, however, cloud gaming capabilities have leveled up repeatedly. Stadia has had <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/google-stadia-closes-two-studios\">its share of struggles</a> as a business, but Google's cloud gaming service, along with competitors like <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/amazon-luna-cloud-gaming\">Amazon's Luna</a>, capably deliver on the promise of <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/google-stadia-review-first-impressions\">high-end gaming streamed straight to your device</a> (bandwidth permitting).</p><q>\n    There's no reason that cloud-based game previews can't be opened up for a wider audience.\n    </q>\n<p>For someone like me who works on the press side of the industry, I've had closer experiences than most with the true power of this technology. Multiple major publishers rely on cloud gaming services like Parsec to bring me the hands-on preview experience at home. It's fantastic. </p><p>From my perspective as a full-time remote worker, streaming a game preview to my home computer is a welcome alternative to shlepping off to meetings that are a two-hour commute away. And from the publisher perspective, the security benefit speaks for itself: No one can pirate a playing experience that is managed remotely, by the publisher. They flip a switch and it's game over, literally.</p><p>There's no technical reason that cloud-based game previews can't be opened up for a wider audience. Even if it's not under an \"E3\" banner, publishers have lots to gain and little to lose by letting you and your friends check out the kind of polished gameplay demonstration that gets trotted out at trade shows. </p><p>At the behind the scenes level, lots of demo experiences are projects unto themselves that stand apart from the ongoing work of building whatever game. If all that extra work is happening anyway, why not put it in front of more people? Reading a preview that someone else has written isn't nearly as instructive as playing the polished demo that write-up is derived from yourself.</p><p>Publishers have often shied away from showing off unfinished work to people who aren't industry professionals. Which is totally fair: Games that aren't finished are usually a hotbed of bugs and unexpected issues. Those who work in the industry understand and make allowances for that before forming a judgment.</p><p>But as loud as the community can sometimes be, gamers are a pretty plugged in bunch. The proliferation of \"early access\" games &mdash; which is to say, titles that are released unfinished, often at a reduced price, and developed as feedback comes in &mdash; and public beta tests in recent years has helped people better understand the process that unfolds as a game comes together. </p><p>In 2022, you don't need to be an industry professional to \"get it.\" Game makers have been implicitly teaching their audiences how the development process works for a very long time. They've even monetized it in some cases, turning something like access to a public beta test into the stuff of pre-order bonuses.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/devolver-digital-e3-2021-showcase\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            If you've never seen an E3 showcase from Devolver Digital, it's time to treat yourself\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/best-wordle-clones-alternatives\"><b>14 of the best 'Wordle' clones, because one word a day isn't enough</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/god-of-war-amazon-series-cast-chris\"><b>Kratos in Amazon's 'God of War' series should be Christopher Judge's job to lose</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/elden-ring-tips-soulsborne-beginners\"><b>3 crucial mistakes 'Elden Ring' newcomers should avoid to maximize the fun</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/dota-2-how-to-play\"><b>How to start playing 'Dota 2'</b></a></p></li></ul><p>Now, bring that thinking to the trade show circuit. Anyone can stream Electronic Arts' slate of reveals in the publisher's annual EA Play broadcast. But what if you could, for a small fee, sign up for some kind of \"VIP access\" that would open the door to hands-on opportunities as well?</p><p>The premise I'm attacking this from is \"publishers <i>should</i> do this,\" but truly, I think it's only a matter of time before it actually happens. Cloud gaming has already changed the landscape for preview access in the press, with the switch away from in-person meetings opening them up to a wider range of people. It's not a far leap to imagine similar opportunities being offered to the general public, especially in a world where things like <a href=\"https://www.ign.com/articles/steam-next-fest-coming-in-june-will-feature-hundreds-of-game-demos\">Steam Next Fest already exists</a>.</p><p>Don't forget, E3 was never a public event... until it <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/e3-2017-open-to-public-tickets\">started transforming into one</a> in 2016. So whether or not that specific trade show comes back, the thinking that's always guided it &mdash; a festival of video game reveals and previews &mdash; can now be extended from insiders-only to outsiders as well in a way that hasn't been possible before. Here's hoping our favorite publishers seize the opportunity sooner rather than later.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Mar 2022 23:25:27 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03WqHxBNCTmZSNXCaHiMi6L/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"b81162fb152ebb84c779dfc059fda874","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn3@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-03-251_ea76564cf84467c3.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":376680,"destBytes":376680,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03WqHxBNCTmZSNXCaHiMi6L/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn3@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-03-251_ea76564cf84467c3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421752},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Enhance your wine drinking experience with an electronic decanter that plays tunes","link":"https://mashable.com/deals/march-11-wake-up-wine-pro-s","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/07nN28i6iUYEKS2KZck308Q/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Container of wine on black and blue decanting device next to wine glass, bottle, bread, cheese, and grapes\"><p><b>TL;DR: </b>As of March 11, the <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/jBjpy\">WAKE UP WINE&trade; Pro S: Electronic Decanter</a> is on sale for $169.99, which is down 43% from its regular price of $299.</p><hr><p>Whether you consider yourself a <a href=\"https://mashable.com/deals/feb-16-personalized-wine-delivery\">sommelier</a> or you don&rsquo;t know your cabernets from your merlots, a decanter can make your wine experience more enjoyable.&nbsp;</p><p>Decanting, for the uninitiated, is separating the wine from built-up sediment, all the while aerating. It&rsquo;s considered the best way to bring out aromas and flavors in your wine. Not all wines need <a href=\"https://www.thekitchn.com/do-you-have-a-wine-145131\">decanting</a>, but many can benefit from it.</p><p>If you don&rsquo;t own a decanter, and you&rsquo;re a &ldquo;go big or go home&rdquo; kind of wine drinker, the <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/jBjpy\">Wake Up Wine Pro S</a> is on sale for 43% off as of March 11. Featured <a href=\"https://mashable.com/deals/june-12-electronic-wine-decanter-sale\">previously</a>, it's a 750ml electronic glass decanter that can filter out impurities as fine as a millimeter with its sediment strainer.</p><p>You can easily set and adjust the decanting time at the push of a button. And with a full charge, you should get about eight hours of continuous decanting. If you need a little help and don&rsquo;t feel like scouring Google for answers, you can take a quick peek at the wine and spirit guide to understand decanting times.</p><p>To make your wine drinking experience even merrier, the base of the Wine Pro S also serves as a mini party hub. It features built-in Bluetooth 3D speakers, so you can play 360-degree, omni-directional music right from your device. Play your go-to girls night playlist to set the tone for a fun night, or go with more romantic jazz tunes for an upscale wine-tasting experience. The base&rsquo;s tricolor changing light ring even syncs with your tunes for a full audio-visual experience. Add the delicious smells and flavors mixing up in your wine and all of your senses can be heightened and enlightened.</p><p>Grab the Wine Pro S Electronic Decanter for just <a +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/07nN28i6iUYEKS2KZck308Q/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"485f778cc26d53de6f86f7eaf1fb885c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn3@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-02-933_3731f0462cac1333.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":675,"sourceBytes":411637,"destBytes":62134,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/07nN28i6iUYEKS2KZck308Q/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn3@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-02-933_3731f0462cac1333.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/07nN28i6iUYEKS2KZck308Q/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn3@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-24-902_d1191b9aee63dcc3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421768},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"How to take a screenshot on an iPad","link":"https://mashable.com/article/how-to-take-screenshot-on-ipad","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"illustration of an ipad\"><p>Taking a screenshot on iPad has been a core feature since the first generation of Apple&rsquo;s popular tablet, and for good reason.&nbsp;</p><p>Whether you want to share a Twitter thread, save a receipt, or capture a moment of a video (for the memes), screenshots are an invaluable part of how we communicate today. Plus, it&rsquo;s easy to do, and there&rsquo;s more than one way to go about it.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/apple-event-2022-ipad-air\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Apple unveils a new iPad Air with M1 chip at 2022 event\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<h2>If your iPad has a home button</h2><p>For the majority of iPads, the most common method for taking a screenshot is to press the home button and the top button at the same time.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"sm:object-scale-down h-full mx-auto\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644444811.png\" alt=\"Arrows indicating the top right and home buttons on an Ipad, to press for screenshotting\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1644444811.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1644444811.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644444811.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"2160\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans max-w-3xl text-center mx-auto\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Apple </span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>If done successfully, you&rsquo;ll see a white flash over the entire screen, and your iPad will save your screenshot to the photo library. On iOS 11 or newer, you&rsquo;ll also see a preview appear in the lower-left corner, allowing you to edit or delete the screenshot before saving it. Older devices still offer the ability to edit screenshots, but you&rsquo;ll have to bring it up in Photos first.</p><p>If you&rsquo;re having trouble, you may get better results if you press the home button slightly before the top button, then quickly release both.</p><h2>If your iPad doesn&rsquo;t have a home button</h2><p>On iPads without home buttons, the process is similar. The only difference is that instead of the home button, you&rsquo;ll press one of the volume buttons instead.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644444811.png\" alt=\"Arrows indicating the top right and volume buttons to press on iPad for screenshotting.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1644444811.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1644444811.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02HoV7b0wPMvzUbTgGhPl8o/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644444811.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1281\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Apple</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>If you don&rsquo;t want to bother with button combinations</h2><p>If pressing multiple buttons at once seems a little awkward, simply use one of the handiest Accessibility features on any mobile Apple device: AssistiveTouch.</p><p>Open <b>Settings</b>, then navigate to <b>General </b>&gt; <b>Accessibility </b>&gt; <b>Touch </b>&gt; <b>AssistiveTouch</b>, then tap the button at the top of the screen to turn it on. After doing so, you&rsquo;ll see a small virtual button appear onscreen that persists across all open apps. You can also use Siri and say &ldquo;turn on AssistiveTouch&rdquo; to get the same result.&nbsp;</p><p>From here, you can take a screenshot using the default settings by tapping the button, then navigating to <b>Device </b>&gt; <b>More </b>&gt; <b>Screenshot</b>.&nbsp;</p><p>Or, to make things even easier, you can set up one of the Custom Actions (Single-Tap, Double-Tap, or Long Press) to take a screenshot by navigating to the respective menu from the AssistiveTouch settings page. In both cases, you&rsquo;ll see the same flash of the screen as if you&rsquo;d done it the old-fashioned way, and your fresh screenshot will be waiting for you in your photo library.</p><h2><b>More tutorials:</b></h2><p><u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/how-to-delete-individual-photos-from-a-carousel-on-instagram\">How to delete individual photos from a carousel on A tattoo on its chest reads \" fart lyfe><p>Stephen Colbert's pitch for an <i>Ocean's Eleven</i>-style blockbuster built around an NFT heist was doomed from the start, and the reasons are right there in the pitch.</p><p>For all the chatter around non-fungible tokens, they're simply not well understood by the general public. And most of what's out there paints a picture that ranges from <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/limewire-nft-marketplace\">utterly ridiculous</a> to <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/nft-cryptocurrency-bad-environment-art\">profoundly alarming</a>. So in this fake movie trailer that aired during Friday's <i>Late Show</i>, the perps behind a heist-in-the-making are derailed from the start because nobody has a clue.</p><p>That's the joke, of course. Colbert's writers correctly zeroed in on the superficial popularity of NFTs, and the expository bridges that would have to be built in a theoretical NFT heist flick just to help people understand the premise. The conflict in this pitch doesn't come from stylishly committing crimes a la Danny Ocean; it comes from someone questioning the virtues of NFTs as a whole.</p><p>If there's any takeaway, it's save your money. There are plenty of pressing issues <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/how-to-help-ukraine-refugees\">abroad</a> and <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/texas-transgender-discrimination-resources\">at home</a> where those dollars could be far more helpful.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/the-future-of-non-fungible-tokens-poised-big-year\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Sick of NFTs? Except that Styles was texting the wrong number &mdash; which created a pretty chaotic exchange. </p><p>The Spanish superstar told the story on <i>The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon</i>, beginning with her taking her phone out of her boot (a pretty effective hiding place). She and Fallon bonded over how they each change their phone numbers frequently, a habit which, for Rosal&iacute;a, meant missing Styles' texts. </p><p>After a bizarre series of texts, Styles sent her the screenshots of the iMessages to Rosal&iacute;a, writing over Instagram DM, saying, \"Your texts are confusing.\" </p><p>\"But it wasn't me!\" Rosal&iacute;a told the audience, laughing.</p><p>The messages are well worth a look, especially to see Styles grappling with a very strange tone coming from someone he thought was Rosal&iacute;a. The two artists have <a href=\"https://www.billboard.com/video/rosalia-billboard-women-in-music-interview-december-2019-8546179/\">collaborated in the past</a>, on Styles' <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VF-r5TtlT9w\">\"Adore You\"</a> video which Rosal&iacute;a narrated. </p><h2>Want more?</h2><ul><li><p><a dream</a></p></li></ul>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 10:50:57 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/01pPG4Kh0lh0InbtnsXpdDP/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"46e3cad124fbb71581d8aecfd06d1d05","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn97@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-02-014_3ca9971dc74f3d06.webp","destWidth":1712,"destHeight":938,"sourceBytes":898674,"destBytes":898674,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/01pPG4Kh0lh0InbtnsXpdDP/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn97@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-02-014_3ca9971dc74f3d06.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421766},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Pixar's LGBTQ employees say Disney censors same-sex affection","link":"https://mashable.com/article/disney-pixar-lgbtq-letter","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03JK13uBpKpbLwYiFGRZmbN/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"A man rides his bicycle and walks his dog past the entry gates at the headquarters of Pixar Animation Studios in downtown Emeryville, California, with logo visible, June 12, 2018.\"><p>Employees at Pixar have penned a letter suggesting that Disney leaders censor same-sex love onscreen and cuts \"nearly every moment of overtly gay affection.\" </p><p>First obtained by Popular Information newsletter journalist <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JuddLegum/status/1501728898865844225\">Judd Legum</a>, the letter is unsigned but attributed to \"the LGBTQIA+ employees of Pixar, and their allies.\" It's the latest in a collective reaction towards <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/nbc-out/out-politics-and-policy/dont-say-gay-bill-florida-senate-passes-controversial-lgbtq-school-mea-rcna19133\">Florida's \"Don't Say Gay\" bill</a>, legislation <a href=\"https://www.flsenate.gov/Session/Bill/2022/1557/BillText/e1/PDF\">\"prohibiting classroom discussion about sexual orientation or gender identity.\"</a> The widely criticized bill has been passed by Florida's House of Representatives and Senate, now heading to governor Ron DeSantis' desk, where it is poised to be passed into law.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/JuddLegum/status/1501728898865844225\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>The Pixar letter, <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/pixar-employees-disney-statement-lgbtq-community-hollow-1235108281/\">published after Wednesday's annual shareholder meeting</a>, said Disney can do far more to fight against the bill, with a more concrete public response, and that if &ldquo;Disney is true in its values, it will take a decisive public stand against the discriminatory legislation\" in Florida, and other states with similar legislations.</p><p>But most notably, the letter claimed that Disney executives \"shaved down to crumbs\" any LGBTQIA+ content and representation put forth by Pixar writers and animators. </p><p>\"Nearly every moment of overtly gay affection is cut at Disney&rsquo;s behest, regardless of when there is protest from both the creative teams and executive leadership at Pixar,\" reads the letter, <a href=\"https://variety.com/2022/film/news/disney-pixar-same-sex-affection-censorship-dont-say-gay-bill-1235200582/\">per Variety</a>. \"Even if creating LGBTQIA+ content was the answer to fixing the discriminatory legislation in the world, we are being barred from creating it. Beyond the 'inspiring content' that we aren&rsquo;t even allowed to create, we require action.\"</p><q>\n    \"Nearly every moment of overtly gay affection is cut at Disney&rsquo;s behest.\"\n    </q>\n<p>Disney's CEO Bob Chapek has faced internal and external pressure to condemn the bill &mdash; Disney employs <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/03/09/business/disney-ceo-florida-lgbtq-bill.html\">80,000 people</a> in Florida. On Monday, Chapek sent a <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/disney-ceo-bob-chapek-florida-dont-say-gay-bill-response-1235105879/\">company-wide memo</a> declaring that he and Disney's leadership team \"unequivocally stand in support of our LGBTQ+ employees, their families, and their communities,\" and that Disney was \"committed to creating a more inclusive company&mdash;and world.\"</p><p>\"I believe the best way for our company to bring about lasting change is through the inspiring content we produce, the welcoming culture we create, and the diverse community organizations we support,\" Chapek's memo read.</p><p>This echoed a similar <a href=\"https://variety.com/2022/film/news/disney-ceo-bob-chapek-support-lgbtq-1235197938/\">statement from Disney</a> last week which declared, \"The biggest impact we can have in creating a more inclusive world is through the inspiring content we produce...\"</p><p>LGBTQ Disney employees took to Twitter on Monday to speak about the \"Don't Say Gay\" bill and its potential dangers, asking Disney to take a stronger stance against it. Animation writer <a href=\"https://twitter.com/BenjaminJS/status/1500559810709712896\">Benjamin Siemon</a>, for instance, said, \"LGBT kids are going to be left alone and scared and hurt by this bill.\" Abigail Disney, an activist, filmmaker, and descendent of Disney's co-founder Roy O. Disney, also took to social media to express outrage. The hashtag <a href=\"https://twitter.com/hashtag/boycottdisney?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Ehashtag\">#BoycottDisney</a> quickly began to trend on Twitter. </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/abigaildisney/status/1500444182665703428?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1500444182665703428%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_c10&amp;ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fpublish.twitter.com%2F%3Fquery%3Dhttps3A2F2Ftwitter.com2Fabigaildisney2Fstatus2F1500444182665703428widget%3DTweet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/03/09/business/disney-ceo-florida-lgbtq-bill.html\">Chapek spoke about the criticism</a> at an annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday, saying, \"While we&rsquo;ve been strong supporters of the community for decades, I know that many are upset that we did not speak out against the bill. We were opposed to the bill from the outset, and we chose not to take a public position because we felt we could be more effective working behind the scenes directly with lawmakers on both sides of the aisle.\"</p><p>The CEO also said he called Governor DeSantis to express Disney's disappointment and concern, to which DeSantis responded by agreeing to a meeting with LGBTQ members of Disney's senior team in Florida.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/aguirreryan/status/1501641691916234753\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>On Wednesday, Chapek also pledged a $5 million donation to The Human Rights Campaign (HRC) and other organizations protecting LGBTQ rights, which was <a href=\"https://www.hrc.org/press-releases/human-rights-campaign-refuses-money-from-disney-until-meaningful-action-is-taken-to-combat-floridas-dont-say-gay-or-trans-bill\">rejected by the HRC</a> citing the need for \"meaningful action\" from the company on the bill. <a href=\"https://variety.com/2022/biz/news/disney-lgbtq-donation-dont-say-gay-bill-1235200027/\">Disney responded</a>, with a spokesperson saying, \"We signed the HRC&rsquo;s national business statement opposing anti-LGBTQ+ legislation and pledged to financially support their efforts, and while we are surprised and disappointed that they will not take our financial support at this time, we remain committed to meaningful action to combat legislation targeting the LGBTQ+ community.\"</p><p>Disney's support of LGBTQ employees and the community at large, the Pixar letter claims, is only a very recent development, citing that \"Disney Parks did not officially host Pride until 2019, in Paris alone.\"</p><p>Your move, Disney. </p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 11:06:10 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03JK13uBpKpbLwYiFGRZmbN/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"c9899a78db43850bc1a3fc9f124a3d42","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn79@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-466_75db9073161e7f45.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":230137,"destBytes":132000,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03JK13uBpKpbLwYiFGRZmbN/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn79@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-466_75db9073161e7f45.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421778},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 play","link":"https://mashable.com/deals/march-12-square-off-pro-chessboard","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/045tkyRjqtkF8InS3c4WI6Z/hero-image.jpg\" The pieces weren&rsquo;t standardized until the 19th century, then came clocks and tournaments. Like everything else, the game has evolved with the times &mdash;&nbsp;which means it&rsquo;s been digitized.</p><p>Playing chess strictly online, however, takes away from the overall feeling and fervor of the game. If you&rsquo;re looking for the best of both worlds, <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/y2rEw\">Square Off Pro</a> has come up with a chessboard that combines the old world with the new. And right now, it&rsquo;s on sale for $225 &mdash; that&rsquo;s $24 in savings.</p><p>Unroll the light, portable Square Off Pro chessboard to play anyone, anywhere. You can play folks face-to-face like a classic game of chess. You can play solo, against an adaptive AI, with 20 difficulty levels and a guided coach. Or you can connect with over 50 million players around the world via Chess.com and Lichess for interactive online game play. Challenge your opponent via video call and play directly on your board. Feeling the pieces in your hand, rather than moving your mouse or dragging your finger across a touch screen, feels more authentic to the game.</p><p>If you&rsquo;re <a href=\"https://mashable.com/deals/march-11-the-ultimate-beginner-to-grandmaster-chess-course-bundle\">new to chess</a> or you need some pointers, the personal interactive coach, Viktor, will guide you through your moves and warn you of errors. Viktor will light up moves on the board to help you learn, analyze, and improve your game in real time.</p><p>See it in action:</p><div class=\"w-full max-w-4xl mx-auto mt-8\">\n    <div
