10:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/045tkyRjqtkF8InS3c4WI6Z/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"ca01bd152be9bb57714b455eb088d6d6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn61@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-03-059_be07198664147edc.webp","destWidth":3648,"destHeight":2052,"sourceBytes":126986,"destBytes":126986,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/045tkyRjqtkF8InS3c4WI6Z/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn61@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-03-059_be07198664147edc.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/045tkyRjqtkF8InS3c4WI6Z/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn19@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-24-833_913c4b6fa75fc973.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421784},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"The world's longest car has a pool, helipad, and mini golf. Turning is tricky.","link":"https://mashable.com/video/worlds-longest-car","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/00Hy7ffrmxiYWDxT3al8Xyj/hero-image.png\" alt=\"The world's longest car.\"><p>How long is the longest car in the world? Well, over 100 feet, but more importantly it has a hot tub, a swimming pool, and a helipad.</p><p>On March 1, <a href=\"https://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2022/3/worlds-longest-car-over-100-ft-restored-to-its-former-glory-694607\">the world's longest ever car broke its own 1986 Guinness World Record</a> after being restored by a group led by Miami-based developer Michael Dezer. It's a lengthy auto at 30.54 meters (100 feet and 1.50 inches), with 26 wheels, and room for up to 75 passengers. </p><p>Dezer's team took two years to restore the car in his own theme park, Dezerland Park, after buying it on eBay from Michael Manning, who owns Autoseum, a technical teaching museum in Nassau County &mdash; he found it rotting behind a warehouse in New Jersey.</p><p>The car, dubbed \"The American Dream,\" was first built in Burbank, California by Jay Ohrberg and held the record at 18.28 meters (60 feet) &mdash; Dezer and Manning's teams have extended it. According to Guinness World Records, the restoration took three years and cost over $250,000 (&pound;190,725).</p><p>Now, it has both its own pool (with diving board), jacuzzi, mini golf course, waterbed, TVs, a fridge, and a helipad and can be <i>driven from both ends</i>, though turning is an...issue. </p><p>In the video above, Manning actually talks about possibly turning it into an electric vehicle one day, which would make it the longest EV in the world. </p><h2>Want more?</h2><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/toyota-autonomous-car-drift\">Watch this Toyota car drift around obstacles all by itself</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/vw-electric-bus\">The iconic VW bus just transformed into an EV</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/mazda-mx-30-low-range-ev\">The Mazda MX-30 low-range EV is needlessly stressful</a></p></li></ul>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 10:07:51 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/00Hy7ffrmxiYWDxT3al8Xyj/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"0b8ad8a75c8045858dd525ac404ddf19","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn23@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-03-021_2a371ba234707f38.webp","destWidth":1926,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":918534,"destBytes":918534,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/00Hy7ffrmxiYWDxT3al8Xyj/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn23@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-03-021_2a371ba234707f38.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421779},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"A big spider will spread in the U.S. No, it won't 'parachute' down.","link":"https://mashable.com/article/spider-joro-spread-us-parachute","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"a Joro spider on a web\"><p>They're not after you. And they don't \"parachute\" from the sky.</p><p>The internet is awash in news about the spread of the invasive Joro spider, a big, striking arachnid that almost certainly hitched a ride to the U.S. aboard a shipping container, as many invasive species do. Since 2013, the palm-sized animals have colonized northern Georgia, and new, important research <a href=\"https://resjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/phen.12385\">published in the science journal </a><a href=\"https://resjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/phen.12385\"><i>Physiological Entomology</i></a><i> </i>presents compelling evidence that the species will inevitably expand around the Southeast and along the Eastern Seaboard.</p><p>Crucially, these spiders may look imposing, but they aren't a dangerous menace to people. Their potential impact on the environment remains unknown. (They might even have ecological benefits.) And the sizable mature adults definitely aren't going to \"parachute\" down from the sky en mass, like something out of a low-budget horror film. </p><p>Instead, the ways Joros will often expand to new regions in the U.S. are rather mundane. </p><p>\"It's more likely one of the spiders will hitch a ride on someone's car,\" Andy Davis, an ecologist at the University of Georgia and an author of the new research, told Mashable. </p><q>\n    \"It's more likely one of the spiders will hitch a ride on someone's car.\"\n    </q>\n<p>The spider will soon colonize more areas. \"It's definitely expanding its range,\" explained Davis. He suspects the Joros will occupy pockets of the Eastern Seaboard in the next year or so, and that they'll occupy most of the Southeast in five to 10 years. </p><p>Beyond cars, the Joros will likely hitch rides on cargo incessantly moving around the U.S. \"It got here hiding in cargo,\" said Robert Furey, a spider expert at the Harrisburg University of Science and Technology.</p><p>\"Cargo moves,\" Furey, who had no role in the new research, added. \"There's nothing to stop it.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/N8Swick/status/1501579004373082114\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/murder-hornet-hype\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Don't buy the 'murder hornet' hype\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/how-many-species-live-on-earth\">The number of species on Earth is uncountable</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/giant-tortoise-wilderness\">Enthralled scientists spot a giant tortoise behaving in a strange, wild way</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/will-cockroaches-inherit-earth\">Will cockroaches really inherit the Earth?</a></p></li></ul><h2>Why the spiders won't \"parachute\" down</h2><p>The claim that Joro spiders will parachute down from the sky is \"super ridiculous,\" explained David Coyle, an assistant professor of forest health and invasive species at Clemson University.</p><p>Here's what's actually happening: Some little spiders, like a young Joro spider, may choose to \"balloon.\" This means they <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VDL9VxLqdvw\">release a strand of silk from their abdomen</a> and they're able to ride through the air. It's a common way for some spiders to disperse. </p><p>But it's not something all spiders do. <i>And it's not something big spiders can do</i>, because they're too heavy. \"It's why you&nbsp;don't see a battalion of spiders flying at you,\" said Coyle. So, no, three-inch spiders won't be \"parachuting\" across the Eastern U.S. and landing on you.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646886495.png\" alt=\"a Joro spider held in a hand\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646886495.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646886495.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646886495.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1814\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">A mature female Joro spider can be the size of a small plate.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Benjamin Frick</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>What's more, ballooning is simply a risky choice for an animal. That's likely why some spiders don't balloon. \"You can end up in a lake &mdash; or on the hood of a truck,\" noted Coyle. \"Your fate is not in your control anymore.\"</p><p>As the Joros expand their reach in the U.S., you shouldn't expect to see any tiny baby spiders ballooning through the woods. When little spiders ride puffs of wind, it's extremely difficult to see. \"It happens all the time,\" said Furey. \"When's the last time you noticed it?\" </p><p>Furey has never seen a ballooning spider land. \"And I spend a lot of time with spiders,\" he said. </p><h2>Are Joro spiders poisonous or threatening? </h2><p>No. Joro spiders have much better things to do than seek out, or try to harm, humans.  </p><p>\"With very few exceptions, insects and arthropods want nothing to do with you,\" said Coyle, noting the spiders' need to build webs, eat, and mate. \"They're just doing their thing. People just need to chill out. This thing isn't there to get you.\"</p><p>They are not venomous like a black widow or brown recluse. Their fangs are tiny, so it's not easy for them to bite a person (maybe if you pick one up you'll get an insignificant pinch, noted Davis). And if you disturb them, they're likely to scurry away. </p><p>\"It turns out these spiders are real wimps,\" said Davis.</p><q>\n    \"People just need to chill out. This thing isn't there to get you.\"\n    </q>\n<p>But as the Joros spread in the U.S., more people will see their big conspicuous webs in the summer, when they mature. \"Their webs are huge,\" Davis marveled. \"They're all over my backyard.\" And they'll almost certainly become a nuisance. Some people will inevitably run into these big webs, perhaps out on a walk or hike. That will be unpleasant, or startling, because their silk is exceptionally strong.</p><p>\"It's stopped me in my tracks,\" said Furey.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646919298.png\" alt=\"spiderwebs from Joro spiders\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646919298.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646919298.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646919298.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1544\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">A cluster of big spiderwebs from the Joro spider.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Benjamin Frick</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>Where will the Joros spread?</h2><p>A close relative of the Joro,&nbsp;the golden silk spider, can't tolerate the cold. That's why it hasn't spread beyond the Southeast.</p><p>But how will the Joro fair? To test their vulnerability to cooler climes, researchers exposed Joros to brief freezes in the laboratory, the type that often kill golden silk spiders. The Joros survived deep freezes considerably better (74 percent survived, versus 50 percent of golden silk spiders). Their faster metabolisms and bodies worked well in colder environments, too. What's more, in their native Japan, the Joros inhabit cooler, northern climes, similar to those on the Eastern Seaboard. </p><q>\n    \"They're going to expand.\"\n    </q>\n<p>\"The Joro seems more cold tolerant,\" said Davis, an author of the research. \"It will probably be able to exist much farther than the Southeast.\"</p><p>How far, exactly, is uncertain. People have already spotted them in the likes of Tennessee, North Carolina, and South Carolina.</p><p>\"They're going to expand,\" said Furey.</p><h2>What risks do invasive Joros pose to the environment?</h2><p>It's still unknown whether Joros will have a positive, neutral, or negative impact on the environment. Some invasive species wreak havoc on native habitats or agriculture. Take, for example, the colorful spotted lanternfly, which relentlessly destroys trees and crops in parts of the U.S. (\"Squash it, smash it...just get rid of it,\" <a href=\"https://www.agriculture.pa.gov/Plants_Land_Water/PlantIndustry/Entomology/spotted_lanternfly/SpottedLanternflyAlert/Pages/default.aspx\">urges the state of Pennsylvania</a>.) </p><p>But in the early stages of the Joro expansion, ecologists and biologists simply don't have adequate proof of how the arachnids might affect the natural world. \"It's guessing at this point,\" said Davis.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/giant-hornet-bees-attack-scream-like-mammals\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Bees shriek like alarmed mammals when giant hornets attack\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>Their multiplying numbers could potentially be a boon to the environment. Hanging out in the open, Joros could become prey to the likes of lizards, birds, and wasps, Davis said. Already, there's some evidence Joros devour another problematic invasive species, the brown marmorated stink bug.</p><p>Americans will see more Joros. But will they become a curse, a blessing, or just (at times) a nuisance?</p><p>\"Only time will tell,\" said Furey.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"be5adbef5b54dcc9f7b7344141750765","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn99@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-02-013_5cffd20d7c80f6fe.webp","destWidth":683,"destHeight":512,"sourceBytes":148650,"destBytes":148650,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn99@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-02-013_5cffd20d7c80f6fe.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646886495.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn91@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-26-312_822c4e88df7613b5.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cjQAXoS77bANZQ5xv8PJY/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646919298.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn33@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-26-458_c657d65f5443ee97.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421765},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"A rare Kate McKinnon break highlights Zoë Kravitz's hilariously cat-filled 'SNL' monologue","link":"https://mashable.com/video/zoe-kravitz-snl-monologue-kate-mckinnon-break","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/07xX0LQNLS1mlY93MpXyWfM/hero-image.png\" alt=\"Kate McKinnon dressed like Michelle Pfeiffer's Catwoman from \" batman returns standing on the main night live stage with zo kravitz host.><p>Zo&euml; Kravitz, star of <i>The Batman</i>, is only the latest actor to take on the role of the Catwoman. That reminder was her (and our) jokingly painful takeaway from a guest-strewn opening monologue on <i>Saturday Night Live</i>.</p><p>What started out as a normal \"actor talks to live audience\" monologue quickly devolved into hysterics when Kate McKinnon showed up decked out in a Catwoman costume that's almost identical to the one Michelle Pfeiffer wore in 1992's <i>perfect</i> movie, <i>Batman Returns</i>. It's a funny sight on its own, but it gets even better when McKinnon can't contain her chuckles as she swings a whip around and talks about the Pfieffer Catwoman's ridiculous origin story.</p><p>It's not long before others show up, starting with Ego Nwodim dressed in a replica of the legendary Eartha Kitt's Catwoman costume as seen on the campy 1960s Batman series starring Adam West. But then, instead of leaping from there to Halle Berry's much-maligned 2004 take on the character, we get... Aidy Bryant as a \"cat lady\" (complete with an adorably fluff real cat), followed by Chris Redd impersonating Katt Williams. Cats on Katts.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/snl-tiktok-white-house-biden-cold-open\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            TikTok stars visit Biden in an 'SNL' cold open featuring Bowen Yang's captivating plunger nipple\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/snl-weekend-update-dont-say-gay-woke-disney\"><b>'SNL' Weekend Update torpedoes 'woke Disney' claims by pointing to '90 years of cartoons'</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/snl-ukraine-fox-news-cold-open\"><b>A pointed 'SNL' cold open levels Fox News and Trump for supporting Russia over Ukraine</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/john-mulaney-snl-monkey-judge\"><b>John Mulaney playing a monkey judge on 'SNL' is comedy we desperately need</b></a></p></li></ul>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 13 Mar 2022 17:27:30 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/07xX0LQNLS1mlY93MpXyWfM/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"20109570941e977c5034d75c1c6b5d73","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn54@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-03-432_0f3dc8158013066c.webp","destWidth":1184,"destHeight":660,"sourceBytes":482362,"destBytes":482362,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/07xX0LQNLS1mlY93MpXyWfM/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn54@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-03-432_0f3dc8158013066c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421741},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"NASA's monstrous moon rocket is an overpriced, political beast","link":"https://mashable.com/article/nasa-rocket-cost-sls-artemis-space","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"NASA moving the SLS rocket\"><p>As Russian military forces bombarded Ukraine, a congressional committee huddled to discuss progress on Artemis, the ambitious U.S. effort to put astronauts on the moon and Mars. </p><p>They didn't discuss the raging war, but global tensions of the hour were certainly in the air. </p><p>\"China and Russia have their sights set on the moon and its resources,\" said Rep. Bill Posey, a Republican who represents Cape Canaveral in Florida. \"Given what the moon represents in terms of resources, prestige, U.S. national security, what does the U.S. and NASA need to do to guarantee the success of the Artemis program in the coming years?\"</p><p>NASA's James Free, the agency's associate administrator of exploration systems development, answered by talking about the growing number of countries signing <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/specials/artemis-accords/index.html\">the Artemis Accords</a>, a U.S.-led international agreement on principles for human space exploration. He talked about focusing on \"performance,\" the schedule, and budget. </p><p>But Posey wanted to get down to brass tacks. To some people, this is a space race. </p><p>\"For the record,\" he said, referencing <a href=\"https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/planetary/lunar/cnsa_moon_future.html\">China's growing lunar ambitions</a>, including launching robots to the moon's resource-rich south pole in the coming few years. \"What is the China-Russia date?\" </p><p>The potential obstacle standing in the way of the United States achieving the world's first lunar outpost and Mars landing is NASA's gargantuan rocket, <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/audience/forstudents/5-8/stories/nasa-knows/what-is-the-space-launch-system.html\">the Space Launch System</a>, or SLS. Taller than the Statue of Liberty at 322 feet and weighing 5.75 million pounds, the American rocket has 15 percent more thrust than <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/audience/forstudents/5-8/features/nasa-knows/what-was-the-saturn-v-58.html\">the Saturn V rocket</a> used during the Apollo program. </p><p>And it has a price tag to match, said Inspector General Paul Martin, who acts as the federal watchdog over the space agency. The cost to develop and operate SLS is so high, it imperils the entire deep spaceflight program, he said at the House Subcommittee on Space and Aeronautics <a href=\"https://science.house.gov/hearings/keeping-our-sights-on-mars-part-3-a-status-update-and-review-of-nasas-artemis-initiative\">hearing on March 1</a>. </p><p>Until now, few had so publicly called out the elephant in the room.  </p><p>\"As NASA moves forward, it must accelerate these efforts to make Artemis programs more affordable,\" Martin said. \"Otherwise, relying on such an expensive single-use rocket system will, in our judgment, inhibit, if not derail, NASA's ability to sustain its long-term human exploration goals to the moon and Mars.\"</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/rocket-moon-crash-space\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            A rocket will crash into the moon. It'll leave way more than a scar.\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/space-rocket-lab-neutron\">A little-known U.S. spaceport shoots into the big rocket scene</a></p></li></ul><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/moon-water-chinese-lander\">China landed on the moon and found water in dirt and rocks</a></p></li></ul><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/spacex-doctor-nasa-astronaut\">SpaceX doctor finally gets his shot to be a NASA astronaut</a></p></li></ul><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647019850.png\" alt=\"the estimated cost of SLS and Orion per launch\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647019850.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647019850.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647019850.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1437\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">NASA Inspector General Paul Martin estimated the initial four Artemis missions will cost about $4.1 billion each.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: NASA Office of Inspector General\t</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>Though NASA has yet to detail its spending plan for the entire lifecycle of the program, the watchdog estimated the initial four missions will cost <i>about $4.1 billion each</i>, <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/feature/around-the-moon-with-nasa-s-first-launch-of-sls-with-orion\">the first of which</a> is an uncrewed test that could happen this spring or summer. For perspective, that's about one-fifth of <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/news/budget/index.html\">the entire NASA budget</a>. Roughly half of the expense is the new rocket system. By 2025, the agency will have spent about $93 billion on Artemis, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/NASAOIG/status/1498704399543242757?s=20&amp;t=MvXaOuTXfHIMqDfJ9qtTGg\">Martin said</a>. </p><p>Those are sobering figures as the commercial space industry shows <a href=\"https://oig.nasa.gov/docs/IG-22-003.pdf\">it could likely do the job cheaper</a>. SpaceX's Starship rocket, though still a prototype, is designed to be reusable, will carry heavy loads, and has the potential to launch more often than the single-use SLS rocket. The United Launch Alliance's Vulcan Centaur rocket under development also might offer an alternative with a cheaper bottom line.</p><q>\n    \"Relying on such an expensive single-use rocket system will, in our judgment, inhibit, if not derail, NASA's ability to sustain its long-term human exploration goals to the moon and Mars.\"\n    </q>\n<p>The cost per launch does seem high, said Peter Beck, <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/space-rocket-lab-neutron\">CEO of the commercial space company Rocket Lab</a>, in an interview with Mashable: \"I know what I could do for $4.1 billion, and it's a lot.\"</p><p>Such candid talk from NASA's inspector general might lead one to think SLS could cripple the agency's human space exploration program if the rocket isn't scrubbed.</p><p>Yet despite its problems, the rocket isn't going anywhere, experts say. Because if nothing else, the \"elephant\" was born a political animal. </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/elishasauers/status/1498699815907213314?s=20&amp;t=GFenT_lQ9ylUQXm9YIIc0w\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>\"For at least the next 10 years, the SLS program is politically very, very secure, absent some sort of catastrophic failure,'' Casey Dreier, senior space policy adviser for the nonpartisan <a href=\"https://www.planetary.org/\">Planetary Society</a>, told Mashable. </p><p>Crucially, cost efficiency was never the priority. When Congress adopted the NASA Authorization Act of 2010, it directed the space agency to build the rocket. </p><p>SLS is literally and figuratively founded on <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/shuttle/flyout/index.html\">the Space Shuttle legacy</a>, which operated between 1981 and 2011. NASA has upgraded components of the shuttle for the new rocket, using a larger version of the shuttle stack that swaps out the legendary winged orbiter for either a cargo or crew capsule. The vehicle's core rocket stage is a stretched shuttle fuel tank, powered by four shuttle main engines. </p><p>Rather than reusing those engines, though, NASA will ditch them in the ocean during the Artemis missions. Lightening the load enables the spacecraft to get on a moonbound trajectory.</p><p>House and Senate leaders, wanting to support their space industry constituents, legally required NASA to work with all the same contractors used for the shuttle. In 2010, during the Great Recession, those lawmakers sought to preserve thousands of jobs in their districts. About 1,100 U.S. companies and employees at every NASA center are now involved in the megarocket project. </p><p>The 2010 bill even told NASA to use the old \"cost-plus contracts,\" deals that pay the contractor for all of its expenses and then some to allow for a profit (as opposed to a \"fixed cost contract\" where the total budget is set). This model doesn't create an incentive for the contractor to finish its work within a set time and budget. Despite poor performance from Boeing, for instance, NASA gave the company 86 percent of all available award fees for developing the core, Martin said, \"despite being billions over budget and years behind schedule.\" </p><p>\"NASA was told what to build and told the kind of pieces to use,\" Dreier said. \"They couldn't just start fresh.\" </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647019850.jpg\" alt=\"Boeing joining the upper part of the SLS rocket\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647019850.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647019850.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647019850.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1334\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Despite poor performance from Boeing, NASA gave the company 86 percent of all available award fees for developing the rocket core, according to the NASA Office of Inspector General.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: NASA</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<q>\n    \"I know what I could do for $4.1 billion, and it's a lot.\"\n    </q>\n<p>That's a key difference between the SLS and SpaceX Starship, which isn't tethered to decades-old technology or inefficient contracts. Elon Musk's heavy-lift rocket is reusable and designed to be refueled in flight, allowing it to carry more people and cargo, said <a href=\"https://www.heracleous.org/\">Loizos Heracleous</a>, a professor of strategy and organization at Warwick Business School. He co-wrote a book, <i>Above and Beyond: Exploring the Business of Space</i>.  </p><p>SpaceX has proven that the United States does have other transportation options, regardless of recent comments from Russia's space agency chief, Dmitry Rogozin. Russia decided to stop supplying rocket engines to America following U.S. sanctions over the invasion of Ukraine. </p><p>\"In a situation like this, we can't supply the United States with our world's best rocket engines. Let them fly on something else, their broomsticks, I don't know what,\" Rogozin, head of Roscosmos, said on state Russian television last week, according to <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/russia-halts-deliveries-rocket-engines-us-2022-03-03/\">news wire reports</a>. </p><p>Musk reacted on Twitter, labeling SpaceX's extremely successful Falcon 9 rocket an \"American broomstick.\" </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-5.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647024399.jpg\" alt=\"SpaceX Starship readying for launch\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-5.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647024399.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-5.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647024399.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-5.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647024399.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Elon Musk announced he believed Starship could fly orbital missions for under $10 million per launch. </span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: SpaceX</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1499423704983355393?s=20&amp;t=IXDcFJYoKYOaqYYQBp364g\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>SpaceX doesn't publicly disclose its financials, but at an event at its Texas facility last month, Musk announced he believed Starship could fly orbital missions for <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SpaceX/status/1491954065084805128?s=20&amp;t=2FgsT30amg3V9s6RgAarSA\">under $10 million per launch</a> in as little as two or three years. (Though Musk has a history of overpromising technological targets.)</p><p>If true, that would be \"several orders of magnitude cheaper than the SLS,\" Heracleous said. It would be a classic case of commitment bias for the United States to stick to its guns because of the time and money already invested into SLS, he said.</p><p>\"This means that good money is being thrown after bad, rather than cutting one&rsquo;s losses and going with the better option,\" he said in an email. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647019850.jpg\" alt=\"NASA's Space Launch System flying crew to the moon\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-3.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647019850.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-3.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647019850.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647019850.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1506\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">In this artist rendering, the NASA Space Launch System, or SLS, rockets a crew of astronauts to the moon in the Artemis II configuration of the vehicle.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: NASA / MSFC</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>When <a href=\"https://www.congress.gov/bill/111th-congress/senate-bill/3729\">legislators mandated SLS into existence</a> in 2011, the commercial space industry didn't have a spacecraft or rocket to send astronauts anywhere. And there are reasonable concerns for allowing a private company to handle the launching system, Dreier said. When <a href=\"https://spaceexplored.com/2021/11/29/spacex-raptor-crisis/\">Musk wrote to his team</a> that a crisis with the Raptor engine production on Starship threatened to bankrupt the company, skeptics of space exploration privatization pointed to it as an example of why the United States has to have its own rocket.</p><q>\n    \"You're putting the entire national goal on the whims of one company.\"\n    </q>\n<p>\"You're saying that this one privately held company that is under the sway of a very powerful, influential individual whose vision drives the company, if anything happens to him or that company, the U.S. has no assured way to get astronauts to the moon,\" Dreier said. \"You're putting the entire national goal on the whims of one company.\"</p><p>The last three <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/specials/apollo50th/missions.html\">Apollo missions</a> in the 1970s &mdash; 15, 16, and 17 &mdash; cost about $3.8 billion each when adjusted for inflation, Dreier said. That makes the Artemis missions look significantly overpriced. Launching more frequently could reduce the cost, but NASA only plans to blast off once per year. </p><p>Given that the cost of running the entire International Space Station is about $4 billion annually, it's not surprising that the inspector general found the SLS cost unsustainable, said Matthew Weinzierl, a Harvard Business School professor who <a href=\"https://www.aeaweb.org/articles?id=10.1257/jep.32.2.173\">researches space economics</a>. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"sm:object-scale-down h-full mx-auto\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647019850.jpg\" alt=\"NASA erecting SLS first core stage at Stennis Space Center for testing\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-4.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647019850.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-4.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647019850.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02hxFw4vA5m4mERId9Gft4X/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647019850.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"3000\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans max-w-3xl text-center mx-auto\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">NASA's SLS rocket could cost $93 billion by 2025, according to the Office of the Inspector General.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: NASA / SSC&#8203;</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>\"Of course,\" he wrote in an email, \"Congress could easily make it 'sustainable' if it were to increase its allocation to space and if it felt Artemis was worth the investment.\"</p><p>At this point, there's no reason to believe legislators have lost the political will for the endeavor or their beast of a rocket, apropos for the program's namesake Artemis, Greek goddess of wild animals. Time and again, Congress has given more money to the program than the White House has requested. </p><p>At the recent Artemis mission hearing, Congressman Brian Babin, a Republican representing Houston, made his priorities clear. Where does NASA plan to run mission control, he asked? </p><p><i>Houston.</i> </p><p>\"OK, great. Thank you very much,\" he said. \"That's good news.\"</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Mar 2022 13:00:00 href=\"https://mashable.com/article/disney-pixar-lgbtq-letter\">half-assedly opposing</a> Florida's dystopian <a politicians who supported said bill has prompted backlash from the political right. But as Jost sharply points out during this <i>Saturday Night Live</i> Weekend Update segment, there's 90 years of sometimes-questionable cartoon history from the company that undermines any suggestion of Disney suddenly becoming radically progressive.</p><p>It was a busy news week, so there's plenty as well about Vladimir Putin and Russia's invasion of Ukraine, along with high gas prices, a new and overdue hate crime law in the U.S., and antics from Ron DeSantis, Florida's Trump-y governor. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl href=\"https://mashable.com/video/snl-ukraine-fox-news-cold-open\"><b>A pointed 'SNL' cold open levels Fox News and Trump for supporting Russia over Ukraine</b></a></p></li></ul>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 13 Mar 2022 16:48:03 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/05QC5dXzI5JOUhVqicQcMtP/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"77741843ca6afc8d348b2c42200ade9d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn31@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-02-016_f2c53a43ef8771f8.webp","destWidth":1183,"destHeight":666,"sourceBytes":492770,"destBytes":492770,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/05QC5dXzI5JOUhVqicQcMtP/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn31@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-02-016_f2c53a43ef8771f8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421741},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Just get a password manager already — here are the best options","link":"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-password-managers","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/02ii3XWuHI7g2wKREyqalEh/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Computer logged into a password manager site.\"><p>We're just gonna say it: Creating strong, complex passwords &mdash; and then actually remembering what those passwords are &mdash; has become a huge pain in the behind. The well-known advice is that you shouldn't use the same password for everything because it's not safe, but that doesn&rsquo;t make it any less annoying as you&rsquo;re mentally shifting through every password and password variation you&rsquo;ve ever created as you try to log into a bank account or online shop.</p><p>This warning to use a different password for each site is definitely true though: <a href=\"https://https//www.secureauth.com/resources/blog/2017-dbir-misuse-stolen-credentials\">According to Verizon&rsquo;s Data Breach Investigations Report</a>, 81% of hacking related breaches involved the misuse of stolen or weak credentials &mdash; AKA crappy, overused passwords. And we probably don't have to tell you this, but having your money or identity stolen isn't exactly a good time either.</p><p>But even if you do manage to come up with Olympic-level strength passwords, remembering your complex, unique passwords for dozens of different sites is nearly impossible, especially when password requirements sound more like the recipe for a potion. Uppercase letter, number, symbol, eye of newt, etc.</p><p>So before you know it, you&rsquo;ve used up your three guesses and you&rsquo;re locked out because you can&rsquo;t remember your genius combination of letters, numbers, and symbols. And now you need to create a new amazing password <i>again. </i>So you try something you think you&rsquo;ll remember and &nbsp;just like that, you get the alert that &ldquo;new password cannot be the same as old password.&rdquo;</p><p>Enter: password managers. AKA your new best friend to help keep your online accounts safe and keep <i>you </i>from tossing your device across the room every time you need to remember or create a new password.&nbsp;</p><h2><b>What does a password manager really do?</b></h2><p>The best password managers are essentially a way to safely store all your logins and passwords in a safe place.&nbsp;</p><p>All you have to do is remember one master password and then your password manager will autofill the rest for you, plus more security stuff you probably didn't even think about.</p><p>In other words, a password manager is like a secure list of passwords in your phone's notes (or a notebook, if you&rsquo;re old-school), except losing your phone or notebook won't mean that your entire life is about to be hacked.</p><p>Password managers can be apps on your mobile phone, plugins in your browser, or desktop software you install.&nbsp;</p><p>Some will also help you create, not just store, some super secure passwords that a hacker wouldn&rsquo;t be able to guess so you don&rsquo;t have to keep thinking of variations based on your pets&rsquo; or kids' names.&nbsp;</p><p>The best password managers will also allow you to secure your devices &mdash; like your Kindle or Apple Watch &mdash; and even your photos and other private documents that you won&rsquo;t want easily accessible on your computer or smartphone. Think of it as a form of personal encryption to add even more security to your digital life.</p><h2><b>Things to consider when choosing a password manager:</b></h2><ul><li><p><b>Do you want passwords to be remembered on your phone and laptop?</b> If so, you'll need to make sure the password manager allows syncing on multiple devices. (As you'll see, most free versions other than LastPass do not allow more than one device.) </p></li><li><p><b>Are you storing passwords just for personal use</b> or do you need to share with a group? Some password managers will allow you to share logins with colleagues or family without actually telling them what the password is. That will allow you to give them access to a site or platform you all use &mdash; and remove their access if you need to &mdash; without having to worry that they can share the password with people you don&rsquo;t approve. Others will allow you to set up a family account so that you and your spouse or children can share passwords easily.</p></li><li><p><b>Two-factor authentication: </b>Using the Google Authenticator app, an external device, text message, or something similar, does the password manager require a second form of insurance to make sure that it's actually you trying to log in? Without this, if someone gets ahold of your master password, they have access to all of your stuff.</p></li><li><p><b>Emergency contacts: </b>If you forget your master password, you need to make sure you're not completely screwed. Many password managers are equipped with emergency contacts, which are basically the password version of writing someone into your will. This is where you give a trusted friend, family member, or boss access to your master password in the event that you can't provide it.</p></li></ul><h2><b>What are some of the best password managers on the market?</b></h2><p>Interested in employing a password manager to help make your online life a little easier? We&rsquo;ve sifted through a whole bunch of password manager programs out there so you don&rsquo;t have to. Below, we&rsquo;re listing six of the best password managers and exactly what each plan offers, so you can easily find the one that best fits your individual needs. All prices listed are for the year.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 22:29:16 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/02ii3XWuHI7g2wKREyqalEh/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"b549c0f5b3b2b6827c0360510e421b50","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-292_b8bc26dd34dbe123.webp","destWidth":2322,"destHeight":1339,"sourceBytes":239638,"destBytes":239638,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/02ii3XWuHI7g2wKREyqalEh/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-292_b8bc26dd34dbe123.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421755},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Convert text to realistic speech using this AI software on sale","link":"https://mashable.com/deals/march-12-textalky-ai-subscription","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06feoOI7aR03Caxl4yrvDU9/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Phone on home screen and laptop on text input window\"><p><b>TL;DR: </b>As of March 12, a lifetime subscription to <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/qV5Bp\">TexTalky AI Text-to-Speech</a>, worth $540 is 93% off, so you can get it for just $37.</p><hr><p>From marketing content and video narration to customer support and tutorials, there are many instances in today&rsquo;s marketplace when a professional human voice is needed. So, why would you use the same text-to-speech voice effects?</p><p>Once you have the voice and effects you want for your narration, audiobook, podcast, tutorial, marketing content, etc., you can export the file as an MP3, OOG, or WAV and share it instantly. With the lifetime subscription, you&rsquo;re allowed free commercial use of all voices.</p><p>You&rsquo;ll get 1 million welcome characters (approximately 250,000 words) to start with, then 50,000 characters monthly for life when your welcome credits are up. 10:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06feoOI7aR03Caxl4yrvDU9/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"4f8b7ab870e7671d1fd98e058a4e8dba","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn70@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-03-641_e84369731eea20ca.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":675,"sourceBytes":66832,"destBytes":66832,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06feoOI7aR03Caxl4yrvDU9/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn70@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-03-641_e84369731eea20ca.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06feoOI7aR03Caxl4yrvDU9/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn3@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-24-969_32682d73599240a7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421752},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"The Hario insulated server kept my coffee hot all day","link":"https://mashable.com/review/hario-v60-insulated-coffee-server","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"metal coffee pitcher against background with coffee beans\"><p>In the cold months, it&rsquo;s unsettling to find your coffee drop in temperature minutes after serving. It&rsquo;s not much to want hot coffee to be hot &ndash; both for flavor and comfort. Because, as Barry Green, a taste perception scientist at Yale University told <u><a href=\"https://www.livescience.com/19288-room-temperature-coffee-taste.html\">Live Science</a></u>, &ldquo;hot coffee releases more aromatic compounds than room-temperature coffee&hellip;[and] milk, coffee's frequent companion, tastes worse at room temperature.&rdquo; Lukewarm coffee can ruin a morning &mdash;&nbsp;and reheating it on the stove or in the microwave does away with nearly everything good about the drink.</p><p>You can get up and make another cup, but if you&rsquo;re operating in the pour over method, that&rsquo;ll take an additional 15 minutes of labor. So, what&rsquo;s the fix? After months of struggling with this seemingly minute problem, I found a simple and affordable solution: the <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/E3Ey4\">V60 insulated server</a> from Hario, the legendary Japanese coffee and tea brand. It&rsquo;s an insulated, stainless steel server, tailor made for the <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/P25bO\">V60 pour over dripper</a> &mdash; though it works nicely with an AeroPress, and can also be used as an ordinary thermos.</p><div class=\"w-full max-w-4xl mx-auto mt-8\">\n    <div id=\"video-container-YaNZEs-4ZcE\"></div>\n</div>\n\n\n<p>As more people work from home due to the pandemic, some have purchased aspirational <a href=\"https://mashable.com/category/kitchen\">home and kitchen</a> appliances. But there&rsquo;s something to be said about the Hario server, which is practical in a turbulent time. It&rsquo;s more durable than other carafes that I&rsquo;ve had, and it&rsquo;s sleek and ergonomic with a double-wall interior. It&rsquo;ll make your routine all the better because you&rsquo;ll have fresh coffee well into the afternoon.</p><h2>Testing the V60</h2><p>I tested the coffee temperature inside my Hario server in intervals of 30 minutes after using my preferred brewing method: the pour over (which is demonstrated in the above video). Simply place a dripper directly on the carafe&rsquo;s opening &mdash; or if you&rsquo;re using an AeroPress, throw that on top instead. After brewing you&rsquo;ll want to tightly seal the lid back on the carafe.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"sm:object-scale-down h-full mx-auto\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646853239.jpg\" alt=\"Hario coffee server with coffee dripper on top\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646853239.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646853239.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646853239.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"2665\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans max-w-3xl text-center mx-auto\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">The Hario V60 server is designed to work seamlessly with the Hario V60 coffee dripper.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Harrison Malkin/Mashable</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>I used a full serving of coffee (600 milliliters) and made sure not to fiddle with the switch and gasket, because that keeps it vacuum sealed. I also preheated my mug upon first serving,&nbsp;which I think is a great idea in the winter time. If your mug is frozen, the benefits of the server will diminish and the temperature of your coffee will decrease. But with my second and third pouring, I was lazy and drank it straight.</p><p>When I checked in at the 30-minute mark, the temperature was nearly unchanged from the initial brewing. And after 90 minutes, my coffee was still hot and delicious when I poured a cup with my lunch of roasted veggies and an open-faced sandwich. Stainless steel servers rely on the beverage&rsquo;s original heat, unlike a hot plate, so you don&rsquo;t get that odd burnt aroma or taste.</p><p>Hours later, when I got home from the gym, I unexpectedly found the coffee warm enough to still drink &mdash; that was an added bonus with my post-workout snack. Having hot coffee for this long is ideal, and longer than what I was used to when I had the glass Hario server.&nbsp;</p><p>That glass carafe actually shattered when it fell on my kitchen floor, so the stainless steel model is an improvement in durability and utility. However, my current server does lose points for heaviness and clunkiness compared to the glass one. It can feel wonky to pour because coffee leaks into the back of the server, and you need to turn the carafe upside down to get every drop.&nbsp;</p><h2>Cleaning it&nbsp;</h2><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646858967.jpg\" alt=\"metal server sitting on wood surface\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646858967.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646858967.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646858967.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1500\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">The Hario coffee server is durable, but a little difficult to clean.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Harrison Malkin/Mashable</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>The server&rsquo;s interior gets coffee stains and a metallic odor easily, so I recommend cleaning it a few times per week. A quick rinse with hot water will do, but for a more holistic cleaning, it&rsquo;s best to use a mixture of hot water and baking soda or dish soap. Although, it&rsquo;s difficult to scrub the interior, and the lid is tricky to wash completely because it cannot be disassembled.</p><h2>Is the server worth buying?&nbsp;</h2><p>I've owned this server for about a year and it's a staple in my coffee-making process &mdash; along with my beans (often from <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/Lx7nO\">ModCup</a> or <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/y2rw2\">Black River</a>), <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/bZknr\">Stagg EKG kettle</a>, and <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/pVn6l\">Escali Primo scale</a>. I bought the 600-milliliter version, which is nice because it doesn&rsquo;t take up much counter space. The only downside is that it&rsquo;s too tiny if you&rsquo;re making coffee for multiple guests.&nbsp;The server is also available in an 800-milliliter option. Whichever size, the <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/E3Ey4\">Hario insulated server</a> is practical and affordable, and will be a worthwhile long-term investment for those looking to extend that perfect coffee taste.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Mar 2022 10:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"7beb74d20f5a77f3854899c251e63d4b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn91@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-02-716_6077b720fcf1fe54.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":389052,"destBytes":389052,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn91@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-02-716_6077b720fcf1fe54.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646853239.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn43@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-24-850_83d969c710c6b61c.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/07sSKDlILO33Y44bxsGfD2a/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646858967.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn68@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-24-845_9bf020a0c6ac6364.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421753},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Samuel L. href=\"https://zdcs.link/n6wbq?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmashable.com%2Ffeeds%2Frss%2Fall&amp;short_url=n6wbq&amp;cd36=Standard&amp;t=deals&amp;m=deal-card&amp;e=offer&amp;i=buy-button&amp;el=offer\" font-sans btn btn-secondary w-full tracking-wide md:w-auto px-5 md:text-lg\">Get Deal</button>\n        </a>\n    </div>\n</div>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 05:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04pBIphkpLcr8d66EQOEiWk/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"430d8a1e9a1ec79b23f9bd1e2d0d675e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn6@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-02-316_82b823031543f049.webp","destWidth":1248,"destHeight":702,"sourceBytes":419959,"destBytes":41224,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04pBIphkpLcr8d66EQOEiWk/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn6@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-02-316_82b823031543f049.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04pBIphkpLcr8d66EQOEiWk/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421771},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"'Turning Red' review: Imagine if Pixar made 'Pen15'","link":"https://mashable.com/article/turning-red-review","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Three adolescent girls face a giant red panda, who seems embarrassed. \"><p>Becoming a woman can be a messy process. For many, puberty hits hard, transforming our bodies into strange creatures we no longer recognize. Our limbs stretch; our curves swell. A natural musk blooms from our skin. We grow hair in places where there was no hair before. And our emotions attack in a wild rush. For Meilin \"Mei\" Lee, the heroine of the latest Disney/Pixar movie, <i>Turning Red</i>, all of this is true, <i>also,</i> she turns into a giant red panda. This cuddly cute shape-shift is a metaphor for puberty that's bold, bonkers, and totally brilliant &mdash; while being a boatload of fun.&nbsp;</p><p>Co-written and directed by Domee Shi, <a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/pixar-turning-red-trailer\"><i>Turning Red</i></a><a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/pixar-turning-red-trailer\"> </a>is set in 2002 Toronto, where 13-year-old Mei (Rosalie Chiang) is a straight-A student with a bit of a double life. With her Chinese-Canadian family, she is a devoted daughter, volunteering at their temple, helping with dinner, and ever-poised and polite. With her friends, she's a headstrong goofball who loves karaoke, boy bands, and imagining her crushes as mermen. With these dueling identities, Shi and co-writer Julia Cho set the child that Mei is to her parents against the young woman she's becoming. When the pressure to be perfect for her mom and her friends becomes too much, Mei transforms into a towering, fluffy red panda.&nbsp;</p><h2><i><b>Turning Red </b></i><b>brings back to the poppy fun of the 2000s</b></h2><p>Steeped in 2000s nostalgia, this transformation is less traumatizing and more terrific, making Mei as cute and appealing as her Tamagochi virtual pet. With flip-phones and old-school emojis, she and her friends find the fun to be had in her panda. But to her mother, this \"gross red monster\" is a shameful secret that must be hidden, suppressed, and banished with the blood moon. As the moon approaches, so does the concert date for Mei and her friends' favorite boy band, 4 Town. And so comes a showdown full of panda action, mother-daughter drama, and deliciously catchy pop music (written by Billie Eilish and Finneas).&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646257376.jpg\" alt=\"A mom looks at her young daughter's notebook; both look alarmed. \" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-3.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646257376.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-3.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646257376.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646257376.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Disney / Pixar</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2><b>Kids and grown-ups will love </b><i><b>Turning Red</b></i></h2><p>Panda aside, Mei's journey to young womanhood is similar to those seen in cringe-comedies like <a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/eighth-grade-pool-party-clip-exclusive\"><i>Eighth Grade,</i></a><i> </i><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/pen15-season-2-review\"><i>Pen15</i></a>, and <i>Bob's Burgers</i>' Tina Belcher plot lines. All possess a deep empathy for the harried heroine, who is flustered, awkward, and frantically horny. Their fumbles and foibles make us laugh not at them, but at ourselves way back then. <i>Turning Red</i> is less cringe-inducing than its thematic sisters, thanks to the '00s pop-optimism, vivid color palette, and Pixar's kid-friendly polish. Whether Mei is feeling insecure about her body, fighting with her mother, or fantasizing about a cute boy, the vibe is more romp than recoil. This is a genius move by Shi. Because while parents (and child-free grown-ups) will relish the nostalgia for the '00s in aesthetic and perhaps personal naivete, actual kids won't feel the crushing weight of all that cringe. <i>That</i> comes later, be it through age, wisdom, or therapy (or all three).</p><p>Kids won't put together what Mei's mom (an apoplectic Sandra Oh) means when she asks if daughter's \"red peony has bloomed.\" The central metaphor will go over their heads, as will the reason Mei's mom reacts so intensely when she discovers a notebook swamped in steamy doodles. To youngsters, this will be a bouncy story about a girl fighting for her right to grow up, find her own identity, and rock out with her best friends. More importantly, they'll get to see a group of girls who don't fit the typical Disney/Pixar heroine mold not only be heroes but also be loved just as they are.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646257376.jpg\" alt=\"Four young girls dance in a goofy way. \" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646257376.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646257376.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646257376.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Disney / Pixar</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2><b>Mei breaks the mold of Disney heroines</b></h2><p>Forget the flawless and poised princesses of Disney past, who get ball gowns and sea creature serenades in their quests for romance. Mei is not crushing on princes, but those pretty boys of elementary school, who'd toss their long floppy bangs with no idea how it made our hearts skip a beat. (Shi re-creating exactly this move in slo-mo is dead-on and divine.)&nbsp;</p><p>Mei doesn't make pretty smiles or flirty lip bites when she swoons. Her face contorts in a way typically denied Disney's female characters. It's a face that's not cute but is crucial to expressing that juvenile pang of lust that's so abrupt and confounding that your face basically short-circuits. Even in these moments, Mei's got her girls, each of whom is a familiar yet distinct brand of 8th-grade awkward. Always a booster, Miriam (Ava Morse) is enthusiastic but a bit oblivious. Priya (<a href=\"https://in.mashable.com/entertainment/28286/turning-red-maitreyi-ramakrishnan-on-diversity-and-female-friendships-in-the-pixar-film\">Maitreyi Ramakrishnan</a>)&nbsp;is steadily chill, but will give in for a dance break. Abby (Hyein Park) is a girly girl who loves pink, flowers, and fluffy friends, but also will punch you in the face with a moment's notice. Just like the red panda, they break the mold on what being a girl means in a Disney movie. They do it with verve and style &mdash;&nbsp;and we love them for all of it.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/turning-red-pixar\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            'Turning Red''s creators on how the coming of age Pixar film captures teen angst\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<h2><b>A coming-of-age tale that shows maturity in the Disney/Pixar brand</b></h2><p>I could go on and on about the joys of <i>Turning Red</i>, from the visual gags of bunny slippers crushed under big panda feet to the concert merch that becomes a pivotal prop. There's the rollicking pace that makes the movie feel like a roller coaster, full of swerves and thrills. The soundtrack is both throwback and self-aware, nudging at the message while gently parodying boy band jams <i>while</i> being an undeniable bop. The wealth of '00s details will amuse kids but will pitch grown-ups full-bodied back into the era of choker necklaces, flannel fashion, and emo kids. The jubilant animation builds a world familiar yet fresh, perfect for a perplexed giant red panda running amuck. Led by Chiang, the voice cast is sensational, bringing to life characters who get to be cranky, frantic, caring, and occasionally \"kind of a perv.\" But the most remarkable thing about this movie is how it marks a maturity for Disney animation.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646257376.jpg\" alt=\"A little bespectacled girl walks down a Toronto street. \" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646257376.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646257376.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01NZEuVj0eidqvgWW4gmfmC/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646257376.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Disney / Pixar</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>For decades, Disney sold little girls polished princess fantasies to sell toys. But in that, they also sold an idea of girlhood that was woefully limiting. Here, the fantasy has an element of body horror but is treated with a jocular touch that makes <i>Turning Red </i>an absolute blast. In giving us a protagonist who is confident, kooky, but also a mess, Disney and Pixar gave kids a role model who rejects convention and is better for it &mdash;&nbsp;and better for us.&nbsp;</p><p>Full of fun, humor, and heart, <i>Turning Red</i> is a coming-of-age comedy that's as exhilarating as it is groundbreaking family entertainment.</p><p><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/dY48j\"><i>Turning Red</i></a><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/dY48j\"> is now streaming on Disney+. </a></p><div class=\"content-block-mashable-video mt-8\">\n    <div nipple","link":"https://mashable.com/video/snl-tiktok-white-house-biden-cold-open","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/03phaUIDoPJH3CVU3GCCJNO/hero-image.png\" alt=\"Kate McKinnon and James Austin Johnson in costume as Jen Psaki and Joe Biden, respectively, together in the White House alongside a shirtless Bowen Yang with a plunger affixed to one of his nipples.\"><p>There's some good comedy in this <i>Saturday Night Live</i> cold open, but you'll forget all of it once Bowen Yang's plunger nipple arrives on the scene.</p><p>The sketch riffs on a <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2022/03/11/tik-tok-ukraine-white-house/\">very real meeting</a> the White House had with TikTok influencers on Thursday in an effort to counter Russian misinformation on social media that has framed Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine as a good and necessary thing. That meeting prompted <i>SNL</i> writers to imagine what happened behind closed doors, and it's as deranged as you'd expect.</p><p>I don't follow much on TikTok personally, so I probably missed a bunch of references. There's a great moment with Kenan Thompson, who plays a roofer from Pittsburgh named Charles D'Amelio &mdash; a case of mistaken identity for a White House that meant to invite <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/charli-d-amelio-tiktok-100-million-followers\">top TikTok follow Charli D'Amelio</a>. And another with Aidy Bryant playing a cutesy animal makeup artist who turns out to be an alt-right wingnut. Also, James Austin Johnson, as Biden, refers to himself at one point as \"the landline of presidents,\" which is just great.</p><p>But Bowen Yang owns the best bit of the sketch. He shows up shirtless and with a plunger affixed to one of his nipples, which I assume is a riff on <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RDS28C5ZUf4\">Japanese comedian Kazuhisa Uekasa's own antics</a> with the clog-breaking tool. He's got the most insightful comments of the entire sketch, but the camera can only seem to focus on one thing. Just good visual comedy for the TV audience at home.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold helping people find love.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 14:19:16 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/002iTqNd9kT7VX7uKmS3wJA/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"f434db07de68dc1591012fd633f65ea0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn34@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-03-217_9c6659069c9b2c4b.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":483300,"destBytes":163120,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/002iTqNd9kT7VX7uKmS3wJA/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn34@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-03-217_9c6659069c9b2c4b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421776},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"How to pre-order the new green iPhone 13 and iPhone 13 Pro","link":"https://mashable.com/deals/iphone-13-green-preorder","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01agPsca49X0oPtX4sOBXZA/hero-image.png\" alt=\"two green iphone 13s\"><p><b>PREORDER:</b> The new green <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/57ord\">iPhone 13</a> and <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/O2OEY\">alpine green iPhone 13 Pro</a> will go up for preorder on the Apple website at 5 a.m. PST on Friday, March 11, a week before their official release on Friday, March 18.</p><hr><p>Apple has made several <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2017/04/20/apple-mining-end-recycled-material-products.html\">major</a> <a href=\"https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/07/apple-commits-to-be-100-percent-carbon-neutral-for-its-supply-chain-and-products-by-2030/\">commitments</a> to sustainability over the past few years, but it took the \"going green\" thing quite literally with the latest additions to its iPhone 13 lineup.</p><p>Tim Cook <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/apple-event-22-iphone-13-green-ipad-air-purple\">introduced</a> a \"bold\" green iPhone 13 and a \"sophisticated\" alpine green iPhone 13 Pro at this week's \"Peek Performance\" event, setting their official release date for Friday, March 18. If you want to reserve one ahead of time, you can do so through the Apple website starting at 5 a.m. PST this Friday, March 11. </p><p>Prices start at $699 for the <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/jBjN1\">iPhone 13 mini</a>, $799 for the standard <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/57ord\">iPhone 13</a>, $999 for the <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/O2OEY\">iPhone 13 Pro</a>, and $1,099 for the <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/pVnJo\">iPhone 13 Pro Max</a>, but keep in mind that you can get up to $1,000 off with a trade-in <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/w2o8D\">depending on your carrier</a>.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/apple-event-2022-everything-announced-roundup\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Everything announced at the Apple 2022 'Peek Performance' event\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>As a quick refresher, the iPhone 13 family initially debuted last September with some subtle (but mostly successful) design changes. The 6.1-inch iPhone 13 and the 5.4-inch iPhone 13 mini won tech reporter Stan Schroeder over with their improved battery life, starting storage capacity of 128GB, and \"cool\" new Cinematic camera mode, and wound up taking home a Mashable's Choice Award. (<a href=\"https://mashable.com/review/iphone-13-review\">Click here</a> to read the full review.) </p><p>For their part, a 6.1-inch iPhone 13 Pro or a 6.7-inch iPhone 13 Pro Max will get you a stunning Super Retina XDR display that supports refresh rates of up to 120Hz, plus some beefed-up cameras with Apple's high-end <a href=\"https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT212832\">ProRes video format</a> and better low-light performance. These upgrades \"won't transform your life,\" cautioned deputy tech editor Joseph Volpe, but if you're really into photography (and have some cash to spare), those cameras are a serious flex. Peep his complete review <a href=\"https://mashable.com/review/iphone-13-pro-pro-max-review\">here</a>.</p><div class=\"max-w-3xl mx-auto mb-16 font-sans flex flex-col mt-8 md:flex-row\"
