Not because there aren't enough geeks out there, but because dating as a geek is tough. For <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-dating-sites-women-uk\">women</a>, it can involve a lot of creepy guys who want their manic pixie dream girl. For <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-dating-sites-for-men-uk\">men</a>, it can involve a lot of simply trying to not be that guy. If you're in the majority of geeks who are a little bit <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-dating-sites-for-introverts-uk\">introverted</a>, dating can be really intimidating.</p><p>News flash: Loving sci-fi and being madly in love are not mutually exclusive, and success stories from dating sites prove this. You can still find love out there in the real world, but subscribing to a dating site shortens your odds of making a connection.</p><h2><b>Should you consider free dating apps?</b></h2><p>The good news is that there are plenty of free dating sites and apps out there, and the likes of Tinder and Hinge are seriously popular options with huge networks of users. Most of the biggest and best dating sites also offer free versions of their services (with limitations on certain features). You can easily enter the online dating game without spending anything, but sometimes free apps simply don't cut it.</p><p>You get what you pay for with dating sites and apps. For the best experience with the greatest possibility of finding exactly what you're looking for, you are going to dig a little deeper in your pockets. The best dating sites don't come cheap, and whilst you can still find a hookup with a free app, you should upgrade is you're looking for compatibility tests, chat rooms, videos, and a greater level of control.</p><h2><b>What is the best dating site for geeks?</b></h2><p>We have compared all of the internet's top dating sites, trendy swiping apps, and geek-specific sites to find the ones where geeks can express themselves and find that special someone. src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cfOvpRZiJbHoFdVDmT38d/hero-image.png\" alt=\"apple watch with peloton app\"><p>Peloton obsessives, fire up <a href=\"https://mashable.com/category/apple-watch\">your Apple Watches</a> &mdash; or maybe go out and get one. The fitness company announced Thursday you can now connect your Peloton workouts with an Apple Watch. That means you can track your workouts, and how hard you worked out, with just one tap on your watch. </p><p>It's a full integration between the popular device and the popular fitness company &mdash; something lots of folks were likely eagerly awaiting. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/peloton-to-stop-making-bikes\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Peloton will reportedly halt making... basically everything\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>\"With just one tap on your Apple Watch, you can now track your performance during any Peloton workout on the Bike, Bike+, Tread or App,\" Peloton <a href=\"https://blog.onepeloton.com/apple-watch-integration/\">wrote on its blog</a>. \"All it takes is a tap to connect the Peloton App for Apple Watch to any workout on the Bike, Bike+, Tread or App. That way, you can easily keep track of your Strive Score, monitor your heart rate and close your rings&mdash;all in real time.\"</p><p>According to Peloton, the app on your watch should now notify you when you're about to start a workout. All you do is tap the notification and start tracking your workout. You can also start tracking manually by opening the Peloton app on your Apple Watch. </p><p>Via the Apple Watch, Peloton will use your heart rate to track your workout, which will then give you a Strive Score, which is basically a personalized metric that tells you how hard you worked compared to past workouts. </p><h2>How to connect Peloton to Apple Watch</h2><p>Setting up the integration isn't difficult, but there are a few steps. </p><h3>1. First, download the Peloton app to your Apple Watch.</h3><h3>2. Click \"More,\" then \"Apple Watch,\" then \"Set Up,\" then \"Connect to Health App.\" </h3><h3>3. Once you're in the Health app, select \"Turn On All,\" so Peloton can access your data. </h3><h3>4. From there, open the Peloton app on your Apple Watch and, when prompted, give it permission to send notifications. </h3><p>If you need further details, such as images of the process, Peloton <a href=\"https://blog.onepeloton.com/apple-watch-integration/\">has that on its blog here</a>. </p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 15:01:10 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cfOvpRZiJbHoFdVDmT38d/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"875861a27d507aaf3cf44ff9ac051f73","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn77@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-03-129_5b69bd3edf2abfa9.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":109886,"destBytes":109886,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05cfOvpRZiJbHoFdVDmT38d/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn77@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-03-129_5b69bd3edf2abfa9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421774},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"YouTube blocks any and all content tied to Russian state media","link":"https://mashable.com/article/youtube-blocks-russian-media-channels","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01jzZ3K2LtxpQ9SVnFa7wqa/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"The YouTube logo appears through a magnifying glass held over a Russian flag.\"><p>YouTube is now removing all content with ties to Russian state-funded media, it announced Friday, in its latest effort to curb misinformation and prioritize \"trusted\" news sources. </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/YouTubeInsider/status/1502335030168899595?s=20&amp;t=OmSF4u3Mo4S6wcyGK1GB4g\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>\"Our teams have now removed more than 1,000 channels and over 15,000 videos for violating not only our hate speech policy, but also our policies around misinformation, graphic content and more,\" the company <a href=\"https://twitter.com/YouTubeInsider/status/1502335119914381314?s=20&amp;t=OmSF4u3Mo4S6wcyGK1GB4g\">tweeted</a> alongside the announcement. </p><p>On March 1, YouTube announced it was <a href=\"https://twitter.com/YouTubeInsider/status/1498772480034365440?s=20&amp;t=OmSF4u3Mo4S6wcyGK1GB4g\">removing the Russian channels RT and Sputnik</a>, both of which are state-funded news media, and pausing all ads and recommendations for any Russian state-funded media channels. The company also drew attention to its Russia-specific information flags, introduced in 2018, which appear under videos to designate when content is linked to government funding. The panel reads, \"funded in whole or in part by the Russian government.\"</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/ukraine-russia-war-who-to-follow-misinformation\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            How to keep up with the news from Russia and Ukraine \n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>Along with its latest decision to expand these restrictions, YouTube added that the site has seen more interaction with its monitored \"Top News\" and \"Breaking News\" homepage shelves &mdash; the pages have received more than 17 million views in Ukraine alone. Moving forward, the company says it will continue to ramp up its systems to remove more state-sponsored content as needed. </p><p>YouTube suspended all forms of monetization for Russian state-funded content, as well.</p><p>Globally, <a href=\"https://helios-preview.mashable.com/article/social-media-misinformation-ukraine-russia\">social media companies including Meta, Twitter, and TikTok</a> have taken steps to try and prevent the spread of misinformation on their platforms, from cutting revenue-generating advertisements to deleting accounts, even partnering with third-party media literacy organizations. </p><p><a href=\"https://helios-preview.mashable.com/article/video-game-developers-publishers-russia-ukraine-war-sanctions\">Gaming developers like Microsoft and Sony</a> have pulled product launches and services, and service apps like <a href=\"https://helios-preview.mashable.com/article/paypal-shuts-down-russia-service-ukraine\">Paypal</a> and <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/airbnb-russia-suspends-operations-ukraine\">Airbnb</a> have made the choice to suspend their offerings in Russia. These decisions will surely have an impact on Russian citizens who remain in the country as well as those abroad &mdash; many of whom are stranded <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-covid-health-travel-business-e31653ca76e092c78a2af5c53f083b7a\">without access to money or information</a> due to global sanctions. </p><p>But the choice to remove Russian-state controlled media from sites like YouTube will hopefully turn more people toward trusted news organizations. And as many Russians face <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2022/03/07/1084967986/russia-arrests-more-protesters\">intense retribution from state officials</a> for decrying the invasion and combatting <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/03/10/technology/disinformation-russia-ukraine.html\">misinformation campaigns from their own leaders</a>, that's a significant task. </p><p><b>For more stories on the war in Ukraine:</b></p><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/ukraine-russia-war-who-to-follow-misinformation\">How to keep up with the news from Russia and Ukraine</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://helios-preview.mashable.com/article/ukraine-footage-mental-health\">Watching footage from Ukraine? Here's how to protect your mental health.</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://helios-preview.mashable.com/article/social-media-misinformation-ukraine-russia\">What social media platforms are doing to stop misinformation about Russia's invasion of Ukraine</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/how-to-help-ukraine-refugees\">How to help refugees fleeing Ukraine</a></p></li></ul>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Mar 2022 18:27:17 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01jzZ3K2LtxpQ9SVnFa7wqa/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"16b4fb5014b321956f7d8d93769c39d6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn15@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-05-897_0bf943ca406d1055.webp","destWidth":4752,"destHeight":3168,"sourceBytes":24674750,"destBytes":670436,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01jzZ3K2LtxpQ9SVnFa7wqa/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn15@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-05-897_0bf943ca406d1055.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421754},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"This computer science certification bundle is on sale for under £30","link":"https://mashable.com/uk/deals/best-computer-science-certification-bundle","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02mTje5cCoTnTGAohhwhpR3/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Laptop and phone\"><p><b>TL;DR: </b>The <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/vW0oE\">2022 All-in-One Computer Science Certification Bundle</a> is on sale for &pound;26.61, saving you 98% on list price.</p><hr><p>If you're interested in learning computer science, but you never knew where (or when) to start, you're in luck! 05:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02mTje5cCoTnTGAohhwhpR3/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"53d732ae6f33f2fcb703313a86145d50","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn51@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-02-017_dd469598667998ec.webp","destWidth":1248,"destHeight":702,"sourceBytes":63620,"destBytes":63620,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02mTje5cCoTnTGAohhwhpR3/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn51@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-02-017_dd469598667998ec.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02mTje5cCoTnTGAohhwhpR3/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn11@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-24-820_4745421300647f6b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421738},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Meet HELIOS, a robot here to clean your solar panels","link":"https://mashable.com/video/solar-panel-cleaning-robot","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/00ZbGYNTKGybtpUobhfIjYf/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Drone carrying a solar panel cleaning robot\"><p>Need your solar panels cleaned? Fear not. HELIOS, an automated drone and robot duo, is here to help.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 18:46:13 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/00ZbGYNTKGybtpUobhfIjYf/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"c5f7bd1899591f1da85ef5604a63e547","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn85@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-041_cf0aadeacbf47998.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":454260,"destBytes":454260,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/00ZbGYNTKGybtpUobhfIjYf/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn85@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-041_cf0aadeacbf47998.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421756},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"DuckDuckGo 'down-ranks' Russian disinformation. The search engine's users are not happy.","link":"https://mashable.com/article/duckduckgo-search-engine-russian-disinformation","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rFJVPLAvqxYgVFJM9N59W/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"DuckDuckGo\"><p>Tech companies are <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/social-media-misinformation-ukraine-russia\">continuing</a></u> to take action as Russia's war in Ukraine rages on. Search engine DuckDuckGo is the latest platform to take measures in the information war that's being battled online.</p><p>According to DuckDuckGo's founder and CEO, Gabriel Weinberg, the privacy-focused search engine has \"down-ranked\" websites in its search results that are \"associated with Russian disinformation.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/yegg/status/1501716484761997318?s=21\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>\"Like so many others I am sickened by Russia&rsquo;s invasion of Ukraine and the gigantic humanitarian crisis it continues to create. #StandWithUkraine&#65039;,\" Weinberg wrote in a tweet thread on his personal Twitter account explaining DuckDuckGo's actions.</p><p>To those unfamiliar with DuckDuckGo, the move may not feel too out of the ordinary. Social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter have updated their policies to <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/social-media-misinformation-ukraine-russia\">deal with disinformation</a></u> about Russia's war. Search engines like <u><a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/28/google-facebook-battle-to-stop-spread-of-russian-disinformation.html\">Google</a></u> and even <u><a href=\"https://www.pcworld.com/article/618016/microsoft-pulls-russia-news-sources-rt-from-bing-start.html\">Microsoft's Bing</a></u> have taken actions against disinformation, too.</p><p>However, the overwhelming response to Weinberg's tweets about the \"down-rankings\" has been outrage from DuckDuckGo's user base. Some even claim to have already changed their default search engine preference due to this decision.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/AdamantPluto/status/1501772591211687936\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>\"Can you see how swiftly most of your user base has been put off by this announcement?\" reads a <u><a href=\"https://twitter.com/AdamantPluto/status/1501772591211687936\">reply</a></u> from @AdamantPluto. \"Loyal long time supporters are talking about abandoning the service. Please reconsider your stance on this.\"</p><p>\"This is not the way bro,\" <u><a href=\"https://twitter.com/primalpoly/status/1501899964619935744\">replied</a></u> @primalpoly. \"We no longer trust anyone to decide for us what is 'misinformation.' Let us make our own calls about that.\"</p><p>Whenever the topic of alternative online platforms comes up, the focus is usually on social media services like <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/trump-truth-social-free-speech-bans\">so-called</a></u> \"free speech\" networks <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/inside-truth-social-trump-social-network-tour\">Truth Social</a></u> or <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/gettr-hacked\">Gettr</a></u>. Yet perhaps the most successful alternative to Big Tech platforms is actually DuckDuckGo, which was founded in 2008 as an alternative to the big search engine giants like Google. The company has always focused on privacy and emphasized user privacy. </p><p>According to the <i>New York Times</i>, DuckDuckGo currently makes up around <u><a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/23/technology/duckduckgo-conspiracy-theories.html\">3 percent</a></u> of the U.S. search engine market share. The service's growth points to a strong interest from users looking for a more privacy-oriented search platform. DuckDuckGo says it currently has a U.S. user base of 30 million people from all across the political spectrum. However, it has also gained traction over the past few years as <u><a href=\"https://www.inputmag.com/culture/duckduckgo-more-misinformation-than-google-conspiracy-theories\">conspiracy theorists</a></u> and far-right internet users sought out alternative online platforms as a response to Big Tech companies' content moderation policies.</p><p>Unlike most other recent alternative platforms, though, DuckDuckGo was not built to placate users with a certain political ideology. Still, DuckDuckGo has found themselves lumped in with those platforms just by <i>being </i>an alternative platform in this day and age. So, whether DuckDuckGo likes it or not, many of those types of users have adopted the search engine.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/JasonHayward87/status/1501720436224241666\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>\"The whole point of DuckDuckGo is for you to NOT do that,\" <u><a href=\"https://twitter.com/JasonHayward87/status/1501720436224241666\">replied</a></u> @JasonHayward87 to the DuckDuckGo down-rankings announcement.</p><p>\"So the one thing that differentiates you from Google's uselessly politicized search - you're binning that,\" <u><a href=\"https://twitter.com/MorganColeBooks/status/1501801221270777856\">complained</a></u> another user, @MorganColeBooks.</p><p>Weinberg responded to the previous reply on Twitter.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/yegg/status/1501733167291674627\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>\"The whole point of DuckDuckGo is privacy,\" he stated. \"The whole point of the search engine is to show more relevant content over less relevant content, and that is what we continue to do.\"</p><p>Privacy and data collection policies don't necessarily mean content policies. DuckDuckGo itself, however, has marketed the fact that its search engine results don't create a content \"filter bubble\" that's often found with personalized search results based on users' data.</p><p>DuckDuckGo's dedication to and frequent advertisement of its \"<u><a href=\"https://twitter.com/DuckDuckGo/status/1114524914227253249\">unbiased results</a></u>\" &ndash; again, based on its privacy policies &ndash; have caused confusion among its user base after this most recent action.&nbsp;</p><p>When it comes to content policies <i>unrelated</i> to user data, DuckDuckGo has actually moderated its search results before. The search engine already bans <u><a href=\"https://www.webpronews.com/duckduckgo-follows-content-farm-banning-with-promoting-wikihow-content/\">content farms</a></u> on its platform due to the low-quality content often found on these websites.</p><p>DuckDuckGo is also often beholden to the content policies of Big Tech search engines, because that's where it actually gets its search results. For example, when the infamous \"Tank Man\" Chinese protest photo temporarily <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/microsoft-bing-tank-man\">disappeared</a></u> from Bing last year, the photo stopped appearing in DuckDuckGo's search results as well.</p><p>These nuances don't appear to affect how DuckDuckGo's users feel about Weinberg's announcement. At the time this piece was published, Weinberg's tweet about the \"down-rank\" has been replied to more than 10,000 times and received over 3,000 quote tweets. The tweet has less than 600 retweets. In Twitter lingo, this is called being \"<u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/chris-cilizza-twitter-ratio\">ratioed</a></u>\" &ndash; when a tweet receives more replies than shares, signaling the broader Twitter user base is not in agreement with what's being said.</p><p>In addition to down-ranking certain websites, Weinberg also <a href=\"https://twitter.com/yegg/status/1501717193855283201\">announced</a> that DuckDuckGo would display \"news modules and information boxes\" pointing users to \"quality information\" for certain breaking topics. Many platforms like Facebook and YouTube already provide a similar features. Google calls them \"knowledge panels\" on its search engine. However, this feature doesn't seem to have caused an uproar like DuckDuckGo's down-rankings have.</p><p>Mashable has reached out to DuckDuckGo for comment. We will update this piece when we hear back.</p><p class=\"mx-auto\">\n   <em><strong>UPDATE: Mar. 10, 2022, 2:35 p.m. EST </strong>A DuckDuckGo spokesperson provided Mashable with a statement regarding its decision to \"down-rank\" Russian disinformation websites.</em>\n</p>\n<p>\"The primary utility of a search engine is to provide access to accurate information,\" writes a DuckDuckGo spokesperson. \"Disinformation sites that deliberately put out false information to intentionally mislead people directly cut against that utility...We are simply using the fact that these sites are engaging in active disinformation campaigns as a ranking signal that the content they produce is of lower quality, just like there are signals for spammy sites and other lower-quality content.\"</p><p>As mentioned earlier, this isn't the first time DuckDuckGo has moderated for quality. And as <a href=\"https://www.protocol.com/bulletins/duckduckgo-yandex-ukraine\">Protocol</a> covered earlier this month, it's also not the first time DuckDuckGo has taken action regarding Russia's war in Ukraine. The company has recently \"paused\" its partnership with the Russian search engine Yandex. DuckDuckGo was using the service's results for some of its search queries in certain countries.</p><p>DuckDuckGo's full statement as provided to Mashable can be found below:</p><blockquote><p><i>The primary utility of a search engine is to provide access to accurate information. Disinformation sites that deliberately put out false information to intentionally mislead people directly cut against that utility. Current examples are Russian state-sponsored media sites like RT and Sputnik. It's also important to note that down-ranking is different from censorship. We are simply using the fact that these sites are engaging in active disinformation campaigns as a ranking signal that the content they produce is of lower quality, just like there are signals for spammy sites and other lower-quality content. In addition to this approach, for newsworthy topics we're also continuing to highlight reputable news coverage and reliable &ldquo;instant answers&rdquo; at the top of our search results where they are seen and clicked the most. We're also in the process of thinking about other types of interventions.&nbsp;</i></p></blockquote><p></p><p class=\"mx-auto\">\n   <em><strong>UPDATE: Mar. 10, 2022, 3:33 p.m. EST </strong>Additional information from DuckDuckGo has been added to the piece regarding its U.S. user base stats and why people use the platform.</em>\n</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 18:32:13 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rFJVPLAvqxYgVFJM9N59W/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"6877bc30d170a65e6ed3208cfffe4ae4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn46@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-03-521_2995c1301e247099.webp","destWidth":4917,"destHeight":3278,"sourceBytes":1477384,"destBytes":1477384,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rFJVPLAvqxYgVFJM9N59W/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn46@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-03-521_2995c1301e247099.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421772},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Try this streaming-friendly VPN risk-free for 45 days","link":"https://mashable.com/uk/deals/best-free-trial-vpn","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05eT1zoiFunpkv9OE01gFGO/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Lit up laptop in dark room\"><p><b>SAVE 82%:</b> CyberGhost VPN is a streaming-friendly service that offers plenty of advanced security features. 2022):</b></p><ul><li><p><u><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/RoyW7\">Eufy 15C Max</a></u> &mdash; <b>$179.99</b> <s>$279.99</s> (save $100)</p></li><li><p><u><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/7WAY8\">Ecovacs &mdash;&nbsp;<b>$417.98</b> <s>$599.99</s> (save $182)</p></li></ul><hr><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-robot-vacuums\">Robot vacuums</a> have revolutionized the way we clean our homes &mdash;&nbsp;because we don't have to be home to clean. </p><p>With scheduled sweeping sessions welcoming you home to a floor that's ready for bare feet, the work on your end shifts to choosing a robot vacuum that's <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-robot-vacuums\">best for your home's floor type</a>. </p><h2>Do robot vacuums really work?</h2><p>The latest robot vacuums aren't the lazy bumper cars that you may have heard about or experienced earlier. The right ones are beasts. </p><p>If we're being honest, robot vacs are usually not as thorough as <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-vacuum-cleaners-reviews\">traditional upright vacuum cleaners</a>. Their suction isn't as powerful and you just can't get the same kind of clean that you get from eyeballing your floors and going back over spots you can tell you missed.</p><p>Many higher-end robot vacuums do have heightened dirt detection features that help them to scope out problem areas that require extra attention. Smart robot vacuums that navigate based on a self-made map of your home actually know where they're going and can be sent to certain rooms on your command. Otherwise, the method is essentially a random \"hope this works\" pattern that covers less than the side-by-side lines you would probably do if you were the one controlling the vacuum. Though the robots try to hit every spot with this method, they're bound to miss every now and then.</p><p>Regardless, one thing to ask yourself is: Are you currently vacuuming your floors <i>every day</i>? Because robot vacuums can do that. Even if they miss a spot one day, they might catch it the next, leading to an overall increase in floor cleanliness. </p><h2>Are robot vacuums better for hardwood floors or carpet?</h2><p>Given the velcro-like grasp that carpets can have on daily droppings, most robot vacuums perform better on hardwood than on carpet. All robot vacuums have a main suction system and side brushes that push dry debris (crumbs, kitty litter, dirt) into the line of suction. Not all of them have impressive brush rolls or the sheer suction power to rake carpet threads, though, <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-robot-vacuums-for-carpet\">which are a necessity for cleaning carpets</a>.</p><p>Sucking up hair (human or <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-robot-vacuums-pet-hair\">pet</a>) is easier for robot vacuums on hard flooring because on carpet, the vacuums have to really be able to dig deep and pull up hair embedded in the fibers. On smooth floors, the hair has nothing to get stuck on. If you have both carpet and hard flooring, most robot vacuums automatically adjust between floor types, lowering or raising to get the closest clean possible.</p><h2>What about hard floors that aren't wood?</h2><p>Laminate floors, tile floors, and any other kind of hard, bare floors can get the same treatment as wood floors. Robot vacuums that work well on hardwood floors will also do a good job on these floors.</p><h2>Do robot vacuums scratch hardwood floors?</h2><p>Robot vacuums are purposefully are designed to work on hardwood floors without scratching them. They have rubber wheels and gentle rubber brushes that pull in dirt without gnawing at your floors.</p><p>Where you might get floor scratching is if an abrasive piece of sand, glass, rock, etc. gets caught under the wheel and drags throughout the house. This is pretty uncommon, but to be safe, make sure your floors are clear of any large, sharp debris before running the robot vacuum.</p><h2>Are robot mops safe for hardwood floors?</h2><p>Any avowed hardwood floor enthusiast is likely to be just as meticulous about dried shoe prints or wine spills as they are about dust and debris. A robot mop's light wet scrub offers a satisfying shine to a robot vacuum's dry sweep, especially if your hardcore mopping sessions with real hardwood cleaner are few and far between.</p><p>Many robot mops (especially hybrid robot vacuum-robot mop models, like the ones listed below) only mop with water, alleviating concerns about topcoat-damaging ingredients like vinegar, ammonia, or other alkaline products. src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01gL5oz200dJcK18F8dcq6X/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Hand holding a smartphone displaying the Twitter app.\"><p>\"Swipe left\" just took on a whole new meaning. </p><p>On Thursday, Twitter announced that all iOS users now have the option to quickly switch between the Latest and Home timelines with a quick swipe. Twitter had <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/twitter-algorithmic-timeline-live-for-everyone\">prioritized the Home timeline</a> as far back as 2016, but gave users the option to opt out via a <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/twitter-sparkle-icon-chronological-timeline\">nebulous sparkle icon</a> starting in 2018.</p><p>For the unaware, the Latest timeline is the traditional reverse-chronological version and is perhaps most associated with Twitter. The Home timeline, on the other hand, is the disjointed algorithm-populated timeline littered with seemingly random posts from <a href=\"https://help.twitter.com/en/using-twitter/twitter-timeline\">unfamiliar accounts</a>. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/twitter-tor-onion-router-censorship-resistant\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Twitter quietly launches Tor service in the face of Russian censorship\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>With Thursday's update, Twitter seems to have finally come to the realization that users know what works best for them. </p><p>\"With a tap of the sparkle icon, you&rsquo;ll now be able to pin both Home (a personalized timeline of Tweets) and Latest (a timeline of the most recent Tweets from the accounts you follow) to your Home page, allowing you to swipe back and forth easily between the two tabs,\" a Twitter spokesperson explained over email.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/TwitterSupport/status/1501989523588358145\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>Perhaps annoyingly for some users, a Twitter spokesperson confirmed that this update does make the Home timeline the default timeline <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/twitter-algorithmic-timeline-live-for-everyone\">once again</a>, at least \"for now.\" Users will need to get used to swiping left, every time they open the iOS app, in order to see the most recent tweets. </p><p>Twitter had been testing this swipe feature with a subset of iOS users <a href=\"https://twitter.com/TwitterSupport/status/1447971179185295364\">since October of 2021</a>, but Thursday's update makes it official for all iOS users. The company says support for \"Web and Android coming soon.\"</p><p>Notably, giving users the ability to swipe back and forth between timelines was an idea shared as far back as August of 2021 by non other than <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/jack-dorsey-leaving-twitter-sources\">then CEO Jack Dorsey</a>. Though, at the time, he had to use a third-party service to hack the feature into existence. </p><p>\"I used <a href=\"https://twitter.com/getvicarious\">@getvicarious</a> to create and sync a list of all accounts I&rsquo;m following, set that list to be reverse chron, named it 'Latest' and pinned it, and now I can quickly swipe between ranked (algorithm) and all tweets as they happen,\" Dorsey wrote at the time.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/jack/status/1425614093243846657\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>Twitter, unlike, until <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/instagram-chronological-timeline-option\">very recently</a>, <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/instagram-algorithm-explained\">Instagram</a>, has long recognized that timeliness is a virtue. It's what makes, and has always made, the app so powerful. This latest iOS update puts the reverse-chronological timeline front and center &mdash; helping to ease any confusion in users not as familiar with the app's previously buried timeline settings. </p><p>No longer will people need to wonder why they keeping seeing random tweets from accounts they <a href=\"https://help.twitter.com/en/using-twitter/twitter-timeline\">don't follow</a>, and of becoming an actor. Benton has a musical theatre background and played Eliza Hamilton in <i>Hamilton </i>in the the Broadway run of Lin-Manuel Miranda's musical after Phillipa Soo's departure from the cast.  </p><p>\"I dealt with a lot of self-doubt around not quite feeling I belonged, and stereotypes around what Black girls can and can't do and so I felt that my voice wasn't good enough, I was just judging myself,\" she explained. </p><p>In high school, when Benton did a performance of Verdi's opera <i>Aida</i>, she felt a burst of confidence that led to her telling her parents she wanted to go to drama 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Uber adds new fees to help drivers with high gas prices","link":"https://mashable.com/article/uber-fuel-surcharge-gas-prices","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00ghYxmTI7RD3suq4ODVCtI/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"The Uber logo in front of a graph with trend lines.\"><p>Ride-sharing behemoth Uber will institute <a href=\"https://www.uber.com/newsroom/new-fuel-surcharge/\">new surcharges</a> on Uber rides and Uber Eats deliveries to offset the high costs of gas for its drivers, the company announced Friday. </p><p>The addition of new fees is intended to address the financial pinch many drivers are facing with historically-high costs of fuel. Liza Winship, Uber&rsquo;s head of driver operations for the U.S. and Canada, said in the announcement that Uber was hoping to reduce this burden. </p><p>\"While earnings on our platform remain elevated compared to historical trends, the recent spike in gas prices has affected rideshare and delivery drivers,\" Winship wrote. Gas prices in the United States have hit <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2022/03/09/gas-prices-going-up-russia-ukraine/\">an average of $4.30</a>, breaking records set before the 2008 financial crisis. </p><p>So Uber, which doesn't cover the cost of gas for its drivers, is asking riders to pitch in. The exact cost of surcharges will depend on your location and state price increases, ranging from either $0.45 or $0.55 on Uber rides and either $0.35 or $0.45 on Uber Eats deliveries &mdash; 100 percent of the surcharge goes straight to the Uber driver, the company says. </p><p>The added fees will not apply to deliveries and rides originating in New York City, Uber also said, after the city recently <a href=\"https://www.engadget.com/nyc-gig-drivers-pay-increase-012304976.html\">increased the minimum pay</a> for drivers. The company also credits the high amount of bike deliveries there for its lack of surcharges. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/best-electric-vehicles\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            The best EVs for all different types of drivers\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/uber-rider-ratings\"><b>Uber reveals rider ratings breakdown for first time</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/joseph-gordon-levitt-colbert-travis-kalanick-heckler\"><b>Joseph Gordon-Levitt reacts to footage of Uber founder being heckled on 'Colbert'</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/uber-safety-features-route-change\"><b>Uber's new safety update detects if your route changes</b></a></p></li></ul><p>Many Uber drivers have expressed frustration with the company's decisions to place the offset costs on riders, saying the per-ride fees are too low to account for the many miles a single Uber ride or delivery can traverse (and the accompanying amount of gas used). </p><p>Ben Valdez, an Uber driver and ride share organizer, told <i>The Washington Post</i> that new surcharges <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2022/03/11/uber-gas-prices/\">wouldn't be enough</a> to actually help many drivers faced with increasing financial burdens, and explained that it would take at least 10 trips for the fees to offset a gallon of gas. Others online also criticized the company's refusal to take on the responsibility itself.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/faizsays/status/1502462582740840450?s=20&amp;t=1sJOamDjUpAwlF0al3MdtA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/salty_harrison/status/1502457052328710155?s=20&amp;t=NcPWnIZuLyDRWVFYex6B9Q\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/we_stan_dan/status/1502455373088772098?s=20&amp;t=OA0D5XcIYVzIdOWPMhFvWg\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>Beyond ride sharing, many drivers are now <a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2022-03-11/high-gas-prices-commuters\">considering alternatives</a> to combat the high prices. Appropriate public transportation is once again top of mind, with online communities offering advice for bike and <a href=\"https://www.wpbf.com/article/florida-gas-brightline-trirail-bike/39408737#\">transit alternatives</a> across the country. E-bike sales are also on the rise in <a href=\"https://www.nbcsandiego.com/news/local/record-gas-prices-helping-e-bike-sales-in-san-diego/2890158/\">some</a> <a href=\"https://www.foxla.com/news/e-bikes-as-an-alternative-to-cars-amid-rising-gas-prices\">cities</a>. And many Americans are once again considering the switch over to electronic vehicles. </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/STBikesKC/status/1501557313211092994?s=20&amp;t=1sJOamDjUpAwlF0al3MdtA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>Even the ride-sharing company is encouraging drivers to turn away from gas-powered transportation. The company once again touted its <u><a href=\"https://www.uber.com/us/en/drive/services/electric/?uclick_id=61d7643d-8c11-4f52-9703-7a09b8eb0d3a\">Green Future Program</a></u> in its surcharge announcement, which provides financial incentives to drivers of electric vehicles. The company also said it has negotiated discounts for drivers of certain EV models and exclusive deals on vehicle charging. And Uber has partnered with car rental company Hertz to encourage drivers to <a href=\"https://www.uber.com/us/en/drive/vehicle-solutions/hertz/tesla/\">rent Tesla models</a> rather than drive their own vehicles. </p><p>The surcharges will begin on March 16 and be in effect for at least 60 days, after which the company has said it will reassess the situation. </p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Mar 2022 16:20:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00ghYxmTI7RD3suq4ODVCtI/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"f8906e8b1527065c118d24cfc45ead08","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn49@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-902_03608537277101e0.webp","destWidth":5000,"destHeight":3363,"sourceBytes":1968460,"destBytes":1968460,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00ghYxmTI7RD3suq4ODVCtI/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn49@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-902_03608537277101e0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421754},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Apple's new iPad Air is on sale already","link":"https://mashable.com/deals/march-11-apple-ipad-air-2022","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03Bkzk2N8pxUpOoWGDgCeE4/hero-image.png\" alt=\"all colors of the new ipad air\"><p>The new Apple iPad Air (WiFi) is on sale at Walmart as of March 11:</p><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/Xlr3e\">64GB model</a> &mdash; +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03Bkzk2N8pxUpOoWGDgCeE4/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"d7e1acdcf03d39cde1fd446bfe551346","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn61@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-02-861_f33ca2f4dc4b98dc.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":505046,"destBytes":39374,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03Bkzk2N8pxUpOoWGDgCeE4/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn61@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-02-861_f33ca2f4dc4b98dc.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03Bkzk2N8pxUpOoWGDgCeE4/images-3.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn43@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-25-561_bb577c2255edddb8.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03Bkzk2N8pxUpOoWGDgCeE4/images-2.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn73@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-25-717_04da49c37f506889.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421757},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"The best Dyson Airwrap alternatives available for under £100","link":"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-dyson-airwrap-alternatives","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/03CPg7aDD3fL7UdOrdas2bh/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Person having their hair styled\"><p>If you somehow predicted that a company best known for its high-end <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-dyson-vacuums-uk\">vacuums</a> and <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-air-purifiers-uk\">air purifiers</a> would also wind up making the world's most coveted hair tool, please come collect your prize.</p><p>We're talking, of course, about Dyson and its legendary Airwrap. Launched in 2018, the multi-functional styler has since earned a cult following for its ability to dry, smooth, and curl without the use of extreme heat. Eight different brush and barrel attachments make it suitable for a range of different hair types and textures &mdash;&nbsp;plus, it comes with a sleek leather case for easy storage.</p><p>No blazing-hot plates, no blistering metal rods, and no need to head to the hairdressers for a bouncy hairdo anymore? If that all sounds too good to be true, it kind of is: The Airwrap is even more expensive than a <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/playstation-5-review\">PlayStation 5</a> and just as hard to find.</p><h2><b>Why is the Dyson Airwrap so popular?</b></h2><p>We'd love to tell you that the Airwrap is an overhyped gimmick so you could save your hard-earned money, unsubscribe from all of those restock email alerts, and finally close out the Stock Informer tab that's been pinned to your browser window for months. In fact, that's probably going to be the case if you're someone who doesn't go out of the way to style their hair every single day: The Airwrap has a semi-steep learning curve, it takes up a lot of space, and at the end of the day, it just isn't some miracle-worker for unruly tresses that can't be tamed by other gadgets, said Mashable tech reporter Rachel Kraus.</p><p>But believe it or not, there is an actual time and place for a &pound;450 hair tool. The Airwrap is designed for use on damp hair, so if you like getting ready right after you hop out of the shower, it'll fit effortlessly into your existing routine. If you're worried about frying your ends with daily styling, the Airwrap \"could just be your follicles' saving grace,\" noted Kraus. And if you're someone who frequently drops hundreds of pounds on professional styling, an Airwrap could actually save you money in the long run.</p><p>For her part, Kraus couldn't justify the price of the Airwrap despite it working <a href=\"https://mashable.com/review/dyson-airwrap-styler\">\"really, really well\"</a> on her hair. If you find yourself in a similar boat, it's time to explore some alternatives.</p><h2><b>What should you consider when shopping for an Dyson Airwrap alternative?</b></h2><p>First, a little bit more about the Airwrap itself. According to a <a href=\"https://www.dyson.com/newsroom/overview/features/january-2021/love-is-in-the-air\">press release</a>, its motor harnesses the power of an aerodynamic phenomenon called the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X1kQFJcKEaM\">Coanda effect</a>. This produces a spinning vortex of warm air, which attracts and automatically wraps hair around the Airwrap's barrel to gently dry while adding volume. All the while, an intelligent heat control system is measuring the device's temperature over 40 times a second to ensure it never ventures beyond 150&deg;C.</p><p>Dyson's engineers perfected this technology across about 500 prototypes, so as far as the Airwrap's design is concerned, it's safe to say there really is no exact match or fair comparison elsewhere on the market. That being said, you may be able to get similar results out of simpler tools (with a little practice) &mdash; namely, hot air brushes and certain <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-curling-irons-uk\">curling irons</a> and straighteners.</p><p>Start your search by pinpointing the top reason why you're drawn to the Airwrap in the first place, aside from the \"minimal heat damage\" thing, and pinpoint the device out there that specialises in that department. Once you've figured out what kind of tool will get you closest to your desired results, you can further narrow your search using the following criteria:</p><p><b>Power </b>&mdash;<b> </b>A styling tool's air-blowing power is typically measured in watts. Those with higher wattage will usually produce more heat than those on the lower end, meaning they work faster but can damage hair quickly if you're not careful. Most hot air brushes fall somewhere in the 1,000- to 2,000-watt range. (For comparison's sake, the Airwrap's 1,300-watt motor puts it just slightly below the average pro-quality hair dryer and makes it capable of taking tresses from wet-ish to ready in about 10 to 15 minutes.)</p><p><b>Multiple heat settings</b> &mdash; Any styling tool that forces you to scorch your hair on \"high\" the whole time is a no from us. Being able to choose from a few different temperature settings makes it way easier to avoid heat damage, especially at the end of your hair routine when you're already mostly dry. (Bonus points for any tools with a cool shot, which will seal your hair's cuticles and set the look in place.) Keep in mind that Airwrap has three airflow speeds and four heat settings, including a constant cold shot.</p><p><b>Cord length </b>&mdash; Professional-quality styling tools can have cords as long as 8 or 9 feet &mdash;&nbsp;the Airwrap's clocks in at 8.2 feet &mdash; but you can get away with a shorter one if there's an outlet right next to your vanity.</p><p><b>Weight </b>&mdash;<b> </b>You're going to be holding this thing above your head for a not-insignificant amount of time, so the lighter, the better.</p><p>No matter what kind of device you wind up buying, even if it's an actual Airwrap, consider adding some styling products to your cart while you're at it, too. Dyson itself recommends using <a href=\"https://www.dyson.com/hair-care/hair-stylers/airwrap/how-to-use\">hairspray</a> to \"maximize curls' longevity\" and a <a href=\"https://www.dyson.com/knowledge/hair-care/how-does-heat-damage-hair\">heat protectant</a> \"whenever possible.\" (It can only help.) And for extra volume, its Global Lead Stylist Amy Johnson <a href=\"https://www.dyson.com/newsroom/overview/features/december-2021/christmas-styling-tips-us\">suggests</a> applying a mousse to your roots while your hair is still wet.</p><h2><b>What is the best Dyson Airwrap alternative?</b></h2><p>We've searched high and low for the best Dyson Airwrap alternatives, and lined up a strong selection of your best options. There should be something for everyone here, with all these dupes available for under &pound;100. You just need to consider everything listed below and pick a favourite.</p><p>These are the best Dyson Airwrap alternatives in 2022.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Mar 2022 04:55:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/03CPg7aDD3fL7UdOrdas2bh/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"56ff89eeadc774efebeac9c53cd1d336","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn7@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-03-169_3e179dadd14983d6.webp","destWidth":6000,"destHeight":3892,"sourceBytes":874994,"destBytes":874994,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/03CPg7aDD3fL7UdOrdas2bh/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn7@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-03-169_3e179dadd14983d6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421782},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Save 52% on this cat toy that helps entertain and exercise your furry friend","link":"https://mashable.com/deals/march-13-interactive-balance-feather-cat-toy","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04nloW9ZdLZmq7QeHIOV6Nn/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Orange tabby cat with red scarf looking up\"><p><b>TL;DR: </b>As of March 13, this <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/6wWMd\">Interactive Balance Feather Cat Toy</a> is on sale for $18.99, which is 52% off its regular price of $39.</p><hr><p>When you bring a cat or kitten home for the first time, you can't just let it free in your home and expect it to adjust on its own. 09:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04nloW9ZdLZmq7QeHIOV6Nn/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"24546324b00469a6fb17601b9093584b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn74@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-05-433_6a5351556e9e5076.webp","destWidth":3744,"destHeight":2106,"sourceBytes":2755721,"destBytes":2274570,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04nloW9ZdLZmq7QeHIOV6Nn/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn74@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-05-433_6a5351556e9e5076.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04nloW9ZdLZmq7QeHIOV6Nn/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn15@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-25-226_d62e76e90a7ad126.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421744},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"The best camping hammocks for your next outdoor excursion","link":"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-camping-hammocks","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/07F1W5VJY4gJefxyOOTz4vF/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Two people sitting in a hammock near a lake\"><p>There's nothing quite like hanging out in a hammock at the campsite. Imagine sitting in the woods in a hammock, cold drink in hand, surrounded by a bunch of friends. Immaculate vibes.</p><p>While most camping folks opt for hammocks to lounge in during the day and then move to their tent when it's time to sleep, hammocks can actually be a space-efficient way to snooze in the outdoors &mdash; if you know what you're looking for. Most regular hammocks aren't comfortable enough to sleep in all night, and hammocks designed specifically for camping will have a lot of extra bells and whistles that will keep you cozy all night long. </p><p>Whether you're backpacking, car camping, or just hanging outside for a few hours, we have all the best recommendations. Skip to the bottom to read about the hammocks we've tested and researched, or read on to learn about all the features you should look for in a camping hammock before you buy.</p><h2><b>What to keep in mind when shopping for a camping hammock</b></h2><ul><li><p><b>What are you going to use your hammock for? </b>This is the main thing to address before you add a hammock to your online shopping cart. If you're planning on using a hammock to hang out at base camp, read a book, or maybe take a nap, you won't need to worry as much about an included rainfly, bug net, and other comfort-focused features. If you want to ditch your camping tent in favor of a hammock though, these features will become a lot more important. While some dedicated backpackers will opt to sleep in a hammock with no rain or bug coverage, most casual campers will appreciate the extra bug net and rainfly. </p></li><li><p><b>Weight:</b> Whether you&rsquo;re hiking or driving to your campsite, it&rsquo;s important to look for a hammock that won&rsquo;t weigh you down. If you&rsquo;re used to lugging a 20-pound air mattress on car camping trips, an average two-pound hammock shouldn&rsquo;t matter, but if you're backpacking, every ounce counts.</p></li><li><p><b>How small can it pack down:</b> Likewise, if you&rsquo;re planning on bringing your hammock on a hike, you&rsquo;ll want to look for one that can pack down pretty small. Most hammocks have the capacity to pack down into about the size of a football or smaller, and many have integrated stuff sacks.</p></li><li><p><b>Weight capacity:</b> Consider what kind of camping you plan on doing. If you&rsquo;re going with your kids or a significant other, you may want to look for a hammock that can support more weight so you can comfortably hang out in one hammock. </p></li><li><p><b>Suspension system:</b> If you want a fast, easy setup and takedown, hammocks with no-knot suspension systems are a must. These often have to be purchased separately from the actual hammock, but they have the ability to cut your setup time down to just a few minutes and can allow you to set your hammock up on trees that would normally be too far apart. These no-knot systems can also protect trees, whereas rope suspension systems may damage bark on trees. Using rope as suspension is cheaper (and sometimes rope is included with hammocks) but you need to know how to tie knots really well if you want to string your hammock up that way.</p></li><li><p><b>Comfort: </b>While comfort is subjective, we recommend always investing in a high quality hammock that includes suspension straps and carabiners to keep you secure. If you're planning on sleeping in your hammock overnight, a structural ridge line and the ability to lie flat are important, too.</p></li><li><p><b>Bug net: </b>If you&rsquo;re particularly sensitive to insect bites or you know you&rsquo;ll be frequently camping in an area dense with mosquitos, you may want to consider looking into a built-in bug net. External netting is also available but can be more of a hassle to set up.</p></li><li><p><b>Rainfly:</b> When forgoing the tent in favor of a hammock, it's best to be safe and keep a rainfly handy. A rainfly isn't just good for when it's raining &mdash; it''ll also keep condensation, bugs, and foliage off of you while you sleep. Even if you don't end up using it, you'll be glad you have it.</p></li></ul><p>With that in mind, we&rsquo;ve pulled together some of the absolute best camping hammocks you can buy. Whether you&rsquo;re looking for something that&rsquo;ll take you through all four seasons, or you really just want something that&rsquo;s quick and easy to assemble and take down, these are the hammocks you&rsquo;ll actually want to hang out in.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 18:17:55 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/07F1W5VJY4gJefxyOOTz4vF/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"ec717f5bcd66498f0d0be466965ccec3","destWidth":1500,"destHeight":1500,"sourceBytes":462137,"destBytes":492950,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/07F1W5VJY4gJefxyOOTz4vF/hero-image.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421757},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Learn to code from home with this online bootcamp on sale for under $30","link":"https://mashable.com/deals/march-12-coding-bootcamp","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02OBtHor04NeSYguhdREcRj/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Child at computer showing coding screen\"><p><b>TL;DR: </b>As of March 12, <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/jBjrv\">The Coding 101 Bootcamp Beginners Bundle</a> &mdash;&nbsp;worth $2,000 &mdash; is just $29, which means you can get it for 98% off.</p><hr><p>The perfect time to learn to code may never arise, but the need for coders will always be there. With lifetime access on both desktop and mobile, you can work your way through all 10 courses completely at your own pace.</p><p>If you're feeling brave, you can kick things off with an introduction to C++, which is one of the most requested job skills in the coding industry, yet one of the <a href=\"https://www.bitdegree.org/tutorials/most-in-demand-programming-languages/\">hardest skills</a> to learn. This course allows you to start from the ground up by conquering the basics and tackling hands-on projects, where you'll learn how to manipulate data so you can control your own programs and keep your code language clean and legible.&nbsp;</p><p>From there, you can move on to courses on Git and Github, where you'll learn how to troubleshoot broken code and collaborate with others. The rest of the courses cover popular programs such as MongoDB, Node.js, Express, HTML, CSS, and more. Figuring out which coding language or style is for you (if any) starts with dabbling a little in each option on the market. And this 13-hour bootcamp can help you find your place.</p><p>Over 1 million people have turned to Zenva to learn the latest up-to-date skills on coding and programming and have used their knowledge to land competitive full-time jobs in the industry. You can use this bootcamp as a launchpad into more in-depth coding education or just to get a grip on the tech world and try your hand at a new skill.</p><p>Valued at $2,000, you can sign up for this beginner coding bootcamp for just <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/jBjrv\">$29</a>.</p><p><i>Prices subject to change.</i></p><p></p><div class=\"max-w-3xl mx-auto mb-16 font-sans flex flex-col mt-8 10:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02OBtHor04NeSYguhdREcRj/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"b0ca1d34c57e7d475f1ea2f746e748af","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn66@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-02-502_c5569765618dba65.webp","destWidth":3500,"destHeight":1969,"sourceBytes":401070,"destBytes":401070,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02OBtHor04NeSYguhdREcRj/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn66@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-02-502_c5569765618dba65.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02OBtHor04NeSYguhdREcRj/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn77@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-25-383_3b553e42599e0fed.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421782},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"YouTube removes NELK Boys interview of Donald Trump for election misinformation, Trump responds","link":"https://mashable.com/article/youtube-removes-trump-interview-nelk-boys-full-send-podcast","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/026KMKhaC9MinR9CRHpJju1/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Donald Trump at CPAC 2022\"><p>Have you seen that <u><a href=\"https://twitter.com/RonFilipkowski/status/1501733405423251456\">viral clip</a></u> of Donald Trump talking to a few podcasters about the future of Ukraine and somehow going off on a tangent about windmills?</p><p>If you wanted to check out the whole video interview on YouTube, you can't.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/RonFilipkowski/status/1501733405423251456\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>The <i>Full Send Podcast'</i>s full video interview of former president Trump has been <u><a href=\"https://twitter.com/fullsendpodcast/status/1502105349221806081\">removed</a></u> from YouTube for violating the platform's community guidelines on misinformation. While the interview touched upon a wide range of topics, it seems that Trump's continued lies about the 2020 presidential election resulted in the takedown of the video.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/fullsendpodcast/status/1502105349221806081\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>\"We removed this video for violating our <u><a href=\"https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/10835034?hl=en\">election integrity policy</a></u>, which prohibits content containing false claims that widespread fraud changed the outcome of the 2020 U.S. presidential election,\" said a YouTube spokesperson in a statement provided to Mashable. \"We allow content with sufficient <u><a href=\"https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/10835034?hl=en#zippy=%2Celection-integrity\">educational, documentary, scientific or artistic context</a></u>, which the video we removed did not provide.\"</p><p>Shortly after the video was taken down, Trump put out a statement comparing the YouTube video takedown to Russia's censorship of its war in Ukraine.</p><p>\"Whatever happened to free speech in our Country?,\" reads Trump's statement, later acknowledging the issue YouTube had was with his discussion of what he called the \"Rigged 2020 Presidential Election.\" (Note: The election was <u><a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/voter-fraud-election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-7fcb6f134e528fee8237c7601db3328f\">not rigged</a></u>. President Joe Biden won the 2020 presidential election.)</p><p>\"Incredibly, but not surprisingly, the Big Tech lunatics have taken down my interview with the very popular NELK Boys so that nobody can watch it or in any way listen to it,\" Trump continued. \"In Russia, the people are not allowed to know that they&rsquo;re fighting a war with Ukraine, that&rsquo;s where our media is going, and that&rsquo;s where our Country is going because it quickly follows&mdash;just study history.\"</p><p>The Trump interview was hosted by the popular YouTubers known as the NELK Boys. The group is known for their viral prank videos and have over 7.2 million subscribers on their main YouTube channel. The NELK Boys also have a video podcast channel called the <i>Full Send Podcast</i>.&nbsp;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/KyleForgeard/status/1502097526295437312\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>While the channel is usually known for its interviews with celebrities, online influencers, and UFC stars, the <i>Full Send Podcast</i> found itself getting extra political with its Trump interview.</p><p>According to host Kyle Forgeard, the Trump interview had <u><a href=\"https://twitter.com/KyleForgeard/status/1502097526295437312\">received</a></u> more than 5 million views within 24 hours before YouTube pulled the video.</p><p>Following the removal of the video, Trump supporters encouraged the NELK Boys to upload the full interview to the conservative alternative platform, <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/what-is-rumble-video\">Rumble</a>. However, it seems those requests have been denied. The YouTubers are now hosting the full interview on its Full Send website, hosted by the video service Vimeo.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 19:21:55 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/026KMKhaC9MinR9CRHpJju1/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"5e239a6d0d9c7c518438f8c1aad024df","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn64@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-01-978_96f486f35ef0876e.webp","destWidth":3000,"destHeight":2000,"sourceBytes":885922,"destBytes":885922,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/026KMKhaC9MinR9CRHpJju1/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn64@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-01-978_96f486f35ef0876e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421756},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Doors or wheels? TikTok wants to know.","link":"https://mashable.com/article/wheels-doors-debate-twitter-tiktok","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03S9VjFfN7IAJNqCaCgPvRx/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Three examples of the wheels v. doors craze\"><p>Confused why you are seeing #TeamDoor and #TeamWheel content all over your FYP? We've got you covered.&nbsp;</p><h2>New internet debate unlocked</h2><p>Wheels vs. Doors is the latest debate to consume the internet &mdash; following in the viral footsteps of <a href=\"https://www.buzzfeed.com/catesish/help-am-i-going-insane-its-definitely-blue\">The Dress</a> and \"<a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/yanny-laurel-audio-hearing-ear-damage\">Yanny or Laurel</a>?\" As with most things on TikTok, the discussion suddenly overtook my FYP this week without any context, and I am not alone. There are dozens of videos of TikTokkers humorously asking where this whole debate came from. A video from <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@bridgetmacfarlane/video/7072679299672706305?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESPgo8nYIGDz4Z0%2BybYrOKwFKrUQaEJK0d8IP7IoVNCaQxu9X3lHyEk%2FrqqiI8aLoKJGD6aukEB4sZ%2FIxsD4eEGgA%3D&amp;_r=1&amp;checksum=6c415043295f16c8867c2da6a3e50a8324620e11f3177be129e8e2b1efdc3082&amp;language=en&amp;preview_pb=0&amp;sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAA5ogRMOQX4rOFFayWRghl_L_oQf16u_uBb6baNXt5U481lcWKwEe4rPTaQ7UyGuLz&amp;share_app_id=1233&amp;share_item_id=7072679299672706305&amp;share_link_id=1B9FED98-E063-469E-8946-C8940884BF7E&amp;social_sharing=v4&amp;source=h5_m&amp;timestamp=1646947259&amp;tt_from=copy&amp;u_code=dbc5egfhh6c7hb&amp;user_id=6805200946390598661&amp;utm_campaign=client_share&amp;utm_medium=ios&amp;utm_source=copy\">@bridgetmacfarlane</a> sums it up nicely: \"opening TikTok on a random Tuesday arvo and ur entire feed is people debating whether there&rsquo;s more doors than wheels in the world and if there&rsquo;s more chairs than people.\"</p><p>According to <u><a href=\"https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/wheels-vs-doors\">KnowYourMeme</a></u>, the debate originated on Twitter (naturally). On March 4, @NewYorkNixon posted the now infamous Twitter poll asking, \"Do you think there are more doors or wheels in the world?\" A little over 230,000 accounts voted in the poll &mdash; 46.4 percent voted for doors, and 53.6 perfect for wheels.&nbsp;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/NewYorkNixon/status/1500000428985286657?s=20&amp;t=xqNuus3ApJER5MvCNJwvFw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>The conversation migrated over to TikTok where users are vehemently arguing their cases. The tag \"doorsorwheels\" has over 25 million views, and \"teamdoor\" and \"teamwheel\" have 6 million and 44 million views, respectively. Based on the hashtags alone, Team Wheel seems to be the clear winner, but TikTok isn't known for its nuanced takes. For many TikTok <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@krabbypatti8/video/7073103962601196843?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESPgo89FXcEbrbGlAI%2B4PZHit3wJrdXjcmqguhQxaoro1NK9GEg6ibRlPcl7U0FAXJfQNppr4I8CPX3aubAgFlGgA%3D&amp;_r=1&amp;checksum=45512d8b25b2a06d758a7fb2f474995f5db4231dd87dae60069c489615c47ce8&amp;language=en&amp;preview_pb=0&amp;sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAA5ogRMOQX4rOFFayWRghl_L_oQf16u_uBb6baNXt5U481lcWKwEe4rPTaQ7UyGuLz&amp;share_app_id=1233&amp;share_item_id=7073103962601196843&amp;share_link_id=83808545-9AAE-42A8-A2A5-B621C36699CB&amp;social_sharing=v4&amp;source=h5_m&amp;timestamp=1646947150&amp;tt_from=copy&amp;u_code=dbc5egfhh6c7hb&amp;user_id=6805200946390598661&amp;utm_campaign=client_share&amp;utm_medium=ios&amp;utm_source=copy\">users</a>, the number of wheels in a room with only one door is evidence enough for \"wheel supremacy.\" Some users, like <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@koowaluh/video/7072814056603716910?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESPgo8ZnR8STMekwgeE%2BuzkB7DYEh4%2FHC%2FhlDBnjqtAGisnfD1UB06O4x42H5zmAMQPSm6zFH5VVslAKK0o%2BeIGgA%3D&amp;_r=1&amp;checksum=1be0825dba5658eb06b8229af93c1cb4f7fb1b11305a1b5c3acbee5d97d0d14b&amp;language=en&amp;preview_pb=0&amp;sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAA5ogRMOQX4rOFFayWRghl_L_oQf16u_uBb6baNXt5U481lcWKwEe4rPTaQ7UyGuLz&amp;share_app_id=1233&amp;share_item_id=7072814056603716910&amp;share_link_id=E3E43E9D-64DC-4E8E-A927-BD9EC8F3E475&amp;social_sharing=v4&amp;source=h5_m&amp;timestamp=1646947093&amp;tt_from=copy&amp;u_code=dbc5egfhh6c7hb&amp;user_id=6805200946390598661&amp;utm_campaign=client_share&amp;utm_medium=ios&amp;utm_source=copy\">@koowaluh</a>, are even producing multi-part <i>math</i> videos<i> </i>to argue their case.&nbsp;</p><p>I never thought I&rsquo;d say this, but I would take <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/euphoria-season-2-memes\">inescapable </a><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/euphoria-season-2-memes\"><i>Euphoria </i></a><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/euphoria-season-2-memes\">memes</a> over a numbers-based debate any day.&nbsp;</p><h2>\"Gangnam Style\" is back</h2><p>Bet you never thought you'd see the day when Psy's 2012 satirical smash hit became relevant again, but 10 years later, the internet's love for \"Gangnam Style\" is still going strong. TikTokker <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@koozebane/video/7015307118110641413?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESPgo8WwU9pbYsG%2B5aLRA7lPCtanrW1h18OTAW%2FjZCFp4fZomWHlxDn6mead2YosKUhDc2oyHmJLUQ8nXlcblsGgA%3D&amp;_r=1&amp;checksum=d79a5d12dfd366f86cb4dfb7d56467b1b5e41ed84725d79f5788054a3c551b43&amp;language=en&amp;preview_pb=0&amp;sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAA5ogRMOQX4rOFFayWRghl_L_oQf16u_uBb6baNXt5U481lcWKwEe4rPTaQ7UyGuLz&amp;share_app_id=1233&amp;share_item_id=7015307118110641413&amp;share_link_id=AD886186-14AA-4C6B-8214-DA4313AFAFD5&amp;social_sharing=v4&amp;source=h5_m&amp;timestamp=1646947921&amp;tt_from=copy&amp;u_code=dbc5egfhh6c7hb&amp;user_id=6805200946390598661&amp;utm_campaign=client_share&amp;utm_medium=ios&amp;utm_source=copy\">@koozebane</a> made a groovy mash-up of \"Gangnam Style\"<i> </i>and Steve Lacy's <i>N Side</i>. It's become the soundtrack to a truly bizarre text-based trend on the app. The sound has been used in over 280,000 videos so far.&nbsp;</p><p>Users share the benign beginnings of a story before revealing the shocking ending using the \"Image Spin\" effect, which encloses a line of text in six hexagons that dance around on the screen. This messy trend has TikTokkers telling their juiciest stories, and I'm personally here for it. Take <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@shaylamherrington/video/7070302913834274090?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESPgo8oHsKtM186rX76UBB%2BVEByxoSVwyS1w36RxJoKMq%2B%2BE%2FdlvzxcCU%2FMFZGcL%2BhDrF4lfzQWpx6z6p3Jyo2GgA%3D&amp;_r=1&amp;checksum=630f25a8694071e44821420b246e6c2411fded6a092585438c384cd4e1dec878&amp;language=en&amp;preview_pb=0&amp;sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAA5ogRMOQX4rOFFayWRghl_L_oQf16u_uBb6baNXt5U481lcWKwEe4rPTaQ7UyGuLz&amp;share_app_id=1233&amp;share_item_id=7070302913834274090&amp;share_link_id=680C0315-633C-4278-9C2E-39651E7778BA&amp;social_sharing=v4&amp;source=h5_m&amp;timestamp=1646950325&amp;tt_from=copy&amp;u_code=dbc5egfhh6c7hb&amp;user_id=6805200946390598661&amp;utm_campaign=client_share&amp;utm_medium=ios&amp;utm_source=copy\">@shaylamherrington</a>'s video as an example. It reads, \"Nobody can find the groom. What if he wrecked on his way here?!\" Then the Image Spin says, \"The Groom hooking up with the bride's mom in the parking lot.\"&nbsp;</p><div class=\"max-w-3xl mx-auto mt-8\">\n                    <div class=\"mb-4\"></div>\n                <div class=\"flex flex-col space-y-4 md:flex-row md:space-x-4 md:space-y-0\">\n            <div class=\"w-full md:w-1/2\">\n                                                    <img style=\"width:100%;\" class=\"w-full border border-gray-100\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03S9VjFfN7IAJNqCaCgPvRx/images-1.fit_lim.size_376x.png\" alt=\"The described TikTok.\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"750\" height=\"1334\">\n                    <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n                                                    <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">To have been at this wedding! </span>\n                                                                            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: TikTok / shaylaherrington</span>\n                                            </div>\n                            </div>\n            <div class=\"w-full md:w-1/2\">\n                                                    <img class=\"w-full border border-gray-100\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03S9VjFfN7IAJNqCaCgPvRx/images-2.fit_lim.size_376x.png\" alt=\"The described TikTok. \" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"750\" height=\"1334\">\n                    <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n                                                                            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: TikTok / shaylaherrington</span>\n                                            </div>\n                            </div>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>The dizzying combination of \"Gangnam Style,\" the Image Spin effect, and drama makes for a wildly entertaining trend.&nbsp;</p><h2>\"Get your fucking ass up and work\"</h2><p>In a viral clip from the Kardashians' interview with <i>Variety</i>, Kim shares her best (and entirely tone deaf) advice for women in business. \"Get your fucking ass up and work,\" she says. \"It seems like no one wants to work these days.\"</p><p><i>Variety </i>posted the interview snippet to <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Variety/status/1501611270843166720?s=20&amp;t=Z9135TRtjSdWBvFt5q5zVg\">Twitter</a> and <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@varietymagazine/video/7073128967535922475?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESPgo8uZWC4nom8TYW8q5xw8A0F3KshO5ISmXVZYcJP%2FBFBf2431pc5B03haRHx9kkDJtFO%2By%2BjTxkILanK%2F6KGgA%3D&amp;_r=1&amp;checksum=84f4d779f1fada85d865c456afceb4604e90d43bf59f5c3b13c2f799d8967c1d&amp;language=en&amp;preview_pb=0&amp;sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAA5ogRMOQX4rOFFayWRghl_L_oQf16u_uBb6baNXt5U481lcWKwEe4rPTaQ7UyGuLz&amp;share_app_id=1233&amp;share_item_id=7073128967535922475&amp;share_link_id=0A892457-7967-4C19-9E11-CE99E516C2A4&amp;social_sharing=v4&amp;source=h5_m&amp;timestamp=1646950667&amp;tt_from=copy&amp;u_code=dbc5egfhh6c7hb&amp;user_id=6805200946390598661&amp;utm_campaign=client_share&amp;utm_medium=ios&amp;utm_source=copy\">TikTok</a> on Wednesday (March 9), and Kardashian immediately faced backlash for her advice. She's now gotten the TikTok treatment, with people using the audio ironically to describe people in their own lives. As user <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@exhibitionbuffalo/video/7073303295288282370?_d=secCgYIASAHKAESPgo8neOAL9DXvJcPdmmJNle1uKesNos6PDsInMjF%2BreDbcAnUXCwYbNOqWsl7X%2FDFmJuUGOxjb5hnG5vzbr1GgA%3D&amp;_r=1&amp;checksum=f884ff518ead3c7cb374bf39626ccf41a3cb8c28adf0704c0d27500efb46565e&amp;language=en&amp;preview_pb=0&amp;sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAA5ogRMOQX4rOFFayWRghl_L_oQf16u_uBb6baNXt5U481lcWKwEe4rPTaQ7UyGuLz&amp;share_app_id=1233&amp;share_item_id=7073303295288282370&amp;share_link_id=A86FBB11-4F27-4CDA-BEE5-F791D1E6D896&amp;social_sharing=v4&amp;source=h5_m&amp;timestamp=1646950760&amp;tt_from=copy&amp;u_code=dbc5egfhh6c7hb&amp;user_id=6805200946390598661&amp;utm_campaign=client_share&amp;utm_medium=ios&amp;utm_source=copy\">@exhibitionbuffalo</a> says, \"my dad when I'm depressed and can't get out of bed.\" (Unfortunately, gym TikTok is using Kardashian's quote sincerely... which is not the vibe.) </p><p>So far there are about 3,000 videos
