posted to the sound, and it has the potential to become even more popular over the weekend.&nbsp;This isn't the first time a member of the Kardashian family has had their moment on TikTok, and it certainly won't be the last.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/tiktok-trend-adele-water-under-the-bridge\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Sorry Adele, you've officially become a TikTok trend\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 16:23:45 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03S9VjFfN7IAJNqCaCgPvRx/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"7107302754725e9d970d291a84a2ef90","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn20@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-02-019_4310849b1eba2f30.webp","destWidth":2010,"destHeight":1252,"sourceBytes":574670,"destBytes":574670,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03S9VjFfN7IAJNqCaCgPvRx/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn20@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-02-019_4310849b1eba2f30.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03S9VjFfN7IAJNqCaCgPvRx/images-1.fit_lim.size_376x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn36@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-25-565_2d24580f294730fb.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03S9VjFfN7IAJNqCaCgPvRx/images-2.fit_lim.size_376x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn95@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-26-241_0d02efe1b932020a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421761},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"‘The Adam Project’ review: A flashy time travel adventure with an all-star cast","link":"https://mashable.com/article/the-adam-project-review","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"An adult man and young boy smile at each other, backlit by sunlight and the silhouettes of trees; still from \" the adam project.><p>Ryan Reynolds broke the rules.</p><p>In the first act of Netflix's <i>The Adam Project</i>, Reynolds as the titular Adam explains to his younger self that he traveled back in time to find his wife. The younger Adam (Walker Scobell) is shocked that he would risk his life, not to mention the space-time continuum, all for a girl.</p><p>\"You might feel different when you meet her,\" Reynolds all but deadpans. It's arrogant, dismissive, and a bit of a copout that saves the film having to explain its in-universe physics. It also works.</p><p>That's the general formula of Shawn Levy's sci-fi caper, written by Jonathan Tropper, T.S. Nowlin, Jennifer Flackett, and Mark Levin. Plot holes and worldbuilding take a backseat to charming performances and entertaining visuals that make this neat 100-movie worth a watch.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951145.jpg\" alt='A young boy speaks to an adult man nursing a bullet wound in a still from \"The Adam Project.\"' srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646951145.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646951145.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951145.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1117\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Young Adam is shocked to learn that he will grow up to be hot.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Doane Gregory / Netflix</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>The story is simple &mdash; perhaps too simple. Between now and 2050, time travel is invented, implemented, and abused. Adult Adam (Reynolds) travels back from the future to stop time travel ever being discovered and to save his wife Laura (Zoe Saldana) &mdash; with the help of his 12-year-old self (Scobell).</p><p>Scobell is a sheer delight in his feature debut, if anything impeded by the demand to recreate Reynolds' signature snark with that incongruously sweet countenance. His Reynolds impression is also excellent, so this is not a critique so much as regret that we'll have to wait for yet another role to showcase Scobell independently. Surrounded by adult A-listers, he exudes the presence and conviction of a seasoned star (again, maybe imitating Reynolds &mdash; and again, not a bad thing).</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/the-batman-review\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            'The Batman' Review: A crime-thriller suffocated by PG-13 demands\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>Reynolds brings the aforementioned snark, albeit nowhere near <i>Deadpool</i> levels and tempered with moving moments Adam shares with his mother (Jennifer Garner), father (Mark Ruffalo), and younger self. He and Saldana make the most of their limited shared screen time, selling a time-torn romance that at least one of them thinks is worth dooming the rest of humanity. Catherine Keener is mesmerizing but underutilized as the villainous Sorian, hunting Adam and Laura with the dangerous composure of someone who knows they never lose.</p><p>With Levy's sensibilities at the helm, <i>The Adam Project</i>'s visuals are vibrant and dynamic, even with the specter of dystopia in our future. The aircraft and weaponry are sleek but not distracting. People do not bruise or bleed in this universe &mdash; except Reynolds in an early scene meant to underscore his physical attractiveness &mdash; but instead burst into chaotic prisms of light and color when they die outside of their own timeline. The low point is a needlessly de-aged Keener, intended to look 30 years younger but also deeply uncanny. Sometimes we can just cast younger actors or ignore the laws of aging.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951145.jpg\" alt='Close up of actors Zoe Saldana and Ryan Reynolds with their foreheads together in a still from \"The Adam Project.\"' srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646951145.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646951145.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951145.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"954\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Rooting for them so hard.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Netflix</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p><i>The Adam Project</i> succeeds by not bogging down a strong emotional core with too much sci-fi minutiae. We don't know why time travel was invented or what its purpose was before it got corrupted, nor do we know what went so wrong that adult Adam says of <i>The Terminator</i>: \"That's 2050 on a good day.\"</p><p>And crucially, we don't care. This is the story of a boy and his parents, a man and his wife, in which people sometimes zip through time and burst into colorful bubbles. Garner's scenes showcase the maternal warmth here she executed so well in <i>Juno</i>, here worn on her sleeve with remarkable vulnerability. She and Ruffalo tap into their winsome <i>13 Going on 30</i> chemistry like no time has passed, and his role as father to the two Adams wonderfully anchors the film's final act and emotional climax. These relationships give <i>The Adam Project</i> a strong foundation even if its genre elements have more flourish than depth, the way <i>Stranger Things</i> first struck such a chord with audiences by focusing on a separated mother and son.</p><p>Levy's love of '80s sci-fi is apparent. With this latest, he's on track to create a nostalgic sub-genre that will inform its own generation of film nerds &mdash; as long as we don't invent time travel. </p><p><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/search?q=the%20adam%20project&amp;jbv=81309354\"><i>The Adam Project</i></a><a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/search?q=the%20adam%20project&amp;jbv=81309354\"> is now streaming on Netflix</a>.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"3cc784bde36490f37ecd75d9d6829f56","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn75@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-02-731_8a1db32c26d94d47.webp","destWidth":1921,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":984865,"destBytes":458724,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn75@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-02-731_8a1db32c26d94d47.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951145.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn97@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-26-022_b8f090f82cb940c7.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03AV8JRgl2WZS4g31vFbwKq/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951145.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn65@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-25-459_0fc2ab4b2ad06b8b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421763},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"14 of the best 'Wordle' clones, because one word a day isn't enough","link":"https://mashable.com/article/best-wordle-clones-alternatives","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Image of phones with Wordle screen open\"><p>If you've spent any time on the internet lately, you know that <i>Wordle</i> has taken over. </p><p>Our obsession has been endlessly <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/wordle-word-game-what-is-it-explained\">analyzed</a> and dissected. We've shared <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/wordle-tips-tricks\">strategies and tips</a>. It has been <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/wordle-memes-twitter\">meme</a>-ed and shared all over Twitter. It was even <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/new-york-times-buys-wordle\">bought</a> by the <i>New York Times</i>. And of course our insatiable appetite for the simple puzzle game has been the catalyst for multiple Wordle clones. Here's a roundup of our favorites.</p><h2>1. <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/absurdle-harder-wordle-game\"><i>Absurdle</i></a></h2><p>If <i>Wordle</i> isn't enough of a challenge, this one will have you stumped. It's even hard to understand how it works, but a previous Mashable article breaks it down: \"Instead of starting with a secret word that players work their way towards, <i>Absurdle</i> doesn't have a single word up its sleeve,\" Sam Haysom explains. \"The game starts with 2,315 possibilities and responds to each of your guesses by keeping the maximum number of potential secret words in its back pocket, forcing you to narrow its options down until you essentially trap the AI into only having one word left.\" Truly diabolical. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-7.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643907301.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of absurdle\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-7.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643907301.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-7.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643907301.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-7.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643907301.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1455\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">For those who just want to watch the world burn.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: qntm / Absurdle</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>2. <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/dordle-double-wordle-game\"><i>Dordle</i></a><i>,</i> <a href=\"https://www.quordle.com/#/\"><i>Quordle</i></a><i>,</i> <a href=\"https://octordle.com/\"><i>Octordle</i></a>, and<i> </i><a href=\"http://www.sedecordle.com/\"><i>Sedecordle</i></a></h2><p>First there was <i>Dordle</i> which is playing two words at the same time. But the one-upmanship didn't stop there. Instead the clones multiplied at a feverish pace. Next came <i>Quordle</i>, which is four words, then <i>Octordle</i>, which is eight, and now we actually have <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/wordle-variant-dordle-31-untrigintordle\"><i>Sedecordle</i></a> which is playing 16 words at the same time. Utter chaos.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643902470.jpg\" alt=\"screenshot of Dordle board\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643902470.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643902470.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643902470.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1872\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">For the ambidextrous mind.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Dordle / Zaratustra Productions</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>3. <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/lewdle-wordle-dirty-version\"><i>Lewdle</i></a></h2><p>It was only a matter of time before someone came up with a NSFW version of <i>Wordle</i>. For those of us who instinctively jump to an inappropriate five-letter word, welcome to <i>Lewdle</i>, you need not get your mind out of the gutter. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643902470.png\" alt=\"screenshot of lewdle board\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643902470.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643902470.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643902470.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">A safe space to act out your 'Wordle' fantasies. </span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Lewdle</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>4. <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/wordle-primel-game\"><i>Primel</i></a> </h2><p>This is technically a game, but for the mathematically-challenged, it's an instrument of torture. With <i>Primel</i>, the goal is to guess a five-digit prime number instead of a five-letter word. The mere thought of a five-digit prime number is panic-inducing, but to each their own.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643903551.png\" alt=\"screenshot of primel board\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-3.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643903551.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-3.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643903551.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643903551.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1408\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">I already hate this.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Primel / Onverged.Yt</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>5. <a href=\"https://sweardle.com/\"><i>Sweardle</i></a> </h2><p>Similar to <i>Lewdle</i>, <i>Sweardle</i> zeroes in on the human tendency to be inappropriate. The major difference is that it uses four-letter words instead of five. It may sound easy, but you'll soon realize that the the lexicon of colorful language is quite extensive.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643904381.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of sweardle board\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-4.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643904381.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-4.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643904381.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643904381.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1525\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Nailed it.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Sweardle </span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>6. <a href=\"https://queerdle.com/\"><i>Queerdle</i></a></h2><p>Self-described as the \"yassification of wordle,\" <i>Queerdle </i>challenges your knowledge of LGBTQ+ vocabulary. Everything is basically the same as the original <i>Wordle</i>, except the words vary between four and eight letters and is sometimes two words. Why? \"Because queerness can't be contained,\" according to the instructions by creator Jordan Bouvier.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-5.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643906050.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of queerdle board\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-5.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643906050.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-5.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643906050.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-5.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643906050.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1534\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Queerdle also takes suggestions for new LGBTQ+ words to include.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Queerdle / Jordan Bouvier</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>7.<a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/taylor-swift-wordle-taylordle\"><i>Taylordle</i></a> </h2><p>Making a <i>Wordle</i> clone is now becoming requisite for any stan community. And Swifties are nothing if not the ultimate stans. Using the same rules as the original, <i>Taylordle</i> is played with album titles, song lyrics, or really any Taylor Swift trivia, i.e. \"scarf.\" IYKYK.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"sm:object-scale-down h-full mx-auto\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-6.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643906809.png\" alt=\"screenshot of taylordle board\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-6.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643906809.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-6.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643906809.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-6.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643906809.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"2101\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans max-w-3xl text-center mx-auto\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">If there's a \"Blank Space,\" you know what to do.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Taylordle</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>8. <a href=\"https://bts-wordle.vercel.app/\"><i>Wordle-BTS</i></a></h2><p>Not to be outdone by the Taylor Swift fandom, there's also a version for K-pop band BTS, and the Army is already hooked. The rules of the game are the same, except with BTS-themed vocab. The tiles turn purple instead of green, which is of course a reference to the phrase \"I Purple You.\"</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"sm:object-scale-down h-full mx-auto\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-8.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643908081.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of BTS wordle board\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-8.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643908081.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-8.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643908081.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-8.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643908081.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"2887\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans max-w-3xl text-center mx-auto\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Put your BTS knowledge to the test. </span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: hannahcode / WORDLE-BTS</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>9. <a href=\"https://www.wordleunlimited.com/\"><i>Wordle Unlimited</i></a> </h2><p>If you've tackled the original <i>Wordle</i>, and all the <i>Wordle</i> clones, there's <i>Wordle Unlimited</i>. It's just like the game we know and love, except with unlimited words, so you don't have to wait an entire day to play again. Plus, this version has a feature where you can enter a custom word and play with friends. <i>Wordle</i> purists might scoff, but we won't \"JUDGE.\"</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-9.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643914278.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of wordle unlimited\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-9.fit_lim.size_800x.v1643914278.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-9.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1643914278.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-9.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643914278.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1593\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Play to your heart's content.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Wordle Unlimited</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>10. <a href=\"https://wtfseo.com/searchdle/\"><i>Searchdle</i></a></h2><p>Gleefully mocking the futility of SEO strategy, the rules of Searchdle are as follows: \"Word length varies wildly (like SEO advice.) Words are random (like SEO data) but you can share your particular word with a friend (like SEO spam.)\" It's fun in a laughing-through-the-tears kind of way.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-12.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of searchdle game\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-12.fit_lim.size_800x.v1644013007.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-12.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1644013007.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-12.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1833\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Play and learn about SEO at the same time.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Searchdle / @RyanJones, WTFSEO</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>11.<i> </i><a href=\"https://www.jewdle.app/\"><i>Jewdle</i></a></h2><p>For a word game based on vocabulary knowledge, it's only fitting that there's now a version celebrating Jewish culture's contribution. Even if you're not Jewish, Hebrew and Yiddish words are so ubiquitous that you'll probably be able to make a few guesses. Mazel tov. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-10.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of Jewdle board\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-10.fit_lim.size_800x.v1644013007.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-10.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1644013007.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-10.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1906\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">'Jewdle' also explains the meaning of the word if you get it right.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Jewdle / dabbles</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>12.<i> </i><a href=\"https://www.starwordle.com/\"><i>Star Wordle</i></a></h2><p>The<i> </i>Star Wars<i> </i>franchise has one of the most legendary followings of all time, so it's no surprise that this fandom would jump on the <i>Wordle</i> bandwagon. Using vocabulary from <a href=\"https://starwars.fandom.com/wiki/Main_Page\">Wookieepedia</a> this version will test your knowledge of the galaxy far far away.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-11.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of Star Wordle\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-11.fit_lim.size_800x.v1644013007.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-11.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1644013007.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-11.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1593\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">May the force be with you.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: Star Wordle</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>13. <a href=\"https://www.heardle.app/\"><i>Heardle</i></a> </h2><p>For the <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/wordle-heardle-song-music-guessing-game\">musically-inclined</a>, this one is for you. Listen to just a second of music's intro and guess the song. Each time you guess incorrectly, <i>Heardle</i> adds more of the song which brings down your score. You can also choose to add a second to the music for additional help. Plus, you get to listen to the whole song once when you guess right.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-13.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of 'Heardle' game\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-13.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647030328.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-13.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647030328.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-13.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1587\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Test your musical knowledge. </span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: 'Heardle' / Omaske</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p></p><h2>14. <a href=\"https://worldle.teuteuf.fr/\"><i>Worldle</i></a> and <a href=\"https://globle-game.com/\"><i>Globle</i></a></h2><p>These two <i>Wordle</i> spinoffs put your geographic skills to the test. Kind of like the game <a href=\"https://www.geoguessr.com/\"><i>GeoGuessr</i></a><i>, </i>as Mashable's Belen Edwards <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/worldle-wordle-globle-geography-map\">points out</a>, the goal of <i>Worldle</i> is to guess the country based on its outlined border. You get six guesses and with each incorrect guess, the game gives you hints with the geographic distance and direction from the answer. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-14.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of 'Worldle' game\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-14.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647030328.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-14.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647030328.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-14.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1735\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Without a sense of scale, this game can be tricky.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: 'Worldle' / @teuteuf </span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>With <i>Globle</i>, the goal is also to guess the correct country, but instead of beginning with the outline of a country, you start the game by guessing any country at random. The closer you are the correct country, the redder or \"hotter\" the guesses become. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-15.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png\" alt=\"Screenshot of 'Globle' game\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-15.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647030328.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-15.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647030328.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-15.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1912\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Just start guessing.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshot: 'Globle' / The Abe Train</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p><i>This article was published in February 2022 and was updated in March 2022.</i> </p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 20:57:36 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"8ae047daf8d493a8af639b61aae429ab","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn38@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-908_e0387fff6fb1525f.webp","destWidth":3840,"destHeight":2160,"sourceBytes":1554564,"destBytes":1554564,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn38@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-908_e0387fff6fb1525f.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-7.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643907301.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn72@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-24-848_292842b4bb715177.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643902470.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn63@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-25-403_ead6196994151a5e.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643902470.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn5@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-26-061_dafabfe36d247aaf.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643903551.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn9@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-25-172_cd322aabc172e7bf.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643904381.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn100@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-25-468_d90070c68385438f.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-5.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643906050.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn57@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-25-690_5415665bd45775a8.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-6.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643906809.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn33@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-26-061_96d583f84bc020da.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-8.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643908081.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn44@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-26-134_7b70b8ffb3fc23a4.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-9.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1643914278.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn3@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-26-337_184c74cacf5a71f5.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-12.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn76@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-24-924_72788da99063aedb.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-10.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn51@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-24-859_38ab8df69108f342.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-11.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1644013007.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn79@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-25-965_0a6b68d1f18c7baf.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-13.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn7@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-26-294_0ff78a78489fe358.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-14.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png":null,"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06rQ2AGLr5cl4wm6lFNwidE/images-15.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647030328.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn30@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-26-054_f1d8333097f12a12.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421783},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Zelensky's show matters more than ever. Let's see it all.","link":"https://mashable.com/article/zelensky-servant-people-how-to-watch","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05HoBiY7qLj1eoDk7zGNHvc/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"A man on a bike flanked by police vehicles\"><p>If Americans have learned anything about Ukrainian president Vlodomyr Zelensky in the weeks since <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/ukraine-russia-war-who-to-follow-misinformation\">Russia invaded his country</a>, it's that he's a masterful media strategist. In trolling Russian president Vladimir Putin (\"I don't bite,\" Zelensky said when suggesting negotiations, referencing Putin's habit of sitting at the other end of long tables), as in mobilizing world opinion behind Ukraine, his prior experience as an actor and comedian has served him well.</p><p>Which is why this is a perfect time for western audiences to familiarize themselves with Zelensky's <i>Servant of the People</i> &mdash; one of the most intriguing and historically important shows you could possibly watch right now. And you <i>should</i> watch, as much and as fast as you can &mdash; despite a bizarre number of obstacles in accessing the whole thing.  </p><p>This is the TV show that ran in Ukraine for three seasons (plus a movie) from 2015 to 2018. Zelensky's character is a history teacher who is unexpectedly elected president in a landslide after his students post a viral video of him complaining about corruption and crowdfund his campaign online. Life imitated art when Zelensky started a Servant of the People Party, ran for president in a campaign run almost entirely on social media, and won in a landslide.</p><p>It may not explain why Russia started this war as well as, say, <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/death-of-stalin-trump-era\"><i>The Death of Stalin</i></a><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/death-of-stalin-trump-era\"> </a>(in which we see a megalomaniacal Russian leader and his cowed underlings who can't even trust each other, let alone deliver bad news). Still, for outsiders, <i>Servant of the People</i> is something of a lesson in Ukrainian politics and culture, and yet the 24-minute episodes are easy to binge. The humor, a handful of references aside, is universal. </p><p>This is satire of the fast-moving, widely-accessible kind. The show consistently tells the terrible truth about real-life villains &mdash; the billionaire oligarchs who stop any government working for the people &mdash; in a way only the court jester of a hopeful democracy can. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/ukraine-viral-heroes\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Ukraine's everyday heroes are owning social media\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>Zelensky emerges from the show less a buffoon, more a heartfelt true believer in democracy. The nearest American analogue might be Jimmy Stewart in the classic Frank Capra movie <i>Mr. Smith Goes to Washington, </i>another great advertisement for democratic principles in dark times. In both stories a somewhat naive history-lover is elevated to high office, refuses to bow to corruption, suffers outrageous smears from the corrupt, and holds the line of morality with from-the-hip speeches. </p><div class=\"giphy-embed\">\n    <video class=\"w-full\" autoplay loop muted playsinline>\n        <source src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/BZzD3msZH8xE164gZj/giphy.mp4\" type=\"video/mp4\">\n        <img src=\"https://media4.giphy.com/media/BZzD3msZH8xE164gZj/giphy.gif\" title=\"Your browser does not support the mp4 video codec.\">\n    </source></video>\n    <small>Via <a href=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/BZzD3msZH8xE164gZj/giphy.gif\" target=\"_blank\">Giphy</a></small>\n</div>\n<p><i>Servant of the People</i> gives <i>Mr. Smith</i> a humor upgrade by way of <i>Veep</i>, with a little Walter Mitty-style daydreaming (Zelensky's character, Vasily Petrovich Goloborodko, often finds himself talking to historical figures in his head). I also saw scenes and setups that reminded me of <i>The Office, Parks and Rec, The Great, The Thick of It, Yes Prime Minister, Arrested Development, </i>and if you're chomping at the bit to watch it all after that name-checking, you're my kind of people. </p><h2><b>How to watch: with difficulty</b></h2><p>But therein lies the trouble: Watching it all. After tracking down the world's most wondered-about show, the best I can suggest is that you time-travel back a couple of years and convince yourself to watch it on Netflix in its entirety before it vanishes from the streaming service for still-unexplained reasons. Search for it on Netflix now and you'll get redirected to <i>Winter on Fire</i>, the documentary on the 2014 protests that forced Ukraine's pro-Putin, police-state-loving president Viktor Yanukovych to flee the country (which is well worth your time, but not exactly the same thing.) </p><p>If you're in the UK, <i>Servant of the People</i> is now screening on Channel 4 &mdash; but at a painfully slow rate. Currently, just three episodes out of the 24 in season 1 are <a href=\"https://www.channel4.com/programmes/servant-of-the-people\">available on the UK-only All 4 streaming app</a>. (Which is also pretty much what's available on torrenting services; not that you'd ever check such things, of course.) The company that owns TV rights has been doing brisk sales, <a href=\"https://qz.com/2137125/which-channels-are-airing-zelenskyys-servant-of-the-people/\">according to multiple reports</a>, but will not reveal if there's a U.S. taker yet. Given the amount of disinformation about Zelensky rife in certain dark corners of American politics &mdash; Rep. Madison Cawthorn was just caught on video calling Ukraine's leader a \"<a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2022/03/10/politics/madison-cawthorn-volodymyr-zelensky-comments/index.html\">thug</a>\" &mdash; the show that proves the Putin apologists wrong can't come to U.S. screens soon enough. </p><p>For now, would-be <i>Servant of the People</i> viewers are left with YouTube, where there is good and bad news. Good news: Zelensky's own production company has uploaded every episode, so we're talking high-quality transfers, not bad user rips. Bad news for English speakers: Most of the episodes offer only Russian subtitles. (Conversely, this is good news for anti-Putin forces in Russia, where the show was already popular, YouTube still isn't banned, and Zelensky's heroism needs to be kept top of mind.) Some of the episodes with English subtitles are more comprehensible than others. If YouTube wanted to do some good in the world, and thank Zelensky for the millions of ad impressions he's brought to the online video giant, it could sink some money into a full-on worldwide <i>Servant of the People</i> translation project. </p><p>In the meantime, here's a quick guide to the best <i>Servant of the People</i> viewing experience currently possible.</p><h2>Episodes 1 and 2</h2><div class=\"w-full max-w-4xl mx-auto mt-8\">\n    <div id=\"video-container-GZ-3YwVQV0M\"></div>\n</div>\n\n\n<p>The double-length premiere is a great place to start. <i>Servant of the People</i> wisely skips over the whole election part, dropping us into the story the morning that history teacher Vasily Petrovich Goloborodko (who lives with his family) learns his campaign for the president was successful. He's then ushered through a dizzying round of interviews and makeovers by the prime minister, Yuri Ivanovich Chuiko, whose silky smoothness you would be right to distrust. The story of the viral video and the crowdfunding that kickstarted his campaign is told in flashback. And the shadowy oligarchs we'll come to know later in the show are anonymous, their faces always covered by items of furniture as they plot nefarious schemes. </p><p>And here, in all its glory, is the joke that was cut when the show aired in Russia. Vasily is offered a range of expensive watches, and is told which one Putin favors. \"Putin Hublot?\" he says innocently &mdash; a phrase that sounds a lot like \"Putin khuilo,\" a Ukrainian football chant that translates roughly to \"Putin is a dickhead.\"  </p><h2>Episode 3</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rQSlZJVFKzg&amp;list=PLSoP62RB3ymmSC-1UmiVAOcMlTijhohVu&amp;index=2\">Episode 3</a> focuses on Vasily's family; in an early sign of the corruption that will surround him everywhere he goes, his mother, father, niece and sister are seen promising government positions to their friends and receiving \"100 percent discounts\" at their favorite stores. (A shopping trip is in order after the family fears it won't be able to dress as elegantly as Michelle Obama, who is said to be attending the inauguration.) The fourth wall shatters when a couple of policemen ask the family if they can \"do something about\" comedians who criticize the government. </p><h2>Episode 4</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z-myY55Gjmw&amp;list=PLSoP62RB3ymmSC-1UmiVAOcMlTijhohVu&amp;index=3\">Episode 4</a> opens with what is hands-down my favorite scene of the show: Vasily being shown around his swanky new presidential residence. He finds a chandelier so expensive that it caused the country to default on its debt during the 2008 financial crisis, and a parrot that squawks \"no, you're the idiot!\" when it hears the name of ousted pro-Putin president Viktor Yanukovych; the show was actually filmed on the massive estate Yanukovych had vacated in a hurry less than two years earlier. Unfortunately the episode is the first to lose its English subtitles before the end, so if you want to see Zelensky's character chatting about his inauguration address with Abraham Lincoln, you'll need to watch <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-AdMISdvbcc\">this version</a>. </p><h2>Episode 5</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yz3hsUi5qV4&amp;list=PLSoP62RB3ymmSC-1UmiVAOcMlTijhohVu&amp;index=4\">Episode 5</a> may be my favorite episode overall &mdash; and certainly the show's best example of physical comedy. In the first half, Vasily spends much of his time running away from his ridiculously large security detail. In the second, we're introduced to his presidential predecessor, who has barricaded himself into his office with a shotgun and a bar full of booze. Much of the show hits differently now Russia has invaded Ukraine, but this is the first scene that hits differently in the wake of Donald Trump's disastrous bid to cling on to power. </p><p>The quality of the English translation starts to go downhill with <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1PAZr1bQlkI&amp;list=PLSoP62RB3ymmSC-1UmiVAOcMlTijhohVu&amp;index=5\">episode 6</a>, in which Vasily falls out with his family, yells \"Putin has been overthrown\" to get the attention of squabbling deputies, and has a chat with Che Guevara. Subtitles then disappear early in <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wt6gsVaBPxw&amp;list=PLSoP62RB3ymmSC-1UmiVAOcMlTijhohVu&amp;index=6\">episode 7</a>. In <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kgMVWTcRw2E&amp;list=PLSoP62RB3ymmSC-1UmiVAOcMlTijhohVu&amp;index=7\">episode 8</a>, the show takes a turn towards screwball office comedy, as Vasily brings in a cabinet of outsiders like himself &mdash; only they all happen to be his old school pals. The show presents them as a cadre of trusted allies who are less likely to take bribes, but it's hard for a viewer not to notice that such nepotism is a form of corruption in itself. In <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u0-vvSxsdsQ&amp;list=PLSoP62RB3ymmSC-1UmiVAOcMlTijhohVu&amp;index=8\">episodes 9</a> and <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ayL8XFqm2SM&amp;list=PLSoP62RB3ymmSC-1UmiVAOcMlTijhohVu&amp;index=9\">10</a>, the oligarchs take a number of steps to bribe or bring down the new cabinet, including dosing one member with psychedelics. </p><p>As promising a plotline as that may be, we're lost without English subtitles for the next 13 episodes. (You can try auto-translating the Russian captions, but good luck with that.) Which brings us to the last and most epic English language experience in the current canon:</p><h2><i>Servant of the People 2: </i>The Movie</h2><div class=\"w-full max-w-4xl mx-auto mt-8\">\n    <div id=\"video-container-T9kL5XSMBxo\"></div>\n</div>\n\n\n<p>After Season 1 was a huge hit, Zelensky and company repackaged a planned plotline from Season 2 as a (mercifully well-subtitled) 90-minute movie, <i>Servant of the People 2</i>. Here you'll encounter mild spoilers; Yuri Ivanovich, the prime minister, is in jail, having been unmasked as a stooge of the oligarchs, and Vasily is dating an assistant who is also revealed to be one of their people. </p><p>To break up an alliance of the three most powerful oligarchs, Vasily and Yuri take a train to the east of the country (including, chillingly, several cities that are currently under heavy Russian bombardment). Classic road movie farce ensues. Meanwhile Ukraine has applied for a loan from the International Monetary Fund, which keeps piling on the onerous conditions even as Vasily's hapless foreign minister tries to keep the IMF leadership drunk.  </p><p>Vasily's speech at the end of the movie responding to the IMF loan offer is a thing of beauty, and in retrospect can be applied to any situation where Ukraine has been pushed too far. \"We're not a border region between orcs and elves,\" Vasily says. \"We are a nation of open, clever and talented people. When we understand this, when we understand that stealing is bad, that we need to roll up our sleeves and work hard ... Then the whole world will say 'glory to Ukraine!'\" <i>Slava Ukraini</i> indeed. </p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 20:00:08 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05HoBiY7qLj1eoDk7zGNHvc/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"254b338bdd9ecebb7b21f07fc4805004","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn20@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-02-038_257a6fe24fda2734.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1033,"sourceBytes":198047,"destBytes":99234,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05HoBiY7qLj1eoDk7zGNHvc/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn20@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-02-038_257a6fe24fda2734.webp","https://media4.giphy.com/media/BZzD3msZH8xE164gZj/giphy.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn35@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-26-393_743e77e33a0ccbce.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421756},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Air fryer breakfast cookies are super easy to make and pretty healthy","link":"https://mashable.com/article/air-fryer-breakfast-cookies-healthy","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/hero-image.png\" alt=\"cookie with airfryday logo\"><div class=\"raw-embed\">\n    <div style=\"position: relative; width: 100%; height: 0; padding-bottom: 56.25%\"><iframe style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0;\" width=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" src=\"https://embedder.wirewax.com/8261313\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"yes\" allowfullscreen></iframe></div>\n</div>\n<hr><p>I'll be upfront: I am not a sweet breakfast person. Most days my breakfast is a fried egg on a corn tortilla. Or a runny egg over leftovers. Or just eggs with hot sauce. You get the picture. </p><p>But I could see myself, every now and again, enjoying a breakfast of this cookie recipe from <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@nourishedbynic\">nourishedbynic or</a><a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@nourishedbynic\"><br></a><a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@nourishedbynic\">Nicole Addison</a> on TikTok. And lots of other people must enjoy it, too: It's racked up nearly 10 million views. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/air-fryer-peanut-butter-jelly-rolls-recipe\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Air fryer peanut butter and jelly roll-up recipe from viral TikTok is a tasty snack for kids\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>It's simple to make, pretty healthy, and not overly sweet like, you know, a real <i>cookie </i>cookie. Here's what you need to know about making it. </p><h3>Ingredients</h3><ul><li><p>1/2 cup oats</p></li><li><p>1/2 banana, mashed</p></li><li><p>1 tsp baking powder</p></li><li><p>1/2 scoop protein powder</p></li><li><p>1 tbsp coconut oil</p></li><li><p>1 tbsp of milk of choice</p></li><li><p>Cinnamon, to taste</p></li><li><p>Chocolate chips, to taste</p></li></ul><h3>Directions</h3><ol><li><p>Mix all ingredients, except the chocolate chips, in a large mixing bowl.</p></li><li><p>In the basket of your air fryer, lay down a piece of parchment paper, just larger than the desired size of your cookie.</p></li><li><p>Form the dough into a large ball, then smash down on the parchment paper. It should be roughly half an inch thick.</p></li><li><p>Top the cookie with chocolate chips.</p></li><li><p>Air fry at 360 degrees for 10 minutes. Enjoy!</p></li></ol><p>Here's how the  process from Addison looked in the TikTok.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951549.png\" alt=\"cookie being made in three screenshots\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-4.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646951549.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-4.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646951549.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951549.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Screenshots: TikTok / @nourishedbynic</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p> </p><h3>The details</h3><p>Not to steal from a <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Barefoot-Contessa-How-Easy-That/dp/0307238768\">living culinary legend</a>...but to steal from a living culinary legend...<i>how easy is that? </i>The process for making breakfast cookies was super simple. If I didn't slow down for filming and photos, I think I could have made this breakfast in like 13 minutes, just a few of which would have involved actually <i>doing </i>anything. Just mash a bunch of stuff together, shape it into a puck, and air fry. Simple. </p><p>The only real tip I have about the beginning of the cooking process is concerning the mashed banana. In the TikTok from Addison, she mashes the banana in the big bowl with everything else. I did this step separately and I think it helped ensure the banana spread throughout the cookie instead of clumping to oats while being mashed. Here's how all my ingredients looked in the bowl.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951549.jpg\" alt=\"mashed ingredients in bowl\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646951549.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646951549.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951549.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"2000\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Mmmmmm oat mash. </span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Mashable</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>From there, I cut some parchment to size, then placed it in my air fryer. I then carefully rolled and smooshed &mdash; technical cooking term &mdash; my dough into a cookie shape on the parchment. Then I topped with chocolate chips and it looked like this. Neither brain science nor rocket surgery. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"sm:object-scale-down h-full mx-auto\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951549.jpg\" alt=\"uncooked cookie in air fryer\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646951549.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646951549.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951549.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"2069\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans max-w-3xl text-center mx-auto\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Looks kind of cookie-ish, no?</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Mashable</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>Now Addison, in the TikTok comments, suggested air frying for 10 minutes at 360 degrees. My cookie turned out fine with those instructions, but the exterior was definitely a bit more charred than I would've liked. Keep an eye on your cookie because I suspect, with some air fryer models, you might want to cook for about eight minutes instead of 10. Here was my final product. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951549.jpg\" alt=\"cookie on plate\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-3.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646951549.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-3.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646951549.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04eNYUX8nb1fr210XA0j3qR/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646951549.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1500\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Little burnt? Sure. Tastes good? Yes.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Mashable</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>The verdict? It's good. Not mind-blowing, but a good, quick breakfast. It tasted like baked oats in a cookie shape. And you know why? Because it was basically baked oats in a cookie shape.</p><p>But that's not a bad thing. The interior of the cookie was soft, fluffy, and tasty. There was enough sweetness from the banana and protein powder that there was no need for any added sugars. I split the cookie with (<i>Borat voice</i>) my wife and it was a nice midday snack. </p><p>I remain an egg-based breakfast person. You cannot change from savory to sweet overnight. There is nothing like a fried egg on a corn tortilla. Never gets old. But should I get the urge to mix things up, I could absolutely see this cookie in my future. </p><h2><b>More on Foodtok</b></h2><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/best-tiktok-food-trends-of-2021\">The 7 TikTok recipes of 2021 that actually deserved the hype</a></p><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/easy-air-fryer-breakfast-tacos-recipe\">$1 air fryer breakfast tacos are easy to make and so delicious</a></p><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/air-fryer-oranges-viral-tiktok-recipe-review\">A recipe for air-fried oranges went viral. We can confirm it's gross.</a></p><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/air-fried-cheese-recipe-tiktok\">Air-fried cheese is delicious because crispy cheese is amazing</a></p><p><a alt=\"Man wearing a white virtual reality headset with his hands up in the air\"><p>Meta and Apple are playing nice with each other, and that means you can access your Oculus Quest VR workout stats directly on an iOS device. </p><p>Meta <a href=\"https://www.oculus.com/blog/oculus-move-updates-track-your-vr-fitness-stats-and-goals-outside-your-headset/\">announced two new updates to Oculus Move</a>, its built-in fitness tracking app on the Quest VR headset, that are set to roll out next month. The updates include a new Oculus Move mobile app for iOS and Android, where workout data like calories burned and minutes spent exercising in VR can be seen on your phone. Previously, this data could only be accessed in the Oculus Move app on the headset. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-vr-games-fitness-apps\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            The best VR games and apps that make working out fun\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>The update also allows Apple users to directly sync Oculus Move data with the Apple Health app, eliminating the need to manually input VR workout stats if desired.
