+0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01EkM0Ib7fNayk51POULMVf/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"a718b04b7a7e039bd005c8cfbf3da358","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn74@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-03-002_8b77ea9eb38ef8c3.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":549858,"destBytes":549858,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01EkM0Ib7fNayk51POULMVf/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn74@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-03-002_8b77ea9eb38ef8c3.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/01EkM0Ib7fNayk51POULMVf/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn47@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-24-874_9d80e0055f2691f9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421772},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"A Steam game faces backlash for adding a bizarrely sexist anti-mask rant to patch notes","link":"https://mashable.com/article/domina-steam-game-developer-anti-mask-backlash","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03Cw3DsQ6616u4TLk5E7k17/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"A man wearing a surgical mask and a mic-equipped gaming headset sits in front of a computer monitor and RGB-lit keyboard, leaning forward and staring at the screen intently.\"><p>The developers behind indie game <i>Domina</i> should've just sat there and ate their food. </p><p>Instead, they snuck an unhinged anti-masking patch note (with a side of misogyny) into their latest update. Then their rating plummeted as angry players visited <i>Domina</i> page on Steam and waged a \"review bomb\" campaign &mdash; in which people post negative reviews <i>en masse</i> &mdash;that shows no signs of slowing down.</p><p>Backlash against the gladiator management sim by developer Dolphin Barn started spreading Saturday, March 12, after some Twitter users spotted the bizarrely out-of-place <a href=\"https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/535230/view/3122688999868869084%20\">COVID-19 tirade snuck into the notes detailing changes made in the 1.3.18 update</a> released a few days prior. The seventh item on the patch list with otherwise mundane technical fixes reads:</p><blockquote><p>TAKE OFF THE FCKN MASKS - Next time you're at the grocery store, try showing a woman your face. Be confident, unafraid of the LIES -- you might get a girlfriend. Women like confidence. Women don't like dudes who cover their faces in fear. What are you afraid of? Getting laid? Grow up.</p></blockquote><p>If you're wondering (A) What the fuck masks have to do with either this game or getting a girlfriend, (B) Exactly what \"LIES\" refusing to wear a mask in a grocery store protects you from, and (C) What expertise in epidemiology the <i>Domina</i> developers have to qualify their opinions on public health protocols for coronavirus &mdash; you're not alone. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/e3-2022-rumor-cloud-gaming-for-e3-at-home\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            E3 isn't happening in 2022. But cloud gaming can bring previews to the people at home.\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/steam-deck-shortcuts-how-to\"><b>Steam Deck's hidden shortcuts make it easy to snap screenshots and call up the keyboard</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/best-wordle-clones-alternatives\"><b>14 of the best 'Wordle' clones, because one word a day isn't enough</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/destiny-2-witch-queen-review\"><b>Bungie brings some of that old Halo magic to Destiny in 'The Witch Queen'</b></a></p></li></ul><p>While the almost <a href=\"https://store.steampowered.com/app/535230/Domina/#app_reviews_hash\">8,000 Steam reviews of the game</a> are categorized as \"very positive,\" the over 700 recent reviews from the past 30 days are now \"overwhelmingly negative.\" The backlash of reviewers demanding refunds and critiquing the developers' politicized anti-masking rant (among other game-related complaints) essentially flipped <i>Domina</i>'s review statistics overnight, going from 82 percent positive overall to 81 percent negative after the update (at the time of this article's publication).</p><p>\"Anti-masker devs using their patch notes as a glorified twitter feed. Embarrassing,\" read one <a href=\"https://steamcommunity.com/id/tomato_gaming/recommended/535230/\">apt negative review posted March 11</a>, from a user who had invested over 15 hours into the game. </p><p>\"Pretty wild the dev ripped out a bunch of content and put it into microtransactions. And instead of making the have better, instead goes on unintelligible rants in the dev notes,\" <a href=\"https://steamcommunity.com/id/juice0123/recommended/535230/\">reads another</a>. Aside from the heavily implied COVID conspiracy talk, <a href=\"https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198055258299/recommended/535230/\">one reviewer knocks the weird incel insecurity</a> evident in \"a tantrum [that] hardly speaks confidence to me.\"</p><p>Of course, a select few of other recent user reviews represent the opposing opinion &mdash; the backlash to the backlash, if you will &mdash; celebrating the anti-masker developers as \"based.\" Interestingly, those supportive reviews seem to come from users who've spent significantly less time playing the game. </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/Shurjoka/status/1502945452408385537\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.pcgamer.com/uk/indie-gladiator-game-faces-steam-review-backlash-over-anti-mask-patch-notes/\">PC Mag (Mashable's sister site) also found</a> more weirdly <a href=\"https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/535230/view/3087758194015412369\">womanizing misogynistic sentiments hidden in previous patch notes</a>. Since the review bombing began, the <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Weathered_M/status/1502935575057375234\">game's official Twitter page</a> has only doubled down on the toxic asshattery, railing against getting the \"cancel culture\" treatment from a \"woke mob\" after they merely suggested people have \"courage.\"</p><p>Considering these derogatory attitudes toward women and, you know, continuing to mask in order to protect yourself and/or other vulnerable people from COVID-19, the whole thing calls the game's <a href=\"https://store.steampowered.com/app/535230/Domina/\">mature content warning into question</a>. It cautions: \"<i>Story events contain mature themes that invite the player to make ethical decisions with regards: slavery, injustice, and occasionally normal and abnormal human sexuality.\"</i></p><p>One Steam user noted the irony of it all in <a href=\"https://steamcommunity.com/app/535230\">a community discussion board titled,</a> \"Thought gamers hated modern politics in their games.\" Unsurprisingly, it appears many self-identified \"gamers\" who rally against politics in video games only reject politics in their entertainment that doesn't reflect with their own worldview.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 13 Mar 2022 22:36:56 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03Cw3DsQ6616u4TLk5E7k17/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"c46e82dc574f686bccf483b794289812","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn43@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-01-971_fe1f7e83c497dd1e.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":109004,"destBytes":109004,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03Cw3DsQ6616u4TLk5E7k17/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn43@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-01-971_fe1f7e83c497dd1e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421739},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"'The Andy Warhol Diaries' review: Capturing a complicated queer icon","link":"https://mashable.com/article/andy-warhol-diaries-documentary-review","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Three portraits of artist Andy Warhol\"><p>You don't need to know about pop art to know the work of Andy Warhol. The Pittsburgh-born artist, who rose to fame with his silkscreen paintings <i>Campbell's Soup Cans</i>, was so influential that his unique and multifaceted brand has gone on to influence countless painters, filmmakers, musicians, and social media stars. 35 years after his death, his fingerprints can be found smudged across our contemporary landscape. Yet the person behind his larger-than-life persona is a slippery mystery &mdash; one that Netflix's new documentary mini-series <i>The Andy Warhol Diaries</i> might set out to solve.&nbsp;</p><p>The title is literal, named after the posthumously published journals <i>The Andy Warhol Diaries</i>, which were edited by Warhol's longtime friend and collaborator, Pat Hackett. Across six episodes, director Andrew Rossi deep-dives into the diaries' stories with interviews from Hackett and a parade of colleagues, art experts, historians, and celebrity friends, including Debbie Harry, Rob Lowe, and John Waters. As Warhol was also a filmmaker and photographer, Rossi is spoiled for choice in terms of archival footage. His selections range from interviews with the artist to his films, news footage, and a flood of photographs, public and personal.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg\" alt=\"Andy Warhol with his eyes closed next to a friend in heavy makeup and a straw hat.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-4.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646865506.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-4.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646865506.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Netflix</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>The controversial use of artificial intelligence in documentary narration</h2><p>Last summer, <a href=\"https://slate.com/culture/2021/07/anthony-bourdain-roadrunner-documentary-movie-ai-morgan-neville.html\">outrage arose over Anthony Bourdain-centered documentary </a><a href=\"https://slate.com/culture/2021/07/anthony-bourdain-roadrunner-documentary-movie-ai-morgan-neville.html\"><i>Roadrunner</i></a> because that documentarian employed AI to create narration in the late Bourdain's voice. Critics, fans, and Bourdain's family were shocked when this device was revealed after the film's release. A similar tool is used in <i>The Warhol Diaries</i>. However, it's never hidden. <a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/andy-warhol-netflix\">It was announced in the trailer,</a> it's made clear in the documentary, and its use has been approved by The Andy Warhol Foundation. So, Rossi has thoughtfully addressed all the issues raised by <i>Roadrunner</i>. But how does it play?&nbsp;</p><p>When the AI is announced via a title card, a quote by Warhol follows: &ldquo;Machines have less problems. I&rsquo;d like to be a machine, wouldn&rsquo;t you?&rdquo;&nbsp;</p><p>Throughout the film, this concept &mdash; this wish to be a machine &mdash;&nbsp; is echoed, as the man struggles with his body's weaknesses, desires, and crippling insecurity around his work and his looks. Warhol's actual voice has a signature flatness and aloofness. So the AI translation seems all the more fitting. However, there are times when a word comes out jarringly robot-y, reminding the viewer that the diary entries are being read by a machine. But since Warhol once <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=he1XK7aQOrU\">participated in having a robot version of himself built</a>, this feels fitting too.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857812.jpg\" alt=\"A black and white photo of two men in suits; one is Andy Warhol. \" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646857812.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646857812.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857812.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Jon Gould and Andy Warhol. </span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Netflix</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>Not for Warhol newbies</h2><p>If you're planning to sit down for a six-hour documentary on an artist, Rossi assumes you know the basics. The first episode will offer a manic montage that swiftly spells out the impact Warhol has had on modern pop culture. But the iconic soup cans, The Factory and its stars, and <a href=\"https://www.history.com/news/andy-warhol-shot-valerie-solanas-the-factory\">the assassination attempt</a> are regarded more as timeline markers than chapters unto themselves. Rather than focusing on these elements that have been much discussed already, <i>The Warhol Diaries</i> looks to understand who he was beyond the headlines and the screenprint coolness. So, Rossi takes us back to the Byzantine Catholic church and the rough blue-collar neighborhood where a young and <a href=\"https://www.villagevoice.com/2000/05/09/swish-myth/\">undeniably \"swish\"</a> Warhol faced inspiration and persecution.&nbsp;</p><p>From there, Rossi charts his journey to New York City. Then the episodes become focused on pivotal personal relationships &mdash; some romantic, some platonic, some much harder to pin down. The second episode, \"Shadows: Andy &amp; Jed\", focuses on Warhol and his long-term boyfriend, Jed Johnson, who became an illustrious interior designer to the stars. \"A Double Life: Andy &amp; Jon\" dives into the relationship between the artist and his closeted paramour, Paramount Pictures executive Jon Gould. \"Collab: Andy &amp; Basquiat\" explores the friendship between Warhol and Jean-Michel Basquiat, which was devoted but plagued by the pressures of the art world and personal blind spots.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg\" alt=\"Andy Warhol and an associate, both carrying cameras.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-3.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646865506.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-3.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646865506.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Netflix</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>What it means to make a diary a documentary</h2><p>Diaries are not reliable narrators. Often, they are written in a fit of feeling for an audience of one. Still, Warhol was aware that his fame meant his decade-long diary-keeping could be preserved. So, on top of omissions, there are codes in the diaries, allusions to people and events he cannot bring himself to name. Other times, Warhol shares a thought that's insensitive or even outright bigoted. Rossi and his interview subjects bring to light these shadowy parts and do so with understanding but not excuses.&nbsp;</p><p>Those closest to Warhol flesh out the highs and lows of his life and loves, giving context to terse anecdotes and urgent scrawls. Old friends challenge some events as Warhol recounts them, noting he had a flair for the romantic when writing about a particular beau. However, other debates over the contents of the diaries are more problematic, spoiling an ideal image of Warhol. More on that in a bit. </p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857812.jpg\" alt=\"Keith Haring, Andy Warhol, and Jean-Michel Basquiat pose for a group photo.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646857812.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646857812.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857812.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Keith Haring, Andy Warhol, and Jean-Michel Basquiat pose for a group photo.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Netflix</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>Andy Warhol: complicated queer icon</h2><p>Today, Warhol is embraced a legend of queer America, who captured queer desire and made queer art nationally recognized. However, Warhol struggled with his queer identity throughout his life, in part because of a Catholic upbringing that urged shame on homosexuals. His art, journals, and friends delve into this inner turmoil, which expressed itself in a desire to hide \"the real me.\" The Warhol persona wasn't just a living art installation, but also a shield that protected Warhol from some of the most vicious homophobia raging in America through the '60s, '70s, and '80s. This film, and its talking heads, dig unflinchingly into what that meant and how it looked. It's not all pretty. </p><p><i>The Warhol Diaries</i> also explores the ways in which Warhol fell short as a queer leader. His <a href=\"https://www.tate.org.uk/art/artists/andy-warhol-2121/ladies-and-gentlemen\"><i>Ladies and Gentlemen</i></a> portrait series could be viewed as a celebration of transgender people or exploitation of them. His relationship with Basquiat was one of admiration but also charged with racial tension, as Warhol was an older white man who didn't comprehend the challenges a young Black man faced in the New York art scene. Finally, as the AIDS crisis raged on, their friend Keith Haring became an outspoken advocate for gay men, while Warhol privately panicked about the ways in which he might be at risk.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-5.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg\" alt=\"Andy Warhol portrait, with a large shadow cast on the wall behind him.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-5.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646865506.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-5.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646865506.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-5.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Netflix</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<h2>Who is Andy Warhol?&nbsp;</h2><p>There is no simple answer to this deceptively simple question. <i>The Andy Warhol Diaries</i> probe the man behind the myth, but also recognize a diary is not the entirety of a person. Warhol gave so much of himself to the world in his prolific art, his public performance of an artist, in his diaries, and in the colleagues that he boosted and collaborated with. Experts and friends can point to pictures and passages and make pronouncements about who Warhol was, but these pieces do not complete the puzzle. That's by design.&nbsp;</p><p>In the end, Rossi has not spent six episodes dissecting, deifying, or demonizing Warhol. Instead, he explores how one of the most famous man of modern times is still a marvelous mystery, no matter how long we look. In that, there is a lot of beauty and humanity to be treasured for decades to come. </p><p><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/57owx\"><i>The Andy Warhol Diaries </i></a><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/57owx\">is now streaming on Netflix. </a></p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"0a244b02d3b933cdea7cc97be88a6a95","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn17@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-03-975_40663039fd31e6fe.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":232171,"destBytes":141816,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn17@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-03-975_40663039fd31e6fe.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn59@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-25-428_441b9bf78c332a79.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857812.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn31@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-25-721_86fbd4267c8dbb6f.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn84@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-24-932_2265fb58374f4046.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857812.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn60@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-25-007_c5901a9430512e00.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03vAnX0NkdSJMD8Gak8JFWG/images-5.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646865506.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn99@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-26-555_6d0b1435657ac0cd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421789},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 The Philips SmartSleep Wake Up Light is on sale for $79.95 at <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/6wWmq\">Amazon</a> and <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/4e0WG\">Walmart</a> as of March 10, down a full $20 from its $99.95 MSRP. </p><hr><p>Simply put, sleep is <a href=\"https://healthysleep.med.harvard.edu/healthy/matters/benefits-of-sleep/why-do-we-sleep\">important</a>. Whether it be for our day-to-day functioning, long term development, or overall health, getting a good night's rest goes a long way. Anything that disrupts sleep can be hard to deal with, which is why the arrival of daylight saving time can be such a pain. Yes, it finally won't be dark by 5 p.m., but it will be dark if you're trying to get up even somewhat early in the morning. Between that and our <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/best-youtube-videos-fall-asleep-calming-relaxing\">phones' blue lights</a> we're all staring at until just before we close our eyes, what're our circadian rhythms to do? </p><p>Well, maybe getting some light regulation built into your routine isn't a bad idea. And luckily enough, just before this year's daylight saving time change, the Philips SmartSleep Wake Up Light is on sale for $79.95 at both <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/6wWmq\">Amazon</a> and <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/4e0WG\">Walmart</a> (and at the time of writing, completely sold out on Philip's website).</p><p>For those unfamiliar, the Philips wake up light presents a much welcome alternative to blaring alarm clocks in early morning darkness and harsh overhead lighting just before bed. Instead, it's warm-sun colored light pairs with five soothing sounds to simulate the sunset or sunrise in your bedroom every night and morning. For the most peaceful morning possible, the light gradually increases its intensity over a period of 30 minutes as it turns on. If you're not quite ready to get up, it does come equipped with a one-tap snooze feature. </p><p>In addition to its sun simulation, this light also comes equipped with FM radio, a USB charging port, and a nightlight that can be activated with a tap. It may not have all the fanciest smart features, but those can run you up to $200. At the end (and start) of the day, if what you're looking for is a light to held you wind down and calmly wake you up with minimal effort on your part, the Philips SmartSleep Wake Up Light is an excellent option. </p><div class=\"max-w-3xl mx-auto mb-16 font-sans flex flex-col mt-8 md:flex-row\" data-ga-module=\"deal-card\" data-ga-element=\"offer\">\n    <div class=\"w-64 mx-auto md:mx-0 src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/04jrjFc43vLrLwlDTBGS3va/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Women staring into sunset\"><p>The online world isn't always the friendliest of places for women, particularly when it comes to trolling and misogyny on social media. From Twitter <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/twitter-reply-guys\">reply guys</a></u>, to other forms of online harassment, to straight up cyberstalking, letting women exist in peace seems to be a hard concept to grasp. </p><p>When it comes to <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-dating-sites-uk\">dating apps</a> specifically &mdash;&nbsp;where others often assume that a dating app profile means that one is willfully subjecting themselves to creepy comments &mdash; the chance of women enduring such unsettling experiences feels doubled. The onslaught of men grasping at straws for attention with messages saying \"think they saw you somewhere\" or requesting nudes in their opening line is an online dating specialty.</p><p>Is it easier to shoot your shot by simply using a hot selfie on your Instagram story as bait for your crush? That's a classic tactic that'll never die. But unless you and said crush are already in some sort of flirtationship and already follow each other on social media, finding love, a hookup, or someone to grab a drink with could happen a lot faster with the right dating app (as opposed to waiting to meet someone at work or agreeing to a blind date). </p><p>This means not deleting and re-downloading Tinder after every breakup or every time you ghost (or get ghosted by) your current entanglement.&nbsp;Tinder can truly be a great place to meet genuine people who are open to getting serious, to find a reliable friend with benefits, or to get a good-old-fashioned confidence boost from a mutual right swipe. But if you're frustrated with horny users disguising themselves as relationship seekers or relationship seekers who can't handle it when you say you're just looking for a hookup, opting for a dating site more finely-tuned to what you're looking for means you'll spend less time dealing with people who aren't looking for the same thing.&nbsp;</p><p>Maybe you can't stand starting every conversation from scratch. Maybe your biggest fear is ending up on a date with someone who doesn't care about cats. Instead of a lazy bio, dating apps that delve into someone's hobbies, favourite movies, career goals, or political views before even talking to them opens up a wealth of clever ice breakers, and ensures that you aren't going into things blindly.&nbsp;</p><h2><b>How are dating apps trying to make dating safer?</b></h2><p>Meeting someone from the internet in person for the first time is nerve-wracking for anyone. But for women, it can dredge up the same fear that occurs when walking alone past a big group of men.&nbsp;</p><p>Match Group is making strides toward a safer dating experience: Tinder was the first to unveil new features coming out of its partnership with <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/tinder-noonlight-safety-features-photo-verification\">Noonlight</a></u>, a safety app that tracks the location of users and notifies authorities if there are concerns. Before heading out on a date, Tinder users can log info about where they're going and who they're meeting, as well as hit a panic button to alert authorities if there's an emergency. </p><p>Match Group plans to roll out the same features for its other apps, like Hinge and OkCupid, later. In March 2021, Tinder announced plans to let users run a <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/tinder-background-check-garbo\">background check</a></u> on their matches.</p><h2><b>How has the pandemic changed dating?</b></h2><p>COVID changed online dating dynamics forever. Being vaccinated becoming a genuine turn-on is the obvious addition to 2022 dating checklists, but there's something about dating discourse that we think could positively affect communication between strangers in the long run.</p><p>Waiting to meet each other and getting to know a match through FaceTime is kind of the norm now &mdash; and <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/post-pandemic-dating-sex-dating-app-survey\">people don't really want that to change</a></u>, even once the pandemic has fully subsided. For the women who'd prefer to gather crumbs of someone's vibe before meeting in person, online dating's <u><a href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2020/4/3/21198794/coronavirus-video-dating-tinder-hinge-grindr\">shift to video dating</a></u> in 2020 could prove comforting. It goes without saying that you're never required to <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/dating-app-meet-harassment-coronavirus-social-distance\">meet up with a match</a></u> in person immediately, but it'd be nice not to be pestered about it.</p><p>The communication skills gained through hashing out COVID-related issues aren't nothing, either. People have gotten comfortable with bringing up personal boundaries and bonding over universal anxieties with someone they met on a dating app &mdash; both of which could benefit women online. <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/tinder-future-of-dating-is-fluid-report-2021\">Tinder</a></u> thinks the honesty will carry over when things are back to normal, and hopefully the creeps will continue to weed themselves out.&nbsp;</p><h2><b>Should you consider using free dating apps?</b></h2><p>There are plenty of free dating sites and apps out there, and the likes of Tinder and Hinge are popular options with massive networks of users. You can easily enter the online dating game without spending anything, but you get what you pay for with dating sites and apps. </p><p>For the best experience with the greatest possibility of finding exactly what you're looking for, you are probably going to need to cough up some cash. The best dating sites don't come cheap, and whilst you can still find a hookup with a free app, you should upgrade is you're looking for compatibility tests, chat rooms, videos, and a greater level of control. </p><h2><b>What are the best dating sites for women?</b></h2><p>Whether you're looking for a <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-hookup-apps-uk\">fun time</a> or your next <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-dating-sites-for-serious-relationships-uk\">long-term relationship</a>, we have picked out a wide range of apps and sites for different types of daters. So whatever you're looking for, we have you covered with this guide.</p><p>We have done the tough stuff, looked at all the <a href=\"https://www.datingadvice.com/online-dating/online-dating-statistics\">facts and figures</a>, and worked out which sites are the best options for every single type of woman out there. That's 20% less than its regular price of $988.</p><hr><p>DJI is the leading brand for camera drones for a reason &mdash; their Hasselblad cameras, automated flight features, and intuitive controls are an industry standard other brands struggle to live up to. Their models populate just about every \"<u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-drones-with-cameras\">Best Drones</a></u>\" list, to widespread professional and amateur videographer consensus alike.</p><p>While these drones come at a range of price points, from the sub-$300<a href=\"https://zdcs.link/NX2ZD\"> </a><u><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/NX2ZD\">Mini SE</a></u> to the just-under-$3,000<a href=\"https://zdcs.link/lLGdX\"> </a><u><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/lLGdX\">Inspire 2</a></u>, they definitely sit on the pricier side of things &mdash; which is why a deal this good is hard to pass up.</p><h3>Why the DJI Mavic Air 2 Fly More Combo is a great buy</h3><p>The<a href=\"https://zdcs.link/bZkAG\"> </a><u><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/bZkAG\">Mavic Air 2</a></u> is a perfect example of DJI's brand reputation. Not only does it have a powerful camera (capable of 4K/60fps video, 48MP photo, and 8K hyperlapse), it also has various shooting modes to spice up your videography. And did we mention their excellent insurance coverage? I flew mine into the ocean the first time I took it out and got a brand new one delivered, no questions asked.</p><p>If there's one drawback to this versatile, powerful drone, it's that the battery life lasts 34 minutes &mdash; this is fairly long in comparison to other drones in the market, but it's never fun to lug a camera around on a six-hour hike for just half an hour of footage. This is where the Fly More combo comes in &mdash; it includes two extra batteries, three pairs of extra propellers, a battery charging hub (so that you don't have to switch out all three batteries one by one), battery to power bank adapter, and an ND filters set (for the camera), all in a padded shoulder bag designed to protect the drone.</p><h3>Seriously, this is a really good deal</h3><p>The Fly More package alone is worth $199, but with the 20% discount, the Mavic Air 2 Fly More Combo (drone + Fly More accessories) is actually $10 less than just the drone itself, which means you get all those add-ons for free <i>and</i> an extra $10 off the unit itself.</p><div class=\"max-w-3xl mx-auto mb-16 font-sans flex flex-col mt-8 md:flex-row\" data-ga-module=\"deal-card\" href=\"https://zdcs.link/bZkAG?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmashable.com%2Ffeeds%2Frss%2Fall&amp;short_url=bZkAG&amp;cd36=Standard&amp;t=deals&amp;m=deal-card&amp;e=offer&amp;i=title&amp;el=offer\" leading-6 text-center md:text-lg md:text-left\">$789 at Amazon (save $199)</div>\n                <a class=\"font-bold text-center hover:underline leading-6\" href=\"https://zdcs.link/bZkAG?u=https%3A%2F%2Fmashable.com%2Ffeeds%2Frss%2Fall&amp;short_url=bZkAG&amp;cd36=Standard&amp;t=deals&amp;m=deal-card&amp;e=offer&amp;i=buy-button&amp;el=offer\"
