href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-drones-with-cameras\">Best drones with cameras: Take aerial photos (and selfies) like a pro</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-drones-under-200-dollars\">The best drones you can get for under $200</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-drones-for-kids\">Best drones for kids: Find a toy drone that's safe, sturdy, and easy to fly</a></p></li></ul>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 18:04:13 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05UbvuSPw0IGiwLoo35Xy7c/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"8eda199b231885caf779d9fb38d629d3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn8@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-01-979_a40b50760ec1ea77.webp","destWidth":1500,"destHeight":844,"sourceBytes":205644,"destBytes":205644,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05UbvuSPw0IGiwLoo35Xy7c/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn8@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-01-979_a40b50760ec1ea77.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/05UbvuSPw0IGiwLoo35Xy7c/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn31@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-24-921_0d7f7acaa13e7389.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421773},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"In Casey Neistat’s documentary, David Dobrik’s act unravels","link":"https://mashable.com/article/david-dobrik-casey-neistat-documentary-under-the-influence","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"David Dobrik looking at a phone, holding his camera in the other hand.\"><p>The essence of David Dobrik, the puckish subject of Casey Neistat&rsquo;s documentary <i>Under the Influence</i>, first crystallizes on screen during a high-pressure pitch to Netflix. It's 2020, and the then 24-year-old sits in front of a laptop, his eyes shining with anticipation as he describes his dream gig: a serotonin supercut of a late-night variety show. \"Do you watch <i>Extreme Makeover: Home Edition</i> or any of those reaction shows?\" he asks representatives from the streaming giant. \"You're really just waiting for that <i>final</i> moment. I kind of wish that there was a show that just skipped all that.\" He gestures urgently, \"I just want to get to that final moment, I want to be there <i>constantly.</i>\"</p><p>Dobrik has made a career out of chasing those \"final moments\" on camera, uploading breakneck, stake-raising romps often enhanced by alcohol and sex to YouTube. His videos have earned him more than <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmh5gdwCx6lN7gEC20leNVA\">18 million subscribers</a>, a show on Discovery+, and enough money to be crowned one of the <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2020/12/18/the-highest-paid-youtube-stars-of-2020/?sh=7467a9bf6e50\">highest-paid YouTube creators</a> of 2020. His success has also made stars of a recurring cast of more than 15 friends collectively called the \"Vlog Squad.\" Most now have their own social media followings, merchandise, and brand sponsorships as a result of their affiliation with Dobrik and appearances in his videos.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647032871.jpg\" alt=\"Casey Neistat, in sunglasses, and David Dobrik pictured in Neistat's New York City studio.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647032871.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647032871.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647032871.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1125\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Casey Neistat and David Dobrik in a still from a May 2017 YouTube video posted to Dobrik's second channel.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: David Dobrik</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p><i>Under the Influence</i> examines Dobrik's explosive rise to fame and inevitable reckoning in 2021 after two career-defining events: a March <u><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/vlog-squad-durte-dom-rape-allegation-david-dobrik-zeglaitis-video-2021-3?_ga=2.75570709.1077159610.1647012740-1795715067.1647012740\">report from Insider</a></u><i> </i>alleging that Dobrik was complicit in the 2018 sexual assault of a college student who appeared in his vlogs; and the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=msWUXM-GQXk\">April reveal</a> of a 2020 accident that left a member of his Vlog Squad with a cracked skull, brain damage, and double vision in one eye.</p><p>The documentary is directed by Neistat, a filmmaker who, from 2015 to 2016, honed a daily vlog style that redefined the genre on YouTube. His snappy, vibrant portraits of his global travels and New York City gambols inspired Dobrik, who found success with his own brand of semi-scripted vlogs combining <i>Jackass</i>-type stunts, stand-up comedy, and reality television. \"Casey [was] my favorite vlogger on YouTube [until] about two years ago, and then I started and I just took over,\" Dobrik joked in a <u><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Oa7BvzZZP0g\">video</a></u> with Neistat from 2017. \"That would be funny if it wasn't the truth,\" Neistat countered.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/casey-neistat-most-expensive-plane-ticket\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Casey Neistat shows us what it's like flying on the 'most expensive plane ticket in the world'\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>Despite Neistat and Dobrik's friendly relationship as contemporaries &mdash; or perhaps because of it &mdash; <i>Under the Influence </i>is a balanced and compelling chronicle of the ways in which power warps, incentivizes, and exploits the motivations of everyone in its orbit.&nbsp;</p><p>Dobrik's content relies mainly on the willingness of the Vlog Squad to perform: as crude caricatures, amateur stunt people, and supportive hype men. Safety and consent seem to come second to getting the shot, if they're considered at all. In the doc, Dobrik notes that a vlog he's filming is \"not funny, unless someone gets hurt.&rdquo; His assistant Natalie Mariduena calls herself \"Safety Sally\" but is later shown pressuring Vlog Squad member Corinna Kopf to remove her shirt while filming a fake party scene in a private jet, even after Kopf expresses her discomfort with the idea.&nbsp;</p><p>The Vlog Squad have made a lot of money by putting their lives on the line and sacrificing their dignity in front of Dobrik's audience of millions. Jason Nash, the oldest Squad member at 48, was a divorcee struggling to support his two children before befriending Dobrik, who he says has made him a millionaire.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647032871.jpg\" alt=\"Dobrik and members of the Vlog Squad, including Nash and Wittek, stand on stage at the 9th Annual Streamy Awards in 2019.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647032871.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647032871.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647032871.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1329\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Dobrik and members of the Vlog Squad, including Nash and Wittek, at the 9th Annual Streamy Awards in 2019.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Alberto E. Rodriguez/Getty Images for dick clark productions</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>\"Are these people sort of being coerced into doing this because of the platform it gives them and the money it gives them?\" asks Kat Tenbarge, the Insider reporter who <u><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/vlog-squad-durte-dom-rape-allegation-david-dobrik-zeglaitis-video-2021-3\">first broke the story</a></u> about the alleged rape of a woman by Vlog Squad member Dominykas Zeglaitis<i>.</i> \"It's only when you think about how that power dynamic is actually affecting those people's decision-making that you can begin to see it as something that's more exploitative.\"</p><p>The documentary includes graphic footage of the result of that decision-making gray area: a 2020 stunt gone wrong. Dobrik is illegally operating an excavator on a shallow lake in Utah. Vlog Squad member Jeff Wittek, who made his first appearance in Dobrik's videos in 2018, is attached to the crane by a thin rope, swinging in a circle, when Dobrik panics and stops the machine. Wittek crashes into its metal arm and dangles upside down from the rope, his head below water, floundering as he waits to be rescued.</p><p>\"People are gonna say you're a fucking idiot for getting on that rope and allowing somebody to control your life like that,\" says Wittek, whose face has been reconstructed and whose brain and eyesight are permanently damaged. \"I wasn't thinking about it like that. I was thinking, 'Let's do what we got to do to make this video great.'\"</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647033814.png\" alt=\"A screenshot from Jeff Wittek's YouTube documentary about his accident. Wittek swings mid-air from the claw of the excavator, seconds before crashing into its metal arm\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-3.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647033814.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-3.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647033814.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647033814.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1103\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">A screenshot from Jeff Wittek's YouTube documentary about the accident that permanently damaged his brain and vision. Wittek is seen here mid-air, seconds before crashing into the excavator's metal arm.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Jeff Wittek</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>Early in the documentary, Neistat asks Dobrik, \"What do you do for a living, David?\" It's 2018, and Dobrik is floppy haired and boyish, with an impish charm. \"I convince people I am having fun,\" Dobrik smiles playfully. \"It's all part of my act.\" As <i>Under the Influence </i>digs deeper, that act begins to feel like a ploy to avoid accountability for the high-intensity, fast-and-loose environment he nurtured on and off camera.&nbsp;</p><p>He seems to brush Wittek's accident off as a result of Wittek's own recklessness. \"Jeff, for some reason, thought that I wasn't getting the shot,\" he tells Neistat. \"So Jeff was like, 'Let's do something more exciting,' and I am always down for more exciting, if someone brings up an idea of doing something cooler, I'm always down for that.\"</p><p>When Neistat asks if the Insider article was \"fair\" Dobrik replies, \"No. This article was written because this place wanted clicks,\" he says while sitting in a $13 million house financed by near-death stunts, a <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ94IBNmj9bBGHgqV1EXCBw\">podcast</a> named Views, and a line of <a href=\"https://www.tubefilter.com/2019/05/22/10000-david-dobrik-fans-368-casey-neistat-clickbait-pop-up-shop-nyc/\">\"clickbait\" merch</a>. He seems to see the woman's account of rape as a pesky rumor, more harmful to him than to her. \"I don't want to respond to it because I don't want to feed the fire of just gossip and hate and drama. I've always wanted to be a person that when you see me, you're just like, laughing or smiling or you're pumped to have me around&hellip; now I'm stained forever with something that I don't necessarily think I should be stained with.\"</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/david-dobrik-vlog-squad-floor-apology-video\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            The enduring art of YouTubers apologizing from the floor\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647035795.png\" alt=\"Dobrik wields a Boring Company flamethrower in a vlog titled &ldquo;THIS STARTED A FIRE IN HIS HOUSE!! (SURPRISE)&rdquo;\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-4.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647035795.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-4.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647035795.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647035795.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1096\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">Dobrik wields a Boring Company flamethrower in a vlog titled &ldquo;THIS STARTED A FIRE IN HIS HOUSE!! (SURPRISE)&rdquo;</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: David Dobrik</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>Have these events been a stain on Dobrik's image? It's hard to say. In June 2021, he made his return to YouTube, Vlog Squad in tow, with videos that usually rack up more than 9 million views each. Sponsors like SeatGeek have returned to finance him. And he's promoting his Discovery+ series <i>Discovering David Dobrik</i>. Though Dobrik continues to spar publicly with Wittek and recently opened up about the <u><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gRMQg2dEo_0&amp;feature=emb_title\">rocky state of his mental health</a></u>, the 25-year-old remains more successful than almost anyone his age. Most importantly, he still has millions of young people following his every move.</p><p>As it weaves a complex tapestry of power, abuse, and coercion, <i>Under the Influence </i>also communicates the scope and seriousness of Dobrik's global influence beyond YouTube. Among other ventures, Dobrik has developed a perfume and a photo-sharing app, and has a pizza chain in the works. He transcends the platform that made him famous, and so does his impact on the people who watch his videos. Netflix ends up passing on Dobrik's show because \"they don't see how a YouTuber can transition into that world.\" Neistat knows that Dobrik already has.&nbsp;</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 13 Mar 2022 02:25:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"c8026e79527f1ca1f2dce70e5812ae45","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn71@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-01-945_ebfea78ce16a399c.webp","destWidth":960,"destHeight":540,"sourceBytes":22990,"destBytes":22990,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn71@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-01-945_ebfea78ce16a399c.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647032871.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn23@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-24-902_91d247353cd5accb.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647032871.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn87@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-25-504_46627b8204dfdc1a.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647033814.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn27@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-24-954_36b5a7fd41d3c857.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00c35ddHD9FfjYru335EVJ5/images-4.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647035795.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-24-934_7fdc6ce48c575d91.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421782},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Jane Campion calls Sam Elliott a 'B-I-T-C-H' over his 'The Power of the Dog' comments","link":"https://mashable.com/article/jane-campion-responds-sam-elliott-sexist-power-dog","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04E0SnTSDYYe1rWdr7kbBZ5/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Jane Campion attends \" the power of dog screening in hollywood><p>It appears the battle over who gets to tell (and critique) the traditionally hyper-masculine stories portrayed in American Westerns is alive and, well, annoyingly sexist in 2022.</p><p>On Saturday, March 12, Academy Award-winning director Jane Campion put actor Sam Elliott on blast for derogatory remarks he made recently about her new cowboy movie <i>The</i> <i>Power of the Dog </i>on the <a href=\"http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episode-1309-sam-elliott\">February 28 episode of Marc Maron's </a><a href=\"http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episode-1309-sam-elliott\"><i>WTF</i></a><a href=\"http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episode-1309-sam-elliott\"> podcast</a>. It happened during an interview with <i>Variety</i> as Campion walked the red carpet line at the 2022 Directors Guild Awards.</p><p>Elliot, a longtime movie cowboy who may be best known for his <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EsKoxi12jbI&amp;ab_channel=pmw8000\">brief appearance in </a><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EsKoxi12jbI&amp;ab_channel=pmw8000\"><i>The Big Lebowski</i></a>, disparaged the 2022 Oscar frontrunner as a \"piece of shit\" for centering on homoerotic themes. The actor continued with other questionable justifications for his dislike of the New Zealand director's take on an American Western, which notably earned Campion one of the top awards at Saturday's ceremony and which also seems like a shoe-in to win at least some of the 12 Academy Award nominations it's up for this year, including one for Best Director.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n    <a class=\"text-gray-600\" href=\"https://twitter.com/Variety/status/1502839949212545028\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Tweet may have been deleted</a>\n</blockquote>\n<p>\"He was being a bit of a B-I-T-C-H,\" <a href=\"https://variety.com/2022/film/news/jane-campion-says-sam-elliott-is-being-a-b-i-t-c-h-with-slam-against-the-power-of-the-dog-1235203098/\">she told Variety when asked about the comments</a>. \"I'm sorry to say it, but Sam's not a cowboy. He's an actor.\"</p><p>Campion went on to call out the underlying misogyny of Elliott questioning her right to subvert the American myths embedded in the Western genre, which he claimed rubbed him the wrong way because she's a foreigner who shot the movie in her home country of New Zealand. \"What the fuck does this woman &mdash; she&rsquo;s a brilliant director by the way, I love her work, previous work &mdash; but what the fuck does this woman from down there know about the American west?\" he raged to Maron.</p><p>As Campion rebutted, though, \"The West is a mythic space and there&rsquo;s a lot of room on the range... And I think it&rsquo;s a little bit sexist.&rdquo;</p><div class=\"w-full max-w-4xl mx-auto mt-8\">\n    <div id=\"video-container-vzfwwpf9Jno\"></div>\n</div>\n\n\n<p>There's a double standard evident in Elliott gatekeeping Campion from the genre on the basis of her being a foreigner. Especially since, as she herself points out, renowned Italian director Sergio Leone, architect of the \"Spaghetti Western,\" famously <a href=\"https://theculturetrip.com/europe/spain/articles/welcome-to-spains-wild-west-town-hollywoods-favourite-filming-location/\">shot some of the genre's most celebrated classics in Spain</a>. </p><p>If anything, the genre's history has been uniquely defined by a global exchange of perspectives on this American mythos, as evidenced by the <a href=\"https://www.thewrap.com/westworld-10-westerns-inspired-by-samurai-movies-from-the-magnificent-seven-photos/\">mutual inspiration shared between Western directors and Japanese Samurai movie directors</a>. Further, Elliott's comments ignore the highly relevant detail that Taiwanese-American filmmaker Ang Lee won an Oscar himself for 2005's even more explicitly homoerotic cowboy movie, <i>Brokeback Mountain</i>.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/the-power-of-the-dog-review\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Benedict Cumberbatch seems wrong for 'The Power of the Dog,' but proves wickedly right\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/where-to-stream-the-2022-oscar-nominees\"><b>How to watch the 2022 Oscar-nominated films from home</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/video/turning-red-pixar\"><b>'Turning Red''s creators on how the coming of age Pixar film captures teen angst</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/best-movies-sundance-now\"><b>15 of the best movies on Sundance Now for when you want something special</b></a></p></li></ul><p>With all that missing context, Elliott's disrespectful dismissal of Campion's take on such an inherently international genre sounds a lot more like grasping for slightly less bigoted excuses explaining why he thinks American Westerns shouldn't be queer or directed by women.</p><p>\"I consider myself a creator,\" Campion continued. \"And I think [Elliott] sees me as a woman or something less first. And I don't appreciate that.\"</p><p></p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 13 Mar 2022 20:50:17 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04E0SnTSDYYe1rWdr7kbBZ5/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"8cc96e8feb1ae469fa9a3a002c51ca98","destWidth":4000,"destHeight":2666,"sourceBytes":634764,"destBytes":634764,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/04E0SnTSDYYe1rWdr7kbBZ5/hero-image.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421740},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Dive into women's history with these 5 free online resources","link":"https://mashable.com/article/free-online-resources-womens-history-month","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06HNx6taqHAacxUZDEeMj7i/hero-image.png\" alt=\"A modern interpretation of Rosie the Riveter.\"><p>March is here and so is Women's History Month in the United States. That means it's time to put on your thinking caps and dive into the deeply rich history of women, both past and present. </p><p>The National Women's History Alliance chooses the month's theme each year, and 2022's focus is \"<u><a href=\"https://nationalwomenshistoryalliance.org/2022-theme/\">Women Providing Healing, Promoting Hope</a></u>.\" According to the organization's website, the choice of theme is \"a tribute to the ceaseless work of caregivers and frontline workers during this ongoing pandemic and also a recognition of the thousands of ways that women of all cultures have provided both healing and hope throughout history.\"</p><p>The origins of Women's History Month <u><a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/womens-history/womens-history-month\">stretch back to 1978</a></u> when the Education Task Force of the Sonoma County (California) Commission on the Status of Women <u><a href=\"https://www.history.com/topics/holidays/womens-history-month\">organized a \"Women's History Week\"</a></u> in March. After an association of women's groups and historians, led by the National Women's History Alliance (then the National Women's History Project), <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/womens-history/womens-history-month#:~:text=Since%20many%20of%20the%20women's,Vote%3A%20Refusing%20to%20Be%20Silenced.\">successfully lobbied for national recognition in 1980</a>, the week of March 8th became National Women&rsquo;s History Week. And in 1987, Congress passed a law declaring March Women's History Month. </p><p>For too long, women's stories and contributions have been left out of our national narrative, says Jennifer Herrera, vice president of external affairs at the National Women's History Museum.</p><p>\"History is only as complete as the stories we teach, share, and learn. Women&rsquo;s history is exciting and inspiring and empowering, and by including women&rsquo;s voices and women&rsquo;s stories, we&rsquo;re telling a more inclusive, representative, and accurate history,\" she says.</p><p>With all that in mind, Mashable reached out to various organizations &mdash; including the National Women's History Museum, the National Women's History Alliance, the New-York Historical Society's Center for Women's History, the National Women's Hall of Fame, and the Smithsonian's Women's History Initiative &mdash; to curate a list of engaging resources that elevate the largely untold stories of underrepresented women. We included digital media that feature a wide range of women from varying cultures, sexualities, classes, and fields. </p><p>Check out the below free online selections and add to your knowledge of how women have shaped the world.</p><h2>1. <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/\">National Women's History Museum</a></h2><p>Feeling as if Washington D.C.'s museums <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/crypt-capitol-rotunda\">ignored</a> women's history, Karen Staser founded the National Women's History Museum in 1996. As an entirely online museum (though, it's working to open a physical location in D.C. in 2022), it's well poised to boost your knowledge about women who contributed to history from afar.</p><p>In the museum's <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/students-and-educators/biographies\">Biographies</a> section, for example, you can learn about both historical and contemporary women who broke barriers, including poet <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/education-resources/biographies/maya-angelou\">Maya Angelou</a>, Supreme Court Justice <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/education-resources/biographies/ruth-bader-ginsburg\">Ruth Bader Ginsburg</a>, the first Native American United States poet laureate <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/education-resources/biographies/joy-harjo\">Joy Harjo</a>, and filmmaker <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/education-resources/biographies/ava-duvernay\">Ava DuVernay</a>. </p><p>Its collection of <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/womens-history/online-exhibits\">online exhibits</a> explore themes within women's history. It also profiles some of the women included within its biographies but includes more visual elements like photos and drawings. You can learn the names and stories of women who were an <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/exhibits/women-nasa\">integral part of NASA</a>, sympathize with the struggles <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/exhibits/representation-hyphen-latinas-fight-womens-suffrage\">Latina and Hispanic suffragists endured</a>, or delve into the fascinating life of abolitionist <a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/exhibits/harriet-tubman\">Harriet Tubman</a>. And that's only a taste of what's available. </p><p>During the COVID-19 lockdown, the museum hosted the Sundays@Home series, which offered virtual education, author talks, panel discussions, and more, all about trailblazing women throughout history. You can still view recordings from past events on the <u><a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/public-programs-events/nwhm-presents/sundayshome\">Sundays@Home webpage</a></u>.</p><p>For 2022, the museum wants visitors to download and use its <u><a href=\"https://www.womenshistory.org/sites/default/files/document/2022-03/NWHM%20Women%27s%20History%20Month%20Resource%20Toolkit%202022_1.pdf\">Women's History Month Toolkit</a></u>, which is intended for everyone \"from individuals, educators, and students, to small nonprofits and large businesses,\" the organization explains. The toolkit includes links to daily activities, online learning resources, both in-person and virtual events for the entire month of March, and even a <u><a href=\"https://embed.solitaired.com/solitaire/womenofthehall\">Women's History version of the game Solitaire</a></u>, created by the National Women's Hall of Fame.</p><h2>2. <a href=\"https://unladylike2020.com/\">UNLADYLIKE2020</a></h2><p>The National Women's History Alliance pointed Mashable toward 26 animated documentary shorts, known collectively as UNLADYLIKE2020. Narrated by <i>The Good Wife </i>actress Julianna Margulies and Lorraine Toussaint from <i>Orange is the New Black, </i>each features a pivotal woman in history and engages readers with its brilliant art, upbeat music, expert interviews, and vivid details. </p><p>Learn about <a href=\"https://unladylike2020.com/profile/louise-arner-boyd/\">Louise Arner Boyd</a>, the first woman to lead scientific expeditions in the Arctic. Or listen to gender non-conforming <a href=\"https://unladylike2020.com/profile/gladys-bentley/\">Gladys Bentley</a>, who sang the blues and played the piano during the Harlem Renaissance. Or cheer on <a href=\"https://unladylike2020.com/profile/gertrude-ederle/\">Gertrude Ederle</a> as you watch her become the first woman to swim the English Channel. She inspired more than 60,000 women in the U.S. to earn Red Cross swimming certificates in the 1920s, a time when most Americans had never swum before.</p><p>Documentary filmmaker Charlotte Mangin created the series because she wanted to share the stories of trailblazing, but relatively unknown women, in time for the centennial anniversary of women's suffrage in 2020. She told Mashable that through the series, she hopes to highlight women who were often the first in their fields, particularly those of color who faced additional hurdles due to racism and sexism.</p><p>Mangin and her team assembled a board of 13 academic advisors to ensure historical accuracy, cultural sensitivity, and help select the 26 women featured in the shorts.</p><p>UNLADYLIKE2020 also offers a free history curriculum and lesson plans based on the 26 women profiled. This content is appropriate for students in grades 6-12. You can access it <a href=\"https://www.pbslearningmedia.org/collection/unladylike2020/\">here</a>. In addition, all videos and learning resources have <u><a href=\"https://unladylike2020.com/unladylike2020-en-espanol/\">Spanish subtitles</a></u> available for viewers. For Spanish versions of the documentary videos, visit the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLH8F0Cu5Vx8IAgcXvi90_hCJH7aUFNT1k\">American masters PBS Youtube channel</a>, the <a href=\"https://ny.pbslearningmedia.org/collection/unladylike2020/\">PBS LearningMedia site</a>, or the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/video/detail/B08X733TXJ/ref=atv_dp_share_cu_r\">PBS Documentaries channel on Amazon Prime</a>. Find accompanying learning resources in Spanish under \"Support Materials for Use with Students\"<b> </b>on<b> </b>the<b> </b>PBS LearningMedia page for each video. </p><h2>3. <a href=\"https://www.nyhistory.org/womens-history\">New-York Historical Society's Center for Women's History</a></h2><p>The Center for Women's History at the New-York Historical Society explores the lives of a wide range of notable women in American history from different cultures, sexualities, classes, and races.</p><p>You can access a guide to the organization's archives online, which allows visitors to search for women's history topics by <a href=\"https://www.nyhistory.org/womens-history/women-in-the-archive/by-era\">eras in American history</a>, or by <a href=\"https://www.nyhistory.org/womens-history/women-in-the-archive/by-theme\">theme</a>, such as arts and literature, education and teaching, and even the social lives of women throughout history. </p><p>Its <a href=\"https://www.nyhistory.org/blogs?category=Women%20at%20the%20Center\">blog</a> discusses a number of fascinating questions and topics, like <a href=\"https://www.nyhistory.org/blogs/wonder-woman-feminist-icon\">if Wonder Woman was actually a feminist icon</a>, the history of the woman <a href=\"https://www.nyhistory.org/blogs/designing-the-n95-mask-sara-little-turnbulls-attention-to-women-consumers\">who pushed for a better medical mask and whose designs inspired the N95 mask</a>, and Black women's integral roles in <a href=\"https://www.nyhistory.org/blogs/juneteenth-and-womens-history\">celebrating Juneteenth</a>.</p><p>The Center also offers a <a href=\"https://wams.nyhistory.org/video-library/\">library</a> of short animated videos that touch on \"inspiring women's stories and key themes.\" For example, learn about <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L3Fyrf6FqRQ\">Thomas(ine) Hall</a>, an intersex person living in colonial Virginia, or <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c7FFRCWWaZM\">Lorenda Holmes</a>, a spy in New York who sabotaged American war efforts during the American Revolution. </p><p>In addition, the center hosts its own free digital curriculum site called <a href=\"https://wams.nyhistory.org/?_ga=2.264457359.180142984.1646929695-1492925239.1646405585\">Women &amp; The American Story</a>, designed for all ages. The site shares a wide scope of women's history beginning with the era of <a href=\"https://wams.nyhistory.org/early-encounters/\">colonization</a>, and it's set to launch its newest unit, The Information Age (1974-2018), sometime this year. The history lessons cover a lot of information, but all of it focuses on the role of women and women's narratives frequently left out of history courses. Lessons like these are great for educators, as well as parents, but are beneficial for just about anyone curious about women's roles in American history. </p><h2>4. <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/\">National Women's Hall of Fame</a></h2><p>The National Women's Hall of Fame, an organization dedicated to \"celebrating the achievements of distinguished American women,\" features a wide range of icons, many of whom bucked societal gender norms to become the first woman, or one of the first, in their fields. You can read about each of these women <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/women-of-the-hall/\">here</a>. </p><p>Inducted women come from fields as diverse as science, government, the arts, business, athletics, education, and philanthropy. For example, read about <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/inductee/gwendolyn-brooks/\">Gwendolyn Brooks</a>, a celebrated poet from Chicago's South Side, <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/inductee/marjory-stoneman-douglas/\">Marjory Stoneman Douglas</a>, a journalist and author who fought to establish the Florida Everglades as a national park, or <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/inductee/althea-gibson/\">Althea Gibson</a>, the first African American tennis player to <a href=\"https://www.loc.gov/wiseguide/july03/tennis.html\">win the All-England Championships at Wimbledon</a>. You can also watch past induction ceremonies <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/watch-past-induction-ceremonies/\">here</a>.</p><p>The National Women's Hall of Fame has also recorded the <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/women-of-the-hall/voices-great-women/\">oral histories</a> of some living inductees.  Listen to former first lady <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/women-of-the-hall/voices-great-women/rosalynn-carter/\">Rosalynn Carter</a> discuss her upbringing, give advice to young children about how to reach their dreams, and encourage them to do whatever they can to help others. Or hear astronomer <a href=\"https://www.womenofthehall.org/women-of-the-hall/voices-great-women/judith-pipher/\">Judith Pipher</a> talk about how she got interested in the field as a child, despite failing her first astronomy test in school.</p><h2>5. <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/\">Smithsonian Women's History Initiative</a></u></h2><p>Part of the greater network of Smithsonian museums and resources, the Smithsonian Institute's Women's History Initiative was tasked with \"<u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/about\">researching, disseminating, and amplifying the histories of American women</a></u>\" after Congress enacted legislation to <u><a href=\"https://www.vox.com/22206468/smithsonian-womens-history-museum-american-latino-omnibus\">create a Smithsonian American Women&rsquo;s History Museum</a></u> in Dec. 2020.</p><p>As part of this mission, the general public was given access to the initiative's work. It's website has a wide array of educational resources, including a deep archive of stories and digitized versions of items in its physical collection, including objects that tell the stories of American women through the years&nbsp; &mdash; like <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/object/cathedral-window-quilt:acm_1995.5009.0003\">a handmade quilt made by artist Viola Canady</a></u>,&nbsp; <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/object/pin-ninety-nines-and-case-sally-ride:nasm_A20140255000\">a pin belonging to astronaut Sally Ride</a></u>, and numerous restored <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/object/group-portrait-five-young-women-outside-breisch-high-school:nmaahc_2012.137.3.51\">photographs</a></u>. You can explore the archive by various themes, like <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/herstory/activism\">Activism</a></u>, <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/herstory/entertainment\">Entertainment</a></u>, and <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/herstory/community\">Community</a></u>. Each theme is accompanied by related collection items, a conversation kit for educators, educational videos, and even music playlists.You can view digitized photos of all of the objects along with their stories <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/collections\">here</a></u>.&nbsp;</p><p>The Smithsonian Institute hosts weekly <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/events\">virtual events</a></u> honoring the achievements of women and girls, as well, including <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/events/detail?trumbaEmbed=eventid%3D155310144%26seotitle%3DFlights-of-Fancy-Story-Time-The-Girl-with-a-Mind-For-Math%26view%3Devent%26-childview%3D%26returnUrl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwomenshistory.si.edu%252Fevents\">children's read-alongs</a></u> and book talks with authors highlighting the stories of women history-makers, like <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/events/detail?trumbaEmbed=eventid%3D158105240%26seotitle%3DHistorically-Speaking-Civil-Rights-Queen-by-Tomiko-Brown-Nagin%26view%3Devent%26-childview%3D%26returnUrl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwomenshistory.si.edu%252Fevents\">Constance Baker Motley</a></u>&nbsp; &mdash; the first African American woman to serve as a federal judge. For virtual children's programming, sign up for the \"<a href=\"https://www.eventbrite.com/e/her-story-how-women-and-girls-transformed-the-world-tickets-267554531807\">Her Story: How Women and Girls Transformed the World!&rdquo;</a> series, which offers three 30-minute programs about women's art, history, and identity. The month's events end with a <u><a href=\"https://womenshistory.si.edu/events/detail?trumbaEmbed=eventid%3D158136318%26seotitle%3DWikipedia-Edit-a-thon-Increasing-the-Representation-of-Women-in-STEM%26view%3Devent%26-childview%3D%26returnUrl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwomenshistory.si.edu%252Fevents\">Wikipedia Edit-a-thon</a></u> on March 31, in which attendees will learn how to edit Wikipedia entries together in order to update articles related to women in STEM. The event is part of the <u><a href=\"https://ifthenexhibit.org/\">#IfThenSheCan</a></u> exhibit, a collection of 120 statues of women in STEM displayed around the grounds of Smithsonian museums on the National Mall.</p><p>All of these resources will likely expand the women that come to mind when you think about historical milestones and, perhaps, inspire the women and girls in your life to realize greatness has no limits.</p><p class=\"mx-auto\">\n   <em><strong>UPDATE: Mar. 11, 2022, 2:15 p.m. EST </strong>This story was originally published in 2021, and was updated with new resources and information in 2022. Additional reporting by Chase Dibenedetto.</em>\n</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06HNx6taqHAacxUZDEeMj7i/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"116fc71105c77a5215212d8c27019249","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn40@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-02-027_44a557dc441fe6c6.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":1162539,"destBytes":128120,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/06HNx6taqHAacxUZDEeMj7i/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn40@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-02-027_44a557dc441fe6c6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421764},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"The best dating sites to help you find a connection","link":"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-dating-sites-uk","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/029CbmGYCdlWmIbIMpW3O40/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Couple holding hands\"><p>If you've <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/7-best-online-dating-sites\">dated</a> in the past 20 years, it's likely that you've encountered a dating site or app. You might have even encountered a few of them (no judgement here). As our lives have moved online in recent years, digital dating has allowed us more freedom to meet others how we choose.</p><p>The only real issue with online dating is that there are a lot of sites and apps out there to consider. With so many options, it can be really tricky knowing where to find the best crop of potential partners. Each of the dating apps on offer has a selection of features that will matter differently to you depending on your lifestyle, what you want, and what's most important to you. It's simply a case of finding something that works for you.</p><h2><b>What should you include on your dating profile?</b></h2><p>In many cases, the amount of information you can get from <a href=\"https://sociologicalscience.com/download/vol-4/september/SocSci_v4_490to510.pdf\">detailed profiles</a> is more than what would be covered in the \"traditional\" period of getting to know someone. The whole \"do you want to have babies\" thing is a huge piece of information that could decide your future with someone, but it's very possible that such a weighty subject won't be brought up until you've caught feelings or met their parents.</p><p>However, many dating sites ask about kids &mdash;&nbsp;whether you want them or already have them &mdash;&nbsp;during the sign-up process (as well as other potentially-awkward questions), and probably won't match you with someone who has different goals than you do. Similarly, some of OkCupid's matching is rooted in political and social justice views. Will you find out if someone opposes vaccinations on the first date? Probably not, but OkCupid won't send you to get a beer with someone you'd start a fight with on Facebook.</p><p>Plus, it's always nice when your current booty call doesn't suck as a person. Even if you're just in it for <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-hookup-apps-uk\">something frisky and fleeting</a>, the personality you can gather from a simple bio might let you know who's worthy of your time &mdash;&nbsp;even if that time is strictly within \"You up?\" hours.</p><p>Julie Spira, dating expert and CEO of <a href=\"https://cyberdatingexpert.com/\">cyberdatingexpert.com</a>, says it wasn't always so easy to meet people online. She would know &mdash;&nbsp;she's been helping clients find love online since 1994.</p><p>\"People didn&rsquo;t have mobile phones and laptops, and the process was people would go home, log on slowly, see who had written to them and write back,\" she says. \"The courtship process was a lot slower, so it took quite a while to get from the first interaction to actually going on a date. Plus in those days, there was a stigma associated with online dating. You did not tell people you met your spouse, or partner, or even a date online.\"</p><p>The rhetoric has clearly come a long way since then, and the digital dating landscape has evolved with people's changing needs. OkCupid realised that the way a potential match votes matters romantically to a lot of people. Women were tired of men blowing up their messages with creepy first-liners, so Bumble came along. \"Tindering\" is now a verb, but it's far from your only option.</p><h2><b>What are the benefits of using a dating site?</b></h2><p>If you're lucky, you'll find a perfect match right away, but that's not usually how it works out. While you do know more about online matches than you would a stranger you met in person, there's only so much a quick dating profile can tell you.</p><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-dating-sites-women-uk\">Dating sites and apps</a> can make finding a compatible potential partner easier, but it's still dating. Not everyone is going to be a gem. While apps like Bumble let you display what kind of relationship you're looking for, others don't, so you might end up going out with someone only to realise you're not looking for the same thing.</p><p>That said, there will be people on dating sites who are looking for the same thing as you. And using a dating app to find them is a hell of a lot easier than going up to strangers on the street or in bars and asking if they're looking for a relationship. Apps and dating websites expand your dating pool and allow you to meet people with similar interests you might not run into naturally in your everyday life. You just might need a little patience to find The One.</p><p>We haven't reached full <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/future-online-dating\">AI-based or gene matchmaking</a> just yet, but many modern features facilitating more meaningful matches (or quicker, safer hookups) have sprung up even in the past five years.</p><h2><b>What is the best dating site?</b></h2><p>Whether you're looking for something specific or a site that ticks every box, we have produced a handy guide that gives you all of the essential details. To ensure that you find a date in time for the weekend, we have tracked down a selection of the best dating sites for everyone, including popular sites like <a href=\"https://r.zdbb.net/u/7n7p\">Match</a>, <a href=\"https://r.zdbb.net/u/bboa\">eharmony</a>, and <a href=\"https://r.zdbb.net/u/9udw\">EliteSingles</a>. </p><p>All you need to do is check out these dating apps and pick a favourite from the bunch. Once you've made your decision, you just need to get out there and actually date someone. 27ba3b3033a.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03PRJm5mhCorbJLJPygs26I/images-9.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn51@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-26-189_d41cbe6bfd1fc4bf.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03PRJm5mhCorbJLJPygs26I/images-10.fit_lim.size_256x.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn32@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-25-197_5cebf19ff710815e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421788},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Steam Deck's hidden shortcuts make it easy to snap screenshots and call up the keyboard","link":"https://mashable.com/article/steam-deck-shortcuts-how-to","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/008v1OvybtqhgSQug8MAmNd/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"A photo of Valve's Steam Deck sitting on a wooden table.\"><p>Valve's Steam Deck is an impressive piece of gaming tech, but there's definitely a learning curve.</p><p>Even if you're familiar with the Steam store, and its TV-friendly \"Big Picture Mode\" that the Deck's SteamOS resembles, it still takes time to figure out how basic features from Steam on PC translate to the portable device's gamepad-style controls. It's easier than you might think at first, though.</p><p>Valve doesn't make it apparent up front, but Steam Deck users have a ton of button-based shortcuts they can lean on for help. All of those shortcuts involve holding the \"Steam\" button in tandem with one of the other buttons to produce different effects. Like I said, easy stuff.</p><p>The most important one to know <i>just</i> involves the Steam button. If you press and hold it at virtually any time, a whole list of all the available shortcuts pops up until you release the button. So for those times when you forget &mdash; like I have numerous times &mdash; you can refresh your memory painlessly, without having to turn to an internet search engine.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/008v1OvybtqhgSQug8MAmNd/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647200326.png\" alt=\"A screenshot of the Steam Deck's list of shortcut commands.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/008v1OvybtqhgSQug8MAmNd/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1647200326.png 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/008v1OvybtqhgSQug8MAmNd/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1647200326.png 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/008v1OvybtqhgSQug8MAmNd/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647200326.png 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1250\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Valve / Screenshot by Mashable</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>In terms of what I've used most, the Take Screenshot shortcut (Steam + R1) captures whatever is on your screen and loads it into an on-device library. If you want to then make your screenshots accessible on a computer (or some other device where you have Steam installed), you can easily send them to the cloud. Head to the Steam Deck's Media menu, highlight the screenshot you want to upload, press the Options button, and select Upload. That's it!</p><p>The virtual keyboard shortcut is also extremely useful for the many Steam Deck-supported games that require occasional typing. Just press Steam + X to summon a smartphone-style keyboard in a flash.</p><p>There's one catch, however. The virtual keyboard only works when Steam is actually running. In the standard SteamOS mode, that means you can call up the keyboard from virtually anywhere. But the feature is more limited if you're using the Windows-style \"Desktop Mode.\" It still works in apps like Chrome, but you'll need to have the desktop version of Steam running in the background (there's an icon for it on the desktop). You probably won't use the feature too often in desktop, but it's useful for those times when you want to install non-Steam apps like Discord.</p><p>You can also tweak the screen brightness in an instant &mdash; which can help preserve battery life &mdash; by holding that Steam button and tilting the left thumbstick up or down to increase or decrease brightness, respectively. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/review/steam-deck-review-valve\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            Valve's big swing with Steam Deck is a hit, but it's not a home run\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<ul><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/steam-deck-how-to-check-compatible-games\"><b>How to see if your favorite games will work on Steam Deck</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/itchio-what-is-it\"><b>What is Itch.io? This oddball indie games store is a vital source of creativity.</b></a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/fortnite-apple-appeals-blacklist\"><b>Apple will blacklist 'Fortnite' from App Store for years, says Epic Games CEO</b></a></p></li></ul><p>The last big one to remember: Steam + B (long press), which is the Steam Deck equivalent of Force Quit on Mac and Alt + F4 on Windows. Games mess up from time to time, and Steam Deck won't always be able to fix it for you. It's easy enough to reboot by pressing and holding the Power button, but the Steam + B \"Force Game Shutdown\" command gives you another option. I've used it plenty.</p><p>Take the time to dig through the menus if you've been lucky enough to score a Steam Deck. There's a lot of not-so-visible features that are easy to miss if you're not looking for them.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sun, 13 Mar 2022 19:39:39 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/008v1OvybtqhgSQug8MAmNd/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"c1bf60852cc1e9447e6a9f12b7b1a33c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn89@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-03-061_e6c22bf83d7176de.webp","destWidth":2500,"destHeight":1406,"sourceBytes":438472,"destBytes":438472,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/008v1OvybtqhgSQug8MAmNd/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn89@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-03-061_e6c22bf83d7176de.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/008v1OvybtqhgSQug8MAmNd/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1647200326.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn24@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-25-299_3b36ec27b1510959.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421740},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Save 37% on a Dyson dupe cordless vacuum that rivals the real thing","link":"https://mashable.com/deals/march-13-jashen-cordless-vacuum-cleaner","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00GidVEjlE2myJ2pxVRLBom/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Person using blue cordless vacuum cleaner to clean white floor in kitchen\"><p><b>TL;DR: </b>The <a href=\"https://zdcs.link/WlWWN\">JASHEN V18 350W Cordless Vacuum Cleaner</a> is on sale for $209.99 as of March 13, making it 37% off its regular price of $336.</p><hr><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-dyson-vacuums\">Dyson vacuums</a> might have a cool factor associated with them, but it&rsquo;s hard to justify their prices. Russia.</p><p>The latest in line are all payment-based Google and YouTube services in Russia, as the country's <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/ukraine-russia-war-who-to-follow-misinformation\">war with Ukraine</a> continues. <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/youtube-google-play-suspend-payment-based-services-russia-2022-03-10/\">Reuters, which first reported the news</a>, says it's due to Western sanctions, which are starting \"to pose banking challenges in the country.\"</p><p>This has numerous consequences for users of Google services in Russia. Perhaps the most important is the fact that users in Russia won't be able to buy apps or games from the Google Play store. </p><p>\"Due to payment system disruption, we will be pausing Google Play&rsquo;s billing system for users in Russia in the coming days. This means users will not be able to purchase apps and games, make subscription payments or conduct any in-app purchases of digital goods using Google Play in Russia,\" said <a href=\"https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/11950272?hl=en\">Google in a notice</a> on its help pages. </p><p>Free apps and games are still available for users in Russia, however. </p><p>Similarly, monetization features on YouTube have also been paused. </p><p>\"We've recently paused all Google and YouTube ads in Russia. As a follow-up, we're now extending this pause to all our monetization features, including YouTube Premium, Channel Memberships, Super Chat and Merchandise, for viewers in Russia,\" YouTube told Reuters in a statement. </p><p>Reuters says that YouTube channels in Russia will \"still be able to generate revenue from viewers outside of Russia through ads and paid features,\" though this will surely be a big hit for Russia's YouTubers. </p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/social-media-misinformation-ukraine-russia\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            What social media platforms are doing to stop misinformation about Russia's invasion of Ukraine\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>The decision follows similar steps taken by other step giants including <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/apple-stops-product-sales-russia\">Apple</a>, <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/microsoft-suspends-sales-russia\">Microsoft</a>, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/spotify-closes-its-office-russia-response-attack-ukraine-2022-03-02/\">Spotify</a>, and <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/airbnb-russia-suspends-operations-ukraine\">Airbnb</a>, all of which came as a result of Russia's attack on Ukraine in February. You just open the app and take a photo (or use an existing one) and let your new plant encyclopedia go to work. If the plant is successfully recognized, it&rsquo;ll pop up with a screen to learn more. You&rsquo;ll get recommendations on how to choose soil, water, and fertilizer for your plant, how to set appropriate temperature conditions, and more.
