14:44:05 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"67402ad0010ae9c501478ceb7fb591cb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn31@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-02-835_ce6b1ec61697cc3a.webp","destWidth":2121,"destHeight":1414,"sourceBytes":1257858,"destBytes":1257858,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn31@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-02-835_ce6b1ec61697cc3a.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/images-1.fit_lim.size_256x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn47@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-26-211_018ba79e8d1e1faf.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/images-2.fit_lim.size_256x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn88@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-25-137_1eec330646c42d25.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/images-3.fit_lim.size_256x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn23@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-26-329_539762771b956bd4.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/images-4.fit_lim.size_256x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn51@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-24-843_011604560f77e10f.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/images-5.fit_lim.size_256x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn60@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-26-133_b64bd72a889c6644.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/images-7.fit_lim.size_256x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn66@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-25-620_0b437aca94d73267.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/images-8.fit_lim.size_256x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn95@2020_1/2022/03/14/08-27-25-430_e9147bbbfc7ab048.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/00FvU6ZtugtCtlWUwdephCF/images-6.fit_lim.size_256x.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn80@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-25-111_1a6ec4a3cde1fe9e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421776},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"'Upload' Season 2 review: The *other* afterlife comedy comes into its own","link":"https://mashable.com/article/upload-season-2-amazon-prime-review","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Two Black women (Andy Allo and Zainab Johnson) carry two iPads around their necks, showing the faces of two men.\"><p>When the first season of <i>Upload</i> premiered on Amazon Prime in 2020, creator Greg Daniels and some of his cast members <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/upload-greg-daniels-interview-amazon-prime\">told Mashable he had an uncanny gift for accidental prediction</a></u>. Elements of the show, set in a 2033 where humans' digital selves can be uploaded to a virtual reality afterlife, kept popping up in real life during filming &mdash; like a joke about hospitals having \"vape lung\" units that was written before <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/quit-vaping\">the phenomenon made real-life headlines</a></u>.</p><p>The idea of being able to whisk ourselves into a digital world where our every whim can be coded or gestured into being, and our vulnerable human bodies left behind in meatspace, has existed <u><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Man_Who_Awoke\">since at least the 1930s</a></u>. Nearly a century later, we're still years off the staggering computing power that would allow fully immersive VR, let alone transferring fully functioning human consciousness into a server. But between the release of the first season of <i>Upload</i> and the second, which arrives on Amazon Prime today, the world's most powerful tech company announced &mdash; <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/iceland-roasts-mark-zuckerberg-meta-with-icelandverse\">to much derision</a></u> &mdash; a pivot to focus on the future of just such a product.</p><p>Because let's face it: <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/what-is-the-metaverse-explainer\">the Metaverse</a> is a product. For all Mark Zuckerberg's dead-eyed utopian promises, accessing whatever the Metaverse ends up becoming will require expensive equipment, connections, data plans &mdash; and that's all before you get in there and need to spend <u><a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/nike-metaverse-rtfkt-nikeland-roblox-nft/\">real-world money on digital sneakers</a></u> or rack up a very macro number of microtransactions to make your experience worthwhile.&nbsp;</p><p>The future of our virtual worlds will be shaped not by what's possible, but what's profitable, and <i>Upload</i> gets that.</p><p>The series has been <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/upload-greg-daniels-interview-amazon-prime\">compared relentlessly to </a></u><u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/upload-greg-daniels-interview-amazon-prime\"><i>The Good Place</i></a></u>, that other sprightly and sweet afterlife comedy by Daniels' <i>Parks and Recreation</i> co-creator Mike Schur (the two projects were conceived independently, but <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/upload-greg-daniels-interview-amazon-prime\">Schur's happened to get made first</a></u>). But it's also regularly likened to the <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/black-mirror-pessimism-ranking-dread\">notoriously bleak British sci-fi series </a><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/black-mirror-pessimism-ranking-dread\"><i>Black Mirror</i></a>, and that's because both shows extrapolate the ethical and social dilemmas of technology in a way that feels plausible because their creators understand how we use technology now. We store parts of ourselves in the cloud, we trade crumb after crumb of control over our days for a little convenience, and life also continues to exist outside of tech in much the same way it always does.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/what-is-the-metaverse-explainer\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            What is the metaverse? A (kind of) simple explainer\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>The world of <i>Upload</i> doesn't have one giant company that controls everything, because neither do we. Horizen &mdash; the show's fictional tech company offering digital afterlives at a range of price points, not to be confused with <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/facebook-rebrands-social-vr-horizon-worlds\">Meta-formerly-Facebook's actual VR project</a></u> Horizon Worlds &mdash; is the dominant player in the digital afterlife space. Protagonist Nathan Brown (Robbie Amell), a benignly self-absorbed startup bro, was uploaded to Horizen's deluxe Lake View facility by his intense, wealthy girlfriend Ingrid (Allegra Edwards) after being severely injured in a self-driving car crash. Season 1 followed Nathan and his living Horizen customer service rep Nora (Andy Allo) as they investigated his death &mdash; in this 2033, self-driving cars are infallible (<u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/tesla-fsd-phantom-braking\">ha!</a></u>), so they deduce that he was murdered because of his work on a free alternative that threatens the digital afterlife industry's billion-dollar bottom line.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646987555.jpg\" alt=\"An eager woman in an elegant white dress and a concerned man in a grey sweatsuit stand in a hotel lobby.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646987555.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646987555.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646987555.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1331\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Amazon Studios</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>As Season 2 begins, Nathan is trapped in \"2 Gig\" &mdash; the grey-sweatsuited, data-limited steerage deck of Lake View's luxury afterlife cruise liner &mdash; having just been surprised by Ingrid's arrival and gleeful announcement that she has uploaded herself to join him and whisk him back to first class. Given that, for some reason, uploading involves having your head literally blown up, he now feels he owes an incalculable debt to Ingrid on top of the fact that she's paying his bills, and so can't explore his blossoming romance with Nora. But once he gets back to his all-expenses-paid version of heaven, his brief experience in 2 Gig makes Nathan even more determined to break down the financial barriers to afterlife access.&nbsp;</p><p>In the world of the living, as Nora tries to untangle the conspiracy against Nathan and discovers a one-percenter scheme that looks beyond mere profit, she gets caught up with a group of anti-technology activists who oppose digital afterlives accessible only to the wealthy. Their catchphrase? \"Delete the rich.\"&nbsp;</p><p>It's about as subtle as an auto-playing ad popup, but then again, this season was put together during a period where the gulf between the privileged and the less-so was starker than ever. While those of us with office jobs complained (validly!) about our Zoom fatigue and our shitty sourdough and loneliness, millions of others were forced to keep the world running at enormous personal risk, or left without income or support at all. Sci-fi stories don't tend to be extraordinarily subtle when it comes to inserting real-life resonance &mdash; it's almost entirely the point.</p><q>\n    Sci-fi stories don't tend to be extraordinarily subtle when it comes to inserting real-life resonance &mdash; it's almost entirely the point.\n    </q>\n<p>Amell's Nathan is about as generic a protagonist as you could ask for, but he and the luminous Allo have a sweet, easy rapport that sells Nathan and Nora's connection and the season's poignant love triangle. Storylines where different characters are called to inhabit others' digital avatars draw some wonderfully funny and affecting performances out of the cast &mdash; Edwards, especially, is given a chance to flex her comedy muscles and flesh out Ingrid's controlling-girlfriend archetype with some real pathos. (Her arc here bears a fair bit of resemblance to that of <i>Jane The Virgin</i>'s Petra Solano, another cartoonish rich-bitch whose scheming conceals an emotionally stunted inner child.) </p><p>And as Nora's pragmatic, permanently exasperated work BFF Aleesha, Zainab Johnson emerges as the season's MVP; whether she's dismissing an annoying intern or developing convincing, charming chemistry with a dead man on an iPad, the show is all the better for having expanded her role. Most crucially, it's at its best when it lets itself get properly weird in the back half of this season.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646987555.jpg\" alt=\"A woman and a man in practical jackets stand in a garden, looking worried.\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-3.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646987555.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-3.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646987555.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646987555.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1331\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\"></span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Amazon Studios</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>There are sometimes nods to outdated <i>Back To The Future</i>-style predictions &mdash; like an absurd office coffee machine that 3D-prints hot mugs of the brown bean juice, including the mug, all at once &mdash; and a lazy running joke about fast food chains buying up IRL social media platforms. (PaneraTok? OK, fine. KFCTwitter? C'mon.) But where <i>Upload</i>'s cheerful techno-cynicism shines most is in the smaller moments. When Nora arrives at a tech-free \"Ludd\" commune in the forest to hide from the corporate conspirators who had Nathan killed, she marvels at their \"unprinted\" vegetables: \"I had a window box [at home],\" she says ruefully, \"but my Monsanto seeds wouldn't grow without a code.\"</p><p><i>Upload</i> still doesn't feel as urgent or as existential as some of the other shows that explore similar questions: <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/years-and-years-why-you-should-watch\">What's on the other side of death</a></u>? <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/severance-apple-tv-plus-review\">Who owns your </a></u><u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/severance-apple-tv-plus-review\"><i>self</i></a></u>, when you outsource or loan it to technology and corporations in small but irreversible ways? <u><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/years-and-years-why-you-should-watch\">Is technology a net good</a></u> if its benefits will only be available to those privileged enough to afford them? But ultimately, <i>Upload</i> doesn't need to be focused on solving those dilemmas. It's similar to <i>The Good Place</i>, but not only because it's a high-concept comedy about the afterlife &mdash; it has that show's same faith that given the opportunity, people will want to take care of each other, no matter how many new ways we invent to to make life hell.</p><p><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/pVnol\"><i>Upload is now streaming on Amazon Prime Video.</i></a></p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Mar 2022 10:35:16 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"d9339b83c145b8041c04d1c6af81cc7e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn85@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-03-386_925e2409865876e2.webp","destWidth":700,"destHeight":484,"sourceBytes":80561,"destBytes":32348,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn85@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-03-386_925e2409865876e2.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646987555.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn15@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-24-883_7a2d55fd2b259165.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/02MjCfddnaOorjVHWNkvGze/images-3.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646987555.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn95@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-24-974_4b73e670104296d9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421767},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"The best strimmers for tidying up your garden","link":"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-strimmers-uk","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/03B3P1HGivoIiv5ebmt4NWk/hero-image.png\" alt=\"A man strimming his garden lawn\"><p>As all gardeners know &mdash; whether you're a green-fingered casual or landscaping professional &ndash; the secret to a <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-lawn-mowers-uk\">beautiful lawn</a> is blood, sweat, and tears. Well, that and tooling up with the best gear available.</p><p>Investing in good tools is absolutely essential. The lawn mower is probably the most important purchase a gardener will make, but the strimmer is a close second. Grass strimmers, also known as trimmers, keep your lawn edges, borders, and even the lawn itself tidy by cutting back weeds and long patches of grass. Basically, these products handle everything that your lawn mower can't reach. </p><p>But unless you&rsquo;re a gardening expert, choosing a strimmer can be tricky. Here&rsquo;s some must-know info if you&rsquo;re looking to buy a new strimmer.</p><h2><b>Are there different types of lawn strimmer?</b></h2><p>The main types you&rsquo;ll have to choose from are electric strimmers that plug into the mains, cordless strimmers powered by rechargeable batteries, and petrol strimmers which give you extra power.&nbsp;The best option for you really depends on the size of your garden and its current state.</p><h2><b>Corded vs. cordless strimmers &ndash; which are best?</b></h2><p>It&rsquo;s less a case of which is best and more which type best suits your <a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-robot-lawnmowers-uk\">garden and gardening needs</a>. Corded strimmers are generally cheapest and best for casual use, but they&rsquo;re slightly limited by the cord. You&rsquo;ll need easy access to a mains outlet &mdash; and you must check that the cord reaches far enough to cover your lawn.</p><p>Cordless strimmers are built for convenience &mdash; lightweight and easy to handle around the garden. The main drawback is that you have to recharge them after use. Look for a model with battery power to match the size of your garden.&nbsp;</p><h2><b>What are the benefits of a petrol strimmer?</b></h2><p><a href=\"https://mashable.com/uk/roundup/best-petrol-lawn-mowers-uk\">Petrol-powered</a> strimmers promise powerful strimming. If you have a large garden, or particularly tough grass and weeds to cut through, a petrol strimmer is likely the best option. They&rsquo;re not always the best option for more delicate or detailed jobs, such as edging.</p><h2><b>What is lawn edging?</b></h2><p>Lawn edging is pretty much as it sounds &mdash; the art of keeping your lawn neat, tidy, and even styled. It can be surprisingly hard to do if you don&rsquo;t have the right tools. Some strimmers are built for both regular trimming and edging, or may have a cutting head that converts into an edger.</p><h2><b>What are the most important lawn strimmer features?</b></h2><p>As well as edging, there are other handy features that can elevate a strimmer from good to great. They can include a telescopic shaft, adjustable handle, shoulder strap, and brush cutter for tackling brambles and shrubbery.</p><p>Another feature that can be a deal-breaker for some gardeners is an automatic line extension. The &ldquo;line&rdquo; is the thing that whips around quickly and does the actual business of grass cutting (though some strimmers use a blade). The lines sometimes break, so you need a system to replace the line mid-cut. Strimmers may have an automatic line feed, or can extend the line by you pressing a button &mdash; or even by giving the head a bump on the ground.</p><h2><b>What is the best lawn strimmer?</b></h2><p>There are plenty of impressive models out there from top brands like Bosch and Flymo. To help you find the right strimmer for you and your garden, we have lined up a selection of the very best models. We have considered customer reviews, specifications, and features to give you a clear idea of what's out there.</p><p>These are the best strimmers in 2022.</p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 10:12:08 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/03B3P1HGivoIiv5ebmt4NWk/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"f0345b9b528b7361eae7aea996c0f5fc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn3@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-04-603_e7c1227e87ede1b8.webp","destWidth":6000,"destHeight":3375,"sourceBytes":44168699,"destBytes":739108,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/roundups/03B3P1HGivoIiv5ebmt4NWk/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn3@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-04-603_e7c1227e87ede1b8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421779},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"I saw my family in the women of ‘Turning Red’","link":"https://mashable.com/article/turning-red-disney-pixar-thanks-i-love-it","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03RcIwiXMzwSrs9pjG2h6Z9/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"Animated still of a mother and daughter looking at a notebook in \" turning red.><p>I knew that <a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/turning-red-review\">Disney&rsquo;s </a><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/turning-red-review\"><i>Turning Red </i></a><a href=\"https://mashable.com/article/turning-red-review\">is about teen angst in 2002,</a><i> </i>but I did not expect to relate to it as deeply as I did.</p><p><i>Turning Red</i> follows 13-year-old Chinese-Canadian, Meilin Lee (Rosalie Chiang) as she grapples with her changing body &mdash; not in the usual ways, but in the form of the giant red panda, which she turns into if she feels any strong emotion. It turns out that the panda problem runs in the family, and that all the women in her family, including Mei&rsquo;s mother (Sandra Oh), have faced it.</p><p>I grew up in an almost overwhelmingly female family (not overwhelming for me, but maybe for the odd boy cousin). My mother has a sister; my grandmother had six. Many of them had daughters, usually in pairs, who went on to have more daughters. When my cousin gave birth to a boy in 2018, the first in 14 years, another cousin told me nervously: &ldquo;We don&rsquo;t <i>have</i> boys!&rdquo;</p><p>Even as an only child living far away from my extended family, I always felt close to them &mdash; just like Mei. When the awkwardness of my teen years set in, any cousin or aunt was a phone call away, and my mother became a trusted confidante &mdash; when most people I knew were running fully in the opposite direction from their parents. I have seen countless shows and movies about teenagers who act out and rebel, but barely any where the kid unironically spends time with her parents or doesn't do anything more scandalous than lie about going to a concert (Mei and I kept things pretty PG, but I think I speak for us both when I say: No regrets).</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03RcIwiXMzwSrs9pjG2h6Z9/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646931119.jpg\" alt='An animated teen girl cringes in a classroom while her mother waves from outside, dodging a security guard; a still from \"Turning Red.\"' srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03RcIwiXMzwSrs9pjG2h6Z9/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646931119.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03RcIwiXMzwSrs9pjG2h6Z9/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646931119.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03RcIwiXMzwSrs9pjG2h6Z9/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646931119.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1161\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">My mom picking me up early to get on a plane to India, probably</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: DIsney</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>When Meilin's red panda arrives, her mother tells the other women in the family. They share stories of their own pandas and gather to help her expel hers in a ceremony. Mei might want to get out of the house to see her friends and raise money for concert tickets, but she isn't generally averse to her family. The support isn't lost on her, nor is her unique circumstance and having people to share it with. As Mei grows reluctant to part with her panda, she never questions the other women's decision to stifle it, nor questions her place in the family.</p><p>Watching Mei gather with her mother and aunts took me instantly back to every big family gathering over the years &mdash; birthdays, weddings, and Bengali ceremonies where babies eat solid food for the first time. Wherever we meet suddenly echoes with the voices of sisters and cousins talking, laughing, fighting, and ordering each other around. We fall naturally into the roles we held as children or the last time we were in that home, we share stories that span decades and continents. When Mei's family squeeze in around the dining table at her Toronto home, I felt a physical pang for the counterparts in my life, all oceans away until we meet next. </p><q>\n    How incredible that I grew up thousands of miles away from some of the people I love and trust most in the world.\n    </q>\n<p><i>Turning Red</i> masterfully weaves together many threads; early 2000s nostalgia, boy band fever, the unique horror of being a teenage girl, and female familial relationships. I did not expect it to leave me warmly thinking about distant family members and wanting to call my mom (who would call me within hours asking about our Netflix password). The aunties and grandmother aren't central to the film, but they struck a chord that will stay with me for a long time.</p><p>My mom and her cousins grew up in the same city, no one more than an hour away from each other. I sometimes wonder what they were all thinking when they grew up, dreamt big, and scattered across the world. They can&rsquo;t have been thinking about the challenges of raising Indian children in unfamiliar countries, of being custodians of an entire culture, or of a generation of cousins that would sometimes not see each other for years. I say this with admiration, not resentment; for how remarkable is it that Ma&rsquo;s family managed to stay this close despite time and distance? How incredible, that I grew up thousands of miles away from some of the people I love and trust most in the world, and that she made that possible.&nbsp;</p><p>In <i>Turning Red</i>, Mei grapples with growing up and growing away from her family, but she realizes that it&rsquo;s ultimately her own choice. She may spend less time with her mother or share life&rsquo;s daily gossip with her friends, but there are bonds that can&rsquo;t be broken. At the end of the day, she shares her roots &mdash; including that fluffy red bear &mdash; with a core of mighty women who will spring to her aid at any moment, and nothing can take that away from her.</p><div class=\"content-block-mashable-video mt-8\">\n    <div id=\"mashable-video-container-Bblyby2xoV\"></div>\n</div>\n<p><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/dY48j\"><i>Turning Red</i></a><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/dY48j\"> is now streaming on Disney+. </a></p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Mar 2022 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03RcIwiXMzwSrs9pjG2h6Z9/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"5ea2b5a0f2e1657f1fc155d166442816","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn23@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-03-362_f653d9182de99111.webp","destWidth":1868,"destHeight":1037,"sourceBytes":240072,"destBytes":240072,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03RcIwiXMzwSrs9pjG2h6Z9/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn23@2020_4/2022/03/14/08-27-03-362_f653d9182de99111.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/articles/03RcIwiXMzwSrs9pjG2h6Z9/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646931119.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn19@2020_3/2022/03/14/08-27-26-324_8b60402e5f76ddc6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421750},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"Cole Sprouse and Lana Condor head to Mars in 'Moonshot' trailer","link":"https://mashable.com/video/moonshot-trailer-cole-sprouse-lana-condor","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/01C5x7rg1pa7w3tMjxpTaLE/hero-image.jpg\" alt=\"A young man and woman sit across from each other at a diner.\"><p>Teen movie and TV royalty join forces in HBO Max's <i>Moonshot</i>. Lana Condor (<i>To All the Boys I've Loved Before</i>) and Cole Sprouse (<i>Riverdale</i>) play two lovelorn twentysomethings on an interplanetary trip.</p><p>Sophie (Condor) is headed to Mars to see her long-distance boyfriend Calvin (Mason Gooding), while Walt (Sprouse) is following his dream girl Ginny (Emily Rudd) to the stars. The two team up to make sure they can reunite with their significant others, but with a long space journey ahead of them, anything can happen.</p><p><a href=\"https://play.hbomax.com/\"><i>Moonshot </i></a><a href=\"https://play.hbomax.com/\">is streaming on HBO Max March 31.</a></p>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Mar 2022 17:59:51 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/01C5x7rg1pa7w3tMjxpTaLE/hero-image.jpg","linkMd5":"6a8a356e648eda0e17697a3306bb9333","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn87@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-01-896_acb6b0fb8fc6f241.webp","destWidth":480,"destHeight":360,"sourceBytes":24480,"destBytes":16678,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/videos/01C5x7rg1pa7w3tMjxpTaLE/hero-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn87@2020_5/2022/03/14/08-27-01-896_acb6b0fb8fc6f241.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421773},{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","title":"The PopBabies portable blender is decent for on-the-go smoothies","link":"https://mashable.com/review/popbabies-portable-blender","description":"<img src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/hero-image.png\" alt=\"left: blender with ingredients, right: blender with blended smoothie\"><p>Like many people, my New Year&rsquo;s resolution was to be healthier. I&rsquo;ve spent way more time than I&rsquo;d like to admit at the bottom of a carton of ice cream, sitting on the couch watching <i>Selling Sunset</i>. I wanted to exercise more and eat healthier &mdash; more specifically, I wanted to get a <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-blenders-for-smoothies\">blender to make smoothies</a>. But, because I live in a small apartment with an equally small kitchen, I didn&rsquo;t want a big blender that takes up too much of my sacred countertop space.</p><p>My mom (the amazing woman she is) bought me the portable <u><a href=\"https://zdcs.link/w25op\">PopBabies blender</a></u> for Christmas. I&rsquo;ve had it for a few months now and love it. I&rsquo;ve been making myself smoothies every day. And it wasn&rsquo;t that expensive, with prices ranging from $36.99 to $49.99 depending on the color. Plus, you can often find the blender on sale.&nbsp;</p><p>The PopBabies personal blender is ideal for smoothies, protein shakes, baby food, and more. It comes with a base, bottle, screwable top, mini-usb cable for charging, a recipe book, mini ice cube tray, and a funnel. As for color options, you can pick from black, blue, white, pink, purple, and yellow.&nbsp;</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857682.jpg\" alt=\"blender, ice tray, funnel, lid, and charger laid out on counter\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-1.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646857682.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-1.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646857682.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857682.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1500\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">The mini ice cube tray is a great accessory because the blender can't handle large ice cubes.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Georgia Dodd/Mashable</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>Is the PopBabies personal blender as powerful, easy to use, and convenient as the brand claims to be? To see if the blender could really conquer it all, I made smoothies, protein shakes, and smoothie bowls. I found that this blender is maybe the easiest blender I&rsquo;ve ever used and it makes great smoothies for a <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-personal-blenders\">single serving</a>. But, it&rsquo;s not very powerful at crushing ice and, while it&rsquo;s easy to drink out of the blender, it&rsquo;s not as great for traveling because of its consistent battery issues. Read on for all the details on the blending process, the included accessories, and more.</p><h2>How does the PopBabies personal blender work?</h2><p>The PopBabies blender is strong enough to crush mini ice cubes and small, frozen fruits. I <i>highly</i> recommend using the small, square-shaped ice cubes from the ice tray accessory included with the blender. The blades are definitely not strong enough to crush normal-sized ice cubes. When I first got this blender, I tried to make a smoothie with the regular ice cubes from my freezer and the results were tragic. The blender&rsquo;s blades could not break the ice cubes no matter how many times I adjusted and restarted or shook the blender. I had to pour everything out and completely start over. The tiny, square ice cubes are the way to go with this blender. And, while it feels ridiculous to say so, the mini ice cubes are a really cute size and perfect for my iced water and juices.</p><div class=\"w-full mx-auto max-w-3xl font-sans mt-8 text-lg leading-loose md:text-xl md:leading-7\">\n        <span class=\"font-bold text-primary-400\">SEE ALSO:</span>\n        <a href=\"https://mashable.com/roundup/best-blenders\" class=\"text-secondary-300\">\n            The best blenders for smoothies, soups, and everything in between\n                            <svg class=\"ml-1 w-4 h-4 fill-current inline-block font-normal\"><use href=\"/images/icons/spritemap.svg#sprite-arrow-right-thin\"></use></svg>\n                    </a>\n    </div>\n<p>For the fruits, veggies, and anything else you want in your smoothie, just make sure they&rsquo;re cut in small enough pieces for the blender to actually slice them. It&rsquo;s best to dice your ingredients. The instructions say not to fill the bottle more than two-thirds full, otherwise you might run into some blending issues. I have often gotten overzealous about what I could fit in the blender and have gone over that limit and had to awkwardly pour out some of my smoothie.</p><p>I find when I&rsquo;m battling a particularly nasty chunk of frozen mango, it&rsquo;s best to stop blending, move stuff around, and then restart because the blades are not the strongest and often get stuck. It also helps to turn it upside down and shake the blender to really get a smooth smoothie. Once you tackle all the tough fruit and ice cubes, it&rsquo;s smoothie sailing (sorry) to blending a great and healthy drink. The PopBabies blender is not horribly loud when it&rsquo;s on, but definitely don&rsquo;t be like me and use it early in the morning with a sleeping roommate in the next room.</p><p>Once it&rsquo;s done, I pop a straw in the 14-ounce cup, detach it from the base, and enjoy my creation. It's nice to not have to transfer the smoothie to a different cup &mdash; I can just drink straight from the blending cup. The blender's compact design at 10 inches tall is great for a small kitchen like mine. When I&rsquo;m done, I put the bottle and top in the dishwasher to clean.</p><div class=\"eloquent-imagery-image\">\n    <div class=\"flex justify-center\">\n        <img class=\"border border-gray-100 h-full\" src=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857975.jpg\" alt=\"smoothie blending inside small personal blender\" srcset=\"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-2.fit_lim.size_800x.v1646857975.jpg 800w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-2.fit_lim.size_1400x.v1646857975.jpg 1400w,https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857975.jpg 1600w\" loading=\"lazy\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1408px) 100vw, 1408px\" width=\"2000\" height=\"1500\">\n\n\n    </div>\n            <div class=\"mt-4 subtitle-2 font-sans text-left\">\n            <span class=\"text-gray-1000 normal-case\">As long as you use small ice cubes and small chunks of fruit/veggies, PopBabies blends seamlessly.</span>\n            <span class=\"credit text-gray-600 capitalize\">Credit: Georgia Dodd/Mashable</span>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n<p>The PopBabies blender makes great smoothies and power drinks because they are more smooth and liquidy, but, when I tried to make a smoothie bowl, I kept running into issues with the blades. Usually when I make a smoothie bowl on my parents&rsquo; Krups blender, I blend it on low to ensure a super thick smoothie and then, after adding milk, I ramp the speed up to medium and add a protein like peanut butter. But, the PopBabies personal blender only has one level for blending. To make a smoothie bowl &mdash; and not a good one &mdash; with this blender, I had to blend for a really long time. I recommend sticking to smoothies and protein shakes with this blender.</p><p>Compared to a Magic Bullet, the PopBabies portable can't compete. The PopBabies&rsquo; blades are definitely not as strong and the battery life is abysmal after a couple of months.</p><h2>Four hours to charge and it only lasts two blends</h2><p>Though charging (and therefore portability) is a major selling point for this blender, in reality it doesn't work quite as well as I&rsquo;d hoped. The blender comes with a mini-USB charging cable but no outlet block (taking one from Apple&rsquo;s book, I see). While PopBabies claims the battery will last for 20 drinks, it actually lasts between two and five drinks. So, it is portable, but needs to be recharged pretty regularly. The personal blender takes about four hours to fully charge, which can be annoying. But, you do have the option to run it while it charges. To avoid this issue, I constantly keep the PopBabies blender plugged in, which does mean that I don't travel with it.</p><h2>Verdict</h2><p>The PopBabies personal blender is definitely a good mini, portable blender. But, is it worth it?</p><p>I liked that it was easy to use, that it&rsquo;s a great size for a small kitchen, and that it&rsquo;s dishwasher safe. But it has a bad battery life and you have to put in a little more work into making good smoothies than blenders from more recognizable brands like NutriBullet or Vitamix. Overall, this mini but mighty personal blender helps me make great smoothies quickly despite its annoying caveats.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;P.s. If you are in need of some smoothie ideas, here&rsquo;s my recommendation for a strawberry banana smoothie:</p><ul><li><p>5 pieces of chopped bananas</p></li><li><p>4 chopped strawberries</p></li><li><p>Spoonful of Chobani vanilla yogurt</p></li><li><p>Splash of milk</p></li><li><p>Honey</p></li><li><p>5 ice cubes</p></li></ul>","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Mar 2022 04:00:00 +0000","feedId":91,"bgimg":"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/hero-image.png","linkMd5":"d6967c32aa7035fb6fa3eeac10c29edc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn48@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-011_b8ddba71b400a759.webp","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":720,"sourceBytes":707826,"destBytes":707826,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/hero-image.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn48@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-02-011_b8ddba71b400a759.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-1.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857682.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn71@2020_2/2022/03/14/08-27-26-203_ab3e8c5e5ae20104.webp","https://helios-i.mashable.com/imagery/reviews/02tD61GRLWBlnXQYgMzn2Yb/images-2.fit_lim.size_2000x.v1646857975.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn63@2020_6/2022/03/14/08-27-26-133_5dc6cb11d8749bcf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1647246421782}],"record":{"createdTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","updatedTime":"2022-03-14 16:27:01","feedId":91,"fetchDate":"Mon, 14 Mar 2022 08:27:01 +0000","fetchMs":49,"handleMs":466,"totalMs":26339,"newArticles":0,"totalArticles":100,"status":1,"type":0,"ip":"245d88d7b2d8f26704713c23b090d029","hostName":"us-003*","requestId":"5ef7033a5b744087932bf88c110979ae_91","contentType":"text/xml;
